All Words Index for All

abandon

[ə'bændən], [ə'bændən]


Image Search
v. 放弃；抛弃；放纵
n. 放纵
cease to support or look after (someone); desert.
leave (a place or vehicle) empty or uninhabited, without intending to return.
condemn someone or something to (a specified fate) by ceasing to take an interest in or look after them.
give up completely (a course of action, a practice, or a way of thinking).
discontinue (a scheduled event) before completion.
allow oneself to indulge in (a desire or impulse).
complete lack of inhibition or restraint.
"her natural mother had abandoned her at an early age"
"derelict houses were abandoned"
"it was an attempt to persuade businesses not to abandon the area to inner-city deprivation"
"he had clearly abandoned all pretense of trying to succeed"
"against the background of perceived threats, the tour was abandoned"
"abandoning herself to moony fantasies"
"she sings and sways with total abandon"
Those who abandon themselves to despair can not succeed.那些自暴自弃的人无法成功。
Despite some difficulties, they're not going to abandon the plan.尽管他们遇到了一些困难,但并不打算放弃这个计划。
The cruel man abandoned his wife and child.那个狠心的男人抛弃了他的妻儿。
They abandon themselves to drinking.他们沉湎于饮酒。
He signed cheques with careless abandon.他无所顾忌地乱开支票。
The cheerleader waved his arms with wild abandon.拉拉队队长疯狂地挥舞双臂。

abbreviation

[əˌbriːvi'eɪʃn], [əˌbriːvi'eɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 缩写
a shortened form of a word or phrase.
the process or result of abbreviating.
All abbreviations are to be written out.所有的缩写都要完整地写出来
UK is the abbreviation of the United Kingdom.UK是大不列颠联合王国的缩写。
English abbreviation is seen everywhere now.英语缩略语的使用已遍及社会生活的各个领域。

abdicate

['æbdɪkeɪt], ['æbdɪkeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 正式放弃；让位
vi. 退位；辞职
(of a monarch) renounce one's throne.
fail to fulfill or undertake (a responsibility or duty).
"in 1918 Kaiser Wilhelm abdicated as German emperor"
"the government was accused of abdicating its responsibility"
He was forced to abdicate his claim on the property.他被迫放弃要求财产的权利。
He's abdicated all responsibility in the affair.他已经放弃了这件事中的一切职责。
The king was forced to abdicate his throne.国王被迫逊位。
King Edward VIII abdicated in 1936.英王爱德华八世于1936年退位。
I want to try something different so I abdicate the office.我辞职是因为我想尝试些不一样的东西。

abduct

[æb'dʌkt], [æb'dʌkt]


Image Search
vt. 诱拐；绑走
take (someone) away illegally by force or deception; kidnap.
(of a muscle) move (a limb or part) away from the midline of the body or from another part.
"the millionaire who disappeared may have been abducted"
He had attempted to abduct the two children.他曾企图诱拐这两名儿童。
I can say you abduct a high school student.我可以告你诱拐中学生。

abhor

[əb'hɔː(r)], [əb'hɔːr]


Image Search
vt. 憎恶；厌恶；痛恨
regard with disgust and hatred.
"professional tax preparers abhor a flat tax because it would dry up their business"
They abhor all forms of racial discrimination.他们憎恶任何形式的种族歧视。
Most people abhor cruelyt to children.大部分人憎恶虐待儿童。
I abhor every commonplace phrase by which wit is intended.我厌恶所有那些力图表现智慧的陈腐不堪的俗话。
I will put my dwelling place among you, and I will not abhor you.我要在你们中间立我的帐幕，我的心也不厌恶你们。
Most people abhor cruelty to children.大多数人痛恨虐待儿童。
Spitting in the street is a practice that I abhor.我痛恨随地吐痰这种习惯。

abolish

[ə'bɒlɪʃ], [ə'bɑːlɪʃ]


Image Search
vt. 废除；革除；消灭
formally put an end to (a system, practice, or institution).
"the tax was abolished in 1977"
Abraham Lincoln abolished slavery in the United States.亚伯拉罕·林肯在美国废除了奴隶制。
There are many bad customs and laws that ought to be abolished.有许多不良的习俗和法规应予以废除。
They petitioned the government to abolish hanging.他们向政府请愿，要求废除绞刑。
The legislature passed a law to abolish the surtax.立法机关通过了一项废除附加税的法令。
The weapons of war must be abolished before they abolish us.在作战武器消灭我们以前，我们应先把它消灭。

abominable

[ə'bɒmɪnəbl], [ə'bɑːmɪnəbl]


Image Search
adj. 讨厌的；令人憎恶的；糟糕的
causing moral revulsion.
very bad or unpleasant.
"the uprising was suppressed with abominable cruelty"
"a cup of abominable tea"
Your behaviour is abominable to me.我讨厌你的行为.
Murder is the most abominable crime.凶杀是最可恶的犯罪。
The food in the cafeteria is abominable.这家自助餐厅的膳食糟糕透了。

abrupt

[ə'brʌpt], [ə'brʌpt]


Image Search
adj. 突然的；唐突的；意外的；陡峭的
sudden and unexpected.
brief to the point of rudeness; curt.
(of a style of speech or writing) not flowing smoothly; disjointed.
steep; precipitous.
"I was surprised by the abrupt change of subject"
"you were rather abrupt with that young man"
"the abrupt double peak of the mountain"
The river takes an abrupt bend to the west.这河突然向西转弯。
His speech comes to an abrupt stop.他的演讲突然停止了。
That young man has an abrupt manner.那个年轻人态度很无礼。
His manner of speaking was quite abrupt.他的说话方式很唐突。
Pug's abrupt proposal gave her a big surprise.帕格的出乎意料的求婚给了她一个意外的惊喜。
We walked down an abrupt slope.我们沿着陡峭的斜坡走下来。
I haven't seen such abrupt rocks yet.你至今没看到过这样陡峭的岩石。

abstain

[əb'steɪn], [əb'steɪn]


Image Search
v. 戒绝；弃权；节制
restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something.
refrain from drinking alcohol.
formally decline to vote either for or against a proposal or motion.
"abstaining from chocolate"
"most pregnant women abstain or drink very little"
"forty-one voted with the opposition, and some sixty more abstained"
He swore to abstain from smoking.他发誓要戒烟。
A high percentage of women said they had abstained from alcohol during pregnancy.很大比例的妇女称他们在怀孕期间戒了酒。
I abstained from voting.我弃权不投票。
Six countries voted for the change, five voted against, and two abstained.六个国家投票赞成改变，五个反对，还有两个弃权。
He abstained from speaking at the meeting.会上，他默不作声。

absurd

[əb'sɜːd], [əb'sɜːrd]


Image Search
adj. 荒唐的；可笑的；不合理的
n. 荒唐
wildly unreasonable, illogical, or inappropriate.
arousing amusement or derision; ridiculous.
"the allegations are patently absurd"
"gym shorts and knee socks looked absurd on such a tall girl"
He finally recovered from an absurd infatuation.他终于从荒唐的迷恋中醒悟过来。
What an absurd suggestion!多荒谬的建议啊！
We have no intention of lying down under these absurd allegations.对这些荒谬的指控我们是不甘受辱的。
It was absurd of you to suggest such a thing.你居然建议这样的事，太可笑了。
He looked absurd in that get-up.他穿著那套衣服看上去怪模怪样的。
It is absurd to argue from these premises.凭这些前提议论是不合理的。
The proposal borders on the absurd.该提议近乎可笑。
The pleading with Nora is beyond absurd.向诺拉好言相求真是荒唐得无以复加。

abundant

[ə'bʌndənt], [ə'bʌndənt]


Image Search
adj. 丰富的；充裕的
existing or available in large quantities; plentiful.
having plenty of something.
"there was abundant evidence to support the theory"
"the riverbanks were abundant in wild plants"
Indonesia is abundant in petroleum deposits.印尼的石油蕴藏量丰富。
The agricultural commodities are abundant this year.今年的农产品很丰富。
Birds concentrate in places where food is abundant.鸟聚集在食物丰盛的地方。
There is abundant firewood in the forest.森林里有充裕的薪柴可用。
We have abundant oil seeds to sell.我们有充裕的油籽出售。

abuse

[ə'bjuːs], [ə'bjuːs]


Image Search
n. 滥用；恶习
vt. 滥用；辱骂；虐待
use (something) to bad effect or for a bad purpose; misuse.
make excessive and habitual use of (alcohol or drugs, especially illegal ones).
treat (a person or an animal) with cruelty or violence, especially regularly or repeatedly.
assault (someone, especially a woman or child) sexually.
masturbate.
use or treat in such a way as to cause damage or harm.
speak in an insulting and offensive way to or about (someone).
the improper use of something.
unjust or corrupt practice.
cruel and violent treatment of a person or animal.
violent treatment involving sexual assault, especially on a repeated basis.
insulting and offensive language.
"the judge abused his power by imposing the fines"
"riders who abuse their horses should be prosecuted"
"he was a depraved man who had abused his two young daughters"
"he had been abusing his body for years"
"the referee was abused by players from both teams"
"alcohol abuse"
"protection against fraud and abuse"
"a black eye and other signs of physical abuse"
"young people who have suffered sexual abuse"
"waving his fists and hurling abuse at the driver"
The government has set up a working party to look into the problem of drug abuse.政府已成立工作组调查滥用毒品问题。
His political reputation was tainted by his abuse of the power.他因滥用职权而破坏了政治声誉。
He greeted me with a stream of abuse.他见到我就连声辱骂。
It's easy to abuse one's power.人容易滥用权力。
I don't consider it good for a person to be afraid of being abused.一个人怕挨骂,我看不好。
He abused his wife and children.他虐待他的妻子和孩子。

abyss

[ə'bɪs], [ə'bɪs]


Image Search
n. 深渊；无底洞
a deep or seemingly bottomless chasm.
a wide or profound difference between people; a gulf.
the regions of hell conceived of as a bottomless pit.
a catastrophic situation seen as likely to occur.
"a rope led down into the dark abyss"
"the abyss between the two nations"
"Satan's dark abyss"
"teetering on the edge of the abyss of a total political wipeout"
He has been in the abyss of despair.他已陷入绝望的深渊。
I've entered the Abyss and never returned.我进去了深渊，再也没回来。
S. is now censured and condemned by the people in every region and country of the world and finding itself in the abyss of international isolation and ruin.目前，美帝国主义在全世界所有的地区和国家都受到孤立和谴责，并且发现自身已处在国际孤立和毁灭的无底洞里。

acclaimed

[ək'leɪmd], [ək'leɪmd]


Image Search
adj. 受赞誉的，受人欢迎的
v. 动词acclaim的过去式、过去分词
praise enthusiastically and publicly.
"the conference was acclaimed as a considerable success"

accommodate

[ə'kɒmədeɪt], [ə'kɑːmədeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 供给住宿；使适应；容纳；提供；顾及；调解
vi. 适应；调节
(of physical space, especially a building) provide lodging or sufficient space for.
fit in with the wishes or needs of.
adapt to.
"the cabins accommodate up to 6 people"
"any language must accommodate new concepts"
"making consumers accommodate to the realities of today's marketplace"
This hotel can accommodate up to 500 guests.这旅馆可供500位来宾住宿。
We must accommodate ourselves to circumstances.我们必须适应环境。
One flat can accommodate a family of five.一套单元房可容纳一个五口之家。
The bank is accommodating its customers more than it used to.这家银行现在给客户贷款比以前多了。
The government came up with a new economic proposal that accommodates the special needs and interests of the elderly.政府出台了一项新的考虑老年人特殊要求和利益的新经济提案。
He tried to accommodate the dispute between his two friends.他尽力调解两个朋友之间的纠纷。
Her eyes took a while to accommodate to the darkness.过了一会儿，她的眼睛才能适应黑暗。

accord

[ə'kɔːd], [ə'kɔːrd]


Image Search
n. 协议；一致；符合
v. 与...一致；给予；调解
give or grant someone (power, status, or recognition).
(of a concept or fact) be harmonious or consistent with.
an official agreement or treaty.
agreement or harmony.
"the powers accorded to the head of state"
"the government and the rebels are in accord on one point"
The two countries reached an accord.两国签订了一项协议。
His words are in accord with his ideas.他心口一致。
Their views were found to be in perfect accord.人们发现他们的意见是完全一致的。
Your behavior is not in accord with your principle.你的行为与你的原则不符。
Our information does not accord with his reports.我们所了解的情况与他的报告不一致。
He was accorded a warm welcome.他受到热烈的欢迎。
We should accord the President the proper deference.我们应给予总统恰当的尊重.
The mayor will try to accord the controversy over the housing scheme.市长试图调解住房规划方面的争议。

accreditation

[əˌkredɪ'teɪʃn], [əˌkredɪ'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 认证；委派
the action or process of officially recognizing someone as havinɡ a particular status or beinɡ qualified to perform a particular activity.
official certification that a school or course has met standards set by external regulators.
an acknowledgment of a person's responsibility for or achievement of something.
"the accreditation of professionals"
"the first fully online university to receive national accreditation"
"both parties create authorship, and to make this clear I have always used joint accreditations"
In case of replacement, the accreditation of the player replaced will be cancelled.若出现顶替现象,被替换运动员的认证卡将被取消。
US schools generally announce their accreditation in admission brochures.通常,美国大学会在招生简章中声明自己的认证情况。
How can you tell if a school has accreditation or not?那么,你又如何知道一所学校是不是受到认证了呢?
I told the school owner how serious this could be since the accreditation delegation is coming.于是，我对校长提了这件事情的严重性，因为认证代表团就要来了。
He carried a letter of accreditation.他带了一份委派书。

accumulate

[ə'kjuːmjəleɪt], [ə'kjuːmjəleɪt]


Image Search
v. 积累；增加；聚集
gather together or acquire an increasing number or quantity of.
gradually gather or acquire (a resulting whole).
gather or build up.
"investigators have yet to accumulate enough evidence"
"her goal was to accumulate a huge fortune"
"the toxin accumulated in their bodies"
They set out to accumulate a huge mass of data.他们开始积累大量的资料。
Dust and dirt soon accumulates if a house is not cleaned regularly.房屋不经常打扫,尘土很快就越积越多。
True poetry accumulates meaning every time it is read.真正好诗愈念涵义愈丰富。
However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the zoo felt obliged to investigate.然而，当证据日趋增多时，该动物园的专家们感到有必要进行调查。
Over the years, I had accumulated hundreds of books.多年来,我收集了几百本书。

achievement

[ə'tʃiːvmənt], [ə'tʃiːvmənt]


Image Search
n. 成就；成绩；完成；达到
a thing done successfully, typically by effort, courage, or skill.
the process or fact of achieving something.
a representation of a coat of arms with all the adjuncts to which a bearer of arms is entitled.
"to reach this stage is a great achievement"
"the achievement of professional recognition"
Effort and achievement are always in full accord.努力和成就总是相辅相承的。
You haven't realized the magnitude of her achievement.你没有认识到她这一成就的重大意义。
I felt a great sense of achievement when I reached the top of the mountain.当我到达山顶的时候，我有一种巨大的成就感。
Coming top in the exam was quite an achievement.考第一是很了不起的成绩。
Flying across the Atlantic for the first time was a great achievement.首次飞跃大西洋是一项了不起的业绩。
That task is impossible of achievement.那项任务不可能完成。
Most achievement rates were close to,or reached,100 per cent.就大部分的服务目标而言，该署几乎完全达到目标。
The achievement of this level of investment in a democratic nation is remarkable.在一个民主国家中投资达到这种高水平，是十分突出的。

acknowledge

[ək'nɒlɪdʒ], [ək'nɑːlɪdʒ]


Image Search
vt. 承认；告知收到；公认；表示感谢；注意到
accept or admit the existence or truth of.
(of a body of opinion) recognize the fact or importance or quality of.
express or display gratitude for or appreciation of.
accept the validity or legitimacy of.
show that one has noticed or recognized (someone) by making a gesture or greeting.
confirm (receipt of something).
"the plight of the refugees was acknowledged by the authorities"
"the art world has begun to acknowledge his genius"
"he received a letter acknowledging his services"
"Henry acknowledged Richard as his heir"
"she refused to acknowledge my presence"
We acknowledged the need for reform.我们承认改革的需要。
Please acknowledge this cheque as soon as you receive it.收到该支票后,请立即告知。
We hope you can acknowledge your mistake in public.希望你当众认错。
We are sending you some money in acknowledgement of your valuable help.我们送些酬劳，对您的大力协助聊表谢意。
I met him in town but he didn't even acknowledge me我在城里见到他，但他却把我当成素不相识的人乙

acquire

[ə'kwaɪə(r)], [ə'kwaɪər]


Image Search
vt. 获得；学到；取得
buy or obtain (an object or asset) for oneself.
learn or develop (a skill, habit, or quality).
achieve (a particular reputation) as a result of one's behavior or activities.
"you must acquire the rudiments of Greek"
We should try to acquire good habits.我们应该努力养成良好的习惯。
He will acquire the right to permanent residency here.他将获得这里的永久居留权。
We hope to acquire the knowledge in the happiness.我们希望在快乐中获得知识。
One can never acquire enough experience.经验是永远学不足的。
You must acquire great skills of perception.你必须学会洞察事物的高超技巧。
We should acquire more firsthand information.我们应当取得更多的第一手资料。

acquisition

[ˌækwɪ'zɪʃn], [ˌækwɪ'zɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 获得；所获之物；采集
an asset or object bought or obtained, typically by a library or museum.
an act of purchase of one company by another.
buying or obtaining an asset or object.
the learning or developing of a skill, habit, or quality.
"there were many acquisitions among travel agents"
"Western culture places a high value on material acquisition"
"the acquisition of management skills"
Life is a process about the acquisition of knowledge, wealth and happiness.生命就是一个获得知识、财富和幸福的过程。
My classmates were attracted by the library's most recent acquisitions.同学们都被图书馆最近新添的书籍吸引了。

acquit

[ə'kwɪt], [ə'kwɪt]


Image Search
v. 宣布无罪；开释；原谅；表现
free (someone) from a criminal charge by a verdict of not guilty.
conduct oneself or perform in a specified way.
discharge (a duty or responsibility).
"she was acquitted on all counts"
"all the young women in the contest acquitted themselves well"
"they acquitted themselves of their charge with vigilance"
He was acquitted of the crime.他被宣告无罪。
They tried to bribe the judge to acquit them.他们试图贿赂法官判他们无罪。
Will the court acquit him of the crime?法庭会宣判他无罪释放吗?
I acquit Edward of all essential misconduct.我原谅爱德华的所有根本过错。
He acquitted himself like a hero.他表现得像个英雄。

activate

['æktɪveɪt], ['æktɪveɪt]


Image Search
v. 激活；使活动；起动
make (something) active or operative.
convert (a substance, molecule, etc.) into a reactive form.
"fumes from cooking are enough to activate the alarm"
"activated chlorine"
You can activate the system by buttons or voice recognition.你可以通过按钮或者声音识别来激活系统。
The burglar alarm was activated by mistake.防盗铃误响了。
I think if you flip the blue switch near the bottom it will activate the air conditioner.我想，如果你把下方的蓝色开关轻轻地推上，冷气就会出来了。
These push buttons can activate the elevator.这些按钮能启动电梯。

acute

[ə'kjuːt], [ə'kjuːt]


Image Search
adj. 严重的；敏锐的；急性的；剧烈的
(of a bad, difficult, or unwelcome situation or phenomenon) present or experienced to a severe or intense degree.
(of a disease or its symptoms) of short duration but typically severe.
denoting or designed for patients with acute conditions.
having or showing a perceptive understanding or insight: shrewd.
(of a physical sense or faculty) highly developed; keen.
(of an angle) less than 90°.
having a sharp end; pointed.
(of a sound) high; shrill.
short for acute accent.
"an acute housing shortage"
"acute appendicitis"
"acute hospital services"
"an acute awareness of changing fashions"
"an acute sense of smell"
He suffers from acute depression.他患有严重的抑郁症。
This area has an acute shortage of water.这个地方缺水严重。
She has acute hearing.她有很敏锐的听力。
The doctor said that you had acute appendicitis.医生说您患的是急性阑尾炎。
The patient is complaining of acute earache.病人说耳部剧痛。

adamant

['ædəmənt], ['ædəmənt]


Image Search
adj. 坚定不移的；固执的
n. 坚硬无比之物；硬石
refusing to be persuaded or to change one's mind.
a legendary rock or mineral to which many, often contradictory, properties were attributed, formerly associated with diamond or lodestone.
"he is adamant that he is not going to resign"
She was quite adamant that she would not come.她坚决不来。
On this point I am adamant.在这一点上我是坚定不移的。
She was adamant in refusing to comply with his wishes.她固执地拒绝按他的意愿办。
She became as rigid as adamant.她变得如顽石般的固执。

adapt

[ə'dæpt], [ə'dæpt]


Image Search
vt. 改编；使适应
vi. 适应；适合
make (something) suitable for a new use or purpose; modify.
become adjusted to new conditions.
alter (a text) to make it suitable for filming, broadcasting, or the stage.
"hospitals have had to be adapted for modern medical practice"
"a large organization can be slow to adapt to change"
"the miniseries was adapted from Wouk's novel"
This novel has been adapted for radio from the Russian original.这部小说已由俄文原著改编成无线电广播节目。
She adapted herself quickly to the new climate.她很快就适应了这种新气候。
You must adapt to the norms of the society you live in.在社会中生活就要遵循社会行为准则。
It's hard to adapt this novel for children.要将这部小说改编为适合小孩的阅读水准很难。
There will be more than one person who can adapt to you.世界上适合你的人不会只有一个。

adept

[ə'dept], [ə'dept]


Image Search
adj. 熟练的；老练的
n. 名手；专家
very skilled or proficient at something.
a person who is skilled or proficient at something.
"he is adept at cutting through red tape"
"they are adepts at kung fu and karate"
He was astonishingly adept at manipulating the big machine.他操作这台大机器熟练得惊人。
Like any culturally adept traveler, the tribe has changed its appearance throughout its history.就像任何聪明熟练的旅行老鸟，从历史上到如今这个部族一直不断地改变自己的面貌。
It may not have the best table manners, but this strange looking creature is certainly a very adept and unusual percussionist, which should help provide Nick with a good beat.也许它的吃相并不雅观，但这种相貌奇特的动物肯定是一位老练的打击乐高手，能为尼克提供一些不错的素材。
Many became adept, and thousands of fires were extinguished before they took hold.其中有很多人成了专家，几千颗烧夷弹还没有燃烧，火势头就被扑灭了。

adhere

[əd'hɪə(r)], [əd'hɪr]


Image Search
vi. 遵守；坚持；粘附
stick fast to (a surface or substance).
believe in and follow the practices of.
represent truthfully and in detail.
"paint won't adhere well to a greasy surface"
"the people adhere to the Muslim religion"
"the account adhered firmly to fact"
They failed to adhere to our original agreement.他们未能遵守我们原定的协议。
We should adhere to our opinions.我们应当坚持我们的意见。
We adhere to the principle stand of marxism.我们坚持马克思主义思想原则。
The new paint won't adhere to the walls so I'll have to strip it all off and start from scratch.新涂的油漆粘不住墙壁,因此我得把它全部刮掉,重新刷过。
Paste is used to make one surface adhere to another.糨糊是用于使一个接触面粘住另一个接触面的。

adhesive

[əd'hiːsɪv], [əd'hiːsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 有粘性的；难忘的
n. 粘着剂
able to stick fast to a surface or object; sticky.
a substance used for sticking objects or materials together; glue.
"an adhesive label"
He also invented the adhesive postage stamp.他还发明了粘性邮票。
The adhesive will stick to most clean surfaces.粘胶剂会粘在非常清洁的表面。
You need a strong adhesive to bond wood to metal.需要强力胶才能把木料粘在金属上。

administration

[ədˌmɪnɪ'streɪʃn], [ədˌmɪnɪ'streɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 实施；管理；行政；行政部门；任期
the process or activity of running a business, organization, etc.
the people responsible for this, regarded collectively.
the management of public affairs; government.
the management and disposal of the property of an intestate, deceased person, debtor, or other individual, or of an insolvent company, by a legally appointed administrator.
the officials in the executive branch of government under a particular chief executive.
the term of office of a political leader or government.
a government agency.
the action of dispensing, giving, or applying something.
"the day-to-day administration of the company"
"the university administration took their demands seriously"
"the inhabitants of the island voted to remain under French administration"
"the company went into administration"
"the Kennedy administration sought to use the conference to repair US prestige"
"the early years of the Reagan Administration"
"the US Food and Drug Administration"
"the oral administration of the antibiotic"
He is responsible for the administration of justice.他负责赏罚。
He works in hospital administration.他从事医院管理工作.
The company developed rapidly under his administration.在他的管理下，公司发展得很快。
Head teachers are more involved in administration than in teaching.校长的行政工作比教学工作多。
She has been looking after the, day-to-day administration.她一直在照管日常的行政工作。
I hate the prodigal administration.我痛恨铺张浪费的行政机关。
A new Presidential administration will begin soon.新一届总统任期马上就要开始了。
He tried to remedy this neglect during his own administration.他努力在他的任期内弥补这个缺陷。

admire

[əd'maɪə(r)], [əd'maɪər]


Image Search
vt. 钦佩；赞美；羡慕；欣赏
regard (an object, quality, or person) with respect or warm approval.
look at with pleasure.
"I admire your courage"
"we were just admiring your garden"
You may not like him, but you have got to admire his persistence.你可以不喜欢他，但你不得不佩服他那种坚韧不拔的精神。
We admire him for his righteousness.我们钦佩他的正直。
You had better admire others more than criticize if you want to be popular.如果你想要更受人欢迎,尽量多赞美、少批评。
Visitors admire Beijing for its beauty.观光者赞赏北京的美丽。
There is no man who does not admire him.没有人不羡慕他的。

admonish

[əd'mɒnɪʃ], [əd'mɑːnɪʃ]


Image Search
vt. 警告；训诫；告诫；提醒；敦促
warn or reprimand someone firmly.
advise or urge (someone) earnestly.
warn (someone) of something to be avoided.
"she admonished me for appearing at breakfast unshaven"
"she admonished him to drink no more than one glass of wine"
"he admonished the people against the evil of such practices"
He was admonished for his carelessness.他因粗心受到警告。
His wife admonished him not to drive too fast.他的妻子警告他开车不要超速。
He has very sternly admonished student.他十分严厉地训诫了学生。
He was admonished against doing wrong.人们告诫他不要做坏事。
I admonished him of the need for silence.我提醒他缄默的必要。

adversary

['ædvəsəri], ['ædvərseri]


Image Search
n. 敌手；对手
one's opponent in a contest, conflict, or dispute.
the Devil.
another term for adversarial.
"Davis beat his old adversary in the quarterfinals"
"the confrontations of adversary politics"
He set at his adversary in strong language.他以强硬的语言抨击他的敌手。
You may have a hidden adversary who would love to prove you wrong.你可能有一个潜在的敌手，他时刻准备着与你作对。
He was dismayed at the size of his adversary.对手的魁伟身材使他丧失了勇气。
They continued to view it as their major adversary.他们继续把它看作主要的对手。

adverse

['ædvɜːs], ['ædvɜːrs]


Image Search
adj. 不利的；逆向的；有害的
preventing success or development; harmful; unfavorable.
"taxes are having an adverse effect on production"
The judge gave us an adverse decision.法官作出对我们不利的判决。
He ignored all kinds of adverse comments about him.他不理睬各种各样对他不利的评论。
The development was adverse to our interests.这种发展与我们的利益背道而驰。
Diseases are adverse to the best growth of children.疾病对儿童的健康成长是有害的。

advocate

['ædvəkeɪt], ['ædvəkeɪt]


Image Search
v. 提倡；主张
n. 拥护者；提倡者；律师；辩护者
a person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy.
a person who pleads on someone else's behalf.
a pleader in a court of law; a lawyer.
publicly recommend or support.
"he was an untiring advocate of economic reform"
"care managers can become advocates for their clients"
"Marshall was a skilled advocate but a mediocre judge"
"they advocated an ethical foreign policy"
Many educators advocate a liberal education.很多教育家提倡通才教育。
We don't advocate learning by rote.死记硬背的学习方法，我们是不提倡的。
Many people advocate building more hospitals.许多人主张增设医院。
We advocate higher salaries for teachers.我们主张涨老师的工资。
She is a passionate advocate of education reform.她是一名教育改革的热情拥护者。
This judge is a strong advocate of prison reform.这位法官是监狱改革的坚决拥护者。
The advocate has undertaken my case.律师己接受我的案子。
He got the best advocate in town to defend him.他请城里最好的律师为他辩护。

affect

[ə'fekt], [ə'fekt]


Image Search
vt. 影响；感动；作用
have an effect on; make a difference to.
touch the feelings of (someone); move emotionally.
pretend to have or feel (something).
use, wear, or assume (something) pretentiously or so as to make an impression on others.
emotion or desire, especially as influencing behavior or action.
"the dampness began to affect my health"
"the atrocities he witnessed have affected him most deeply"
"as usual I affected a supreme unconcern"
"an American who had affected a British accent"
How does interest rate affect the price of bonds?利率如何影响债券的价格?
She was deeply affected by the sad story.她深深被那个悲伤的故事感动了。
His charm doesn't affect or impress me.他的魅力对我不起作用.

affiliation

[əˌfɪli'eɪʃn], [əˌfɪli'eɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 加入；入会；联系；附属机构，分公司，分部；结交，交往
the state or process of affiliating or being affiliated.
"he had no particular affiliation, no close associates"
You need the affiliation of investor.你需要投资者的加入。
The society has many affiliations throughout the country.这个社团在全国有很多关系.
Risk is always having affiliation with its impact on practice.风险总是和效用联系在一起的。
Participation in social groups in the community is independent of religious affiliation, and one's circle of friends will include people of a variety of denominations.社会上的社交团体是不管哪个教派的人都可以参加的，而一个人的社交范围包括各种教派的人。

affirm

[ə'fɜːm], [ə'fɜːrm]


Image Search
vt. 证实；断言；肯定
state as a fact; assert strongly and publicly.
declare one's support for; uphold or defend.
accept or confirm the validity of (a judgment or agreement); ratify.
make a formal declaration rather than taking an oath (e.g., to testify truthfully).
(of a court) uphold (a decision) on appeal.
offer (someone) emotional support or encouragement.
give (life) a heightened sense of value, typically through the experience of something emotionally or spiritually uplifting.
"he affirmed the country's commitment to peace"
"the referendum affirmed the republic's right to secede"
"there are five common ways parents fail to affirm their children"
"it is a rich and challenging motion picture that both affirms life and emphasizes its fragility"
Scientists cannot affirm the existence of life on other planets.科学家们还不能证实在其它星球上有生命存在。
I affirm that what he said is true.我断言他所说的是实情。
They affirmed that the girl did quite a bit of reading.他们断言这个女孩子读了不少书。
I can affirm that no one will lose their job.我可以肯定，谁都不会丢掉工作。
We are not entitled to affirm or negate anything.我们没有任何权利和资格去肯定或否定任何一件事情。

affluence

Image Search
n. 富裕
the state of having a great deal of money; wealth.
"a sign of our growing affluence"
America is a country of great affluence.美国是富裕的国家。

agenda

[ə'dʒendə], [ə'dʒendə]


Image Search
n. 议事日程
a list of items to be discussed at a formal meeting.
a plan of things to be done or problems to be addressed.
the underlying intentions or motives of a particular person or group.
an appointment diary.
"the question of nuclear weapons had been removed from the agenda"
"he vowed to put jobs at the top of his agenda"
"Miller has his own agenda and it has nothing to do with football"
This agenda will form the basis of our next meeting.本议程将成为下次会议的中心议题。
Let's go on to the next item on the agenda.我们讨论议程表上的下一项吧。
Let's thrash the matter over before putting it on the agenda.我们先把这件事仔细研究一下，再把它列入议事日程。

aggrandize

[ə'grændaɪz], [ə'grænˌdaɪz]


Image Search
vt. 增加；夸大；提高
=aggrandise(英).
increase the power, status, or wealth of.
enhance the reputation of (someone) beyond what is justified by the facts.
"an action intended to aggrandize the Frankish dynasty"
"he hoped to aggrandize himself by dying a hero's death"
Indeed, it should be pointed out that although women status were greatly improved, we can not aggrandize the improvement.当然，应该指出的是，妇女的地位尽管在罗马后期有了很大的提高，但我们不能夸大这种提高。
Indeed, it should be pointed out that although women status were greatly improved, we can not aggrandize the improvement.当然，应该指出的是，妇女的地位尽管在罗马后期有了很大的提高，但我们不能夸大这种提高。

aggravate

['æɡrəveɪt], ['æɡrəveɪt]


Image Search
vt. 恶化；严重
make (a problem, injury, or offense) worse or more serious.
annoy or exasperate (someone), especially persistently.
"military action would only aggravate the situation"
"the gesture aggravated me even more"
Scratching can aggravate the rash.搔痒会使疹子发炎。
The Europeans' appeasement policy towards irrational regimes would only aggravate the hidden dangers.欧洲国家对非理性政权的绥靖政策,只会让潜在危机恶化。
This will aggravate the current scarcity of natural resources caused by environmental degradation.这将会加剧由环境恶化而导致的自然资源匮乏的情况。
The lack of rain aggravated the already serious shortage of food.干旱少雨使原本就很严重的粮食短缺问题更加严重。

aggregate

['æɡrɪɡət], ['æɡrɪɡət]


Image Search
adj. 合计的；总的
n. 总计；进球总数；集料
v. （使）聚集；总计
a whole formed by combining several (typically disparate) elements.
the total number of points scored by a player or team in a series of sporting contests.
a material or structure formed from a loosely compacted mass of fragments or particles.
pieces of broken or crushed stone or gravel used to make concrete, or more generally in building and construction work.
formed or calculated by the combination of many separate units or items; total.
(of a group of species) comprising several very similar species formerly regarded as a single species.
denoting the total supply or demand for goods and services in an economy at a particular time.
form or group into a class or cluster.
collect (related items of content) so as to display or link to them.
"the council was an aggregate of three regional assemblies"
"the result put the sides even on aggregate"
"the aggregate amount of grants made"
"aggregate demand"
"the butterflies aggregate in dense groups"
"tools that aggregate data from all of the security devices are a good first step"
What were your aggregate wages last year?去年你的工资一共是多少?
The cause of unemployment was inadequate aggregate demand.失业的原因在于总需求不足。
Manager wants to know the aggregate sales in that market.经理想知道那个市场的总销售量。
The tax increases will, in the aggregate, cause much hardship.增加税收归结起来将造成很多困难。
The football team had a low goal aggregate last season.这支足球队上个赛季的进球总数很少。
This mixture of pozzolana and lime was then added to an aggregate.人们把火山灰与石灰的混合物加到集料中。
Occasionally the cells might aggregate to form lentoid bodies.偶而，细胞能聚集形成类晶体球体。
The television audience aggregated 30 millions.电视观众合计达3000万人。
The sum will aggregate a thousand dollars.总额共计一千元。

agile

['ædʒaɪl], ['ædʒl]


Image Search
adj. （动作）敏捷的；灵活的；（头脑）机灵的
able to move quickly and easily.
able to think and understand quickly.
relating to or denoting a method of project management, used especially for software development, that is characterized by the division of tasks into short phases of work and frequent reassessment and adaptation of plans.
"Ruth was as agile as a monkey"
"his vague manner concealed an agile mind"
"agile methods replace high-level design with frequent redesign"
He was quick and agile and he didn't mind losing.他敏捷，灵活，输了不在乎。
You might sometimes need an agile negotiator.你有时会需要一个灵活的谈判代表。
The problem that he answers newsman is very agile.他回答新闻记者的问题很灵活。
One need an agile mind to solve puzzles.解谜必须有机灵的头脑。

ail

[eɪl], [eɪl]


Image Search
v. 使 ... 苦恼；苦恼；生病
n. 小病
trouble or afflict (someone) in mind or body.
"exercise is good for whatever ails you"
It may provide answers to some of the problems that ail America.这一点可能解答困扰美国的某些问题。
If you eat all that junk food now , you will ail tomorrow.如果你现在吃太多的垃圾食品，将来你会因此而苦恼。
That child is ailing.小孩生病了。

aimless

['eɪmləs], ['eɪmləs]


Image Search
adj. 无目的的；没有目标的
without purpose or direction.
"an aimless, ungratifying life"
Aimless life is like sailing without compass.漫无目的的生活就像出海航行而没有指南针。
Park has sometimes been criticized for aimless running.朴智星有时被批评他的无目的的跑动。
She said that her life seemed aimless.她说她的生活好像没有目标。
Don't be aimless or you will feel life is boring.第一条：不要没有目标，否则你会感到生活如此无聊。

akin

[ə'kɪn], [ə'kɪn]


Image Search
adj. 同族的；同类的；近似的
of similar character.
related by blood.
"something akin to gratitude overwhelmed her"
He is near akin to us.他和我们是近亲。
Spanish is akin to Latin.西班牙语与拉丁语近似。
My friend's feelings are akin to mine.我那位朋友的感受和我相近。

alarmed

[ə'lɑːmd], [ə'lɑːrmd]


Image Search
adj. 惊恐的；忧虑的；装有警报的
动词alarm的过去式和过去分词.
cause (someone) to feel frightened, disturbed, or in danger.
be fitted or protected with an alarm.
"the government was alarmed by an outbreak of unrest"
"this door is locked and alarmed between 11 p.m. and 6 a.m."
Alarmed by the noise, the birds flew away.那声音把鸟吓飞了。
People began to feel alarmed about the cholera.人们开始对霍乱感到惊恐起来。
I'm rather alarmed (to hear) that you're planning to leave the company.(听说)你打算脱离这个公司，我有些担心。
The government is alarmed by the dramatic increase in violent crime.政府对暴力犯罪案件的急剧增加感到担心。
This door is alarmed这个门装有报警系统。

alias

['eɪliəs], ['eɪliəs]


Image Search
n. 别名；化名
adv. 又被称为；另外地
used to indicate that a named person is also known or more familiar under another specified name.
indicating another term or synonym.
a false or assumed identity.
an alternative name or label that refers to a file, command, address, or other item, and can be used to locate or access it.
each of a set of signal frequencies that, when sampled at a given uniform rate, would give the same set of sampled values, and thus might be incorrectly substituted for one another when reconstructing the original signal.
misidentify (a signal frequency), introducing distortion or error.
"Eric Blair, alias George Orwell"
"the catfish—alias bullhead—is a mighty tasty fry-up"
"a spy operating under the alias Barsad"
The name is not an official host name or alias.该名称不是正式的主机名或别名。
It is not permitted for an alias to refer to another alias.不允许一个别名参考另一个别名。
He checked into the hotel under an alias.他用化名登记住进旅馆。
The thief's real name was John Smith, alias Edward Ball.这小偷的真名是约翰史密斯，化名叫爱德华鲍尔。

alibi

['æləbaɪ], ['æləbaɪ]


Image Search
n. 不在场证明或辩解；托辞
v. 辩解；找托辞开脱
a claim or piece of evidence that one was elsewhere when an act, typically a criminal one, is alleged to have taken place.
an excuse or pretext.
offer an excuse or defense for (someone), especially by providing an account of their whereabouts at the time of an alleged act.
make excuses.
"she has an alibi for the whole of yesterday evening"
"a catch-all alibi for failure and inadequacy"
"her friend agreed to alibi her"
"not once do I recall him whining or alibiing"
They've got nothing on me I've got an alibi.他们没抓我的罪证,我有不在现场的证据。
The false alibi threw the police off the scent.那个不在犯罪现场的伪证使警方失去了线索。
The alibi was fabricated by him.这种托辞是他臆造出来的。
I was disappointed that Cathy cooked up an alibi.我感到很失望的是凯瑟编造了一个托辞。

allege

[ə'ledʒ], [ə'ledʒ]


Image Search
vt. 断言；宣称
claim or assert that someone has done something illegal or wrong, typically without proof that this is the case.
suppose or affirm to be the case.
"he alleged that he had been assaulted"
"the first artifact ever alleged to be from Earhart's aircraft"
The newspapers allege that the police shot the suspect without warning.报纸指称说警察未经示警就枪杀那位嫌疑犯。
So they alleged, but have they any proof?他们是这样宣称的，但他们有证据吗？
The police alleged that the man was murdered but they have given no proof.警方声称这男子是被谋杀的，但未提出任何证据。
In your statement you allege that the accused man was seen at the scene of the crime .在你的口供中，你供述曾经看到被告在犯罪现场。

allegiance

[ə'liːdʒəns], [ə'liːdʒəns]


Image Search
n. 忠诚；效忠
loyalty or commitment of a subordinate to a superior or of an individual to a group or cause.
"those wishing to receive citizenship must swear allegiance to the republic"
The judge received their oath of allegiance.法官听取了他们的忠诚誓言。
Private members keep up their outward allegiance to the parties they belong to.议员们对各自所属的党派保持表面上的忠诚。
His allegiance has never been questioned.他的忠心是毫无疑问的。
The soldiers swore allegiance to their motherland.士兵们宣誓效忠于他们的祖国。
He abjured his allegiance to the king.他发誓不再效忠皇帝。

aloof

[ə'luːf], [ə'luːf]


Image Search
adj. 疏远的；冷淡的
adv. 远离地
not friendly or forthcoming; cool and distant.
conspicuously uninvolved and uninterested, typically through distaste.
"they were courteous but faintly aloof"
"he stayed aloof from the bickering"
She had always kept herself aloof from the boys in class.她一直和班上的男同学保持疏远的关系。
It would assist England immeasurably if this hitherto aloof character could inspire some sympathy.如果他迄今所表现出来的冷淡的性格能够赢得一些同情的话也许会对英格兰队有所帮助。

alter

['ɔːltə(r)], ['ɔːltər]


Image Search
v. 改变；更改；阉割；切除卵巢
change or cause to change in character or composition, typically in a comparatively small but significant way.
make structural changes to (a building).
tailor (clothing) for a better fit or to conform to fashion.
castrate or spay (a domestic animal).
"Eliot was persuaded to alter the passage"
"plans to alter the dining hall"
"skirts with the hemlines altered a dozen different times"
But nothing can alter the facts.但任何东西也改变不了这些事实。
Alter Current Boot Record Serial Number.更改当前引导纪录序列号。
Marshaling the structure can transform the layout and alter the offset.封送结构可转换布局并更改偏移量。

altruism

['æltruɪzəm], ['æltruɪzəm]


Image Search
n. 利他主义；利他
the belief in or practice of disinterested and selfless concern for the well-being of others.
behavior of an animal that benefits another at its own expense.
"some may choose to work with vulnerable elderly people out of altruism"
Anonymity is the truest expression of altruism.不记名是利他主义最真的表现。
Altruism, according to the text books, has two forms.根据书本上的解释，利他主义有两种表现形式。
His altruism won the neighbors' respect.他那利他的行为赢得了邻居的尊敬。
Ambitionthat is masked as altruism.利他主义掩盖下的野心。

amalgamate

[ə'mælɡəmeɪt], [ə'mælɡəmeɪt]


Image Search
v. 合并；混合
combine or unite to form one organization or structure.
alloy (a metal) with mercury.
"he amalgamated his company with another"
"amalgamated zinc"
Our local brewery has amalgamated with another firm.我们本地的酿酒厂与另一个公司合并了。
There are plans to amalgamate the village school with a larger one nearby.有计划让乡村学校和附近一所规模较大的学校合并。

amasses

[ə'mæs], [ə'mæs]


Image Search
v. 积聚；收集
gather together or accumulate (a large amount or number of valuable material or things) over a period of time.
(of people) gather together in a crowd or group.
"starting from nothing he had amassed a huge fortune"
"the soldiers were amassing from all parts of Spain"
A speculator may try to amass great wealth.投机商会想方设法积聚钱财。
Mr. Smith's business was very successful, and he was able to amass a fortune.史密斯先生的事业极为成功，所以他积聚了一大笔财富。
She continues to amass a staggering amount of material on the history and technology relating to current-day mind control and other forms of abuse.她继续收集在历史和技术上涉及到当今的精神控制和其他的孽待形式的令人惊愕的材料。
So, as you begin to amass this knowledge and these abilities, there will be others attracted to you for their own reasons because of what they can access through you.所以，如同你们开始收集这知识和这些能力，将会有吸引他们自己的动机，因为他们能够通过你们访问。

ambiguous

[æm'bɪɡjuəs], [æm'bɪɡjuəs]


Image Search
adj. 模棱两可的；含糊不清的
(of language) open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
unclear or inexact because a choice between alternatives has not been made.
"the question is rather ambiguous"
"this whole society is morally ambiguous"
He gave us an ambiguous answer .他给了我们一个模棱两可的答复。
In fact, your ambiguous words amount to a refusal.实际上,你说的那些模棱两可的话等于是拒绝。
Her account was deliberately ambiguous.她的陈述故意含混不清。
Why are you always so ambiguous about this problem?为什么你总是对这个问题含糊不清？

ambivalent

[æm'bɪvələnt], [æm'bɪvələnt]


Image Search
adj. 矛盾的；摇摆不定的
having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
"some loved her, some hated her, few were ambivalent about her"
He has an ambivalent attitude towards her.他对她怀着矛盾的心情。
Although she professed fear of the Russians, she seemed to have ambivalent feelings toward Philby himself.虽然她承认害怕俄国人，然而她似乎对菲尔比本人有一种矛盾的感情。

amble

['æmbl], ['æmbl]


Image Search
n. 溜蹄；缓行漫步
v. 缓行；溜蹄
walk or move at a slow, relaxed pace.
a walk at a slow, relaxed pace, especially for pleasure.
"they ambled along the riverbank"
"a peaceful riverside amble"
The horse is walking at an amble.这匹马正在溜蹄行走。
"Sure." I laugh, slowing to an easy amble.“当然可以，”我笑起来，减下步伐，慢慢地走。
He came ambling down the road.他沿路溜溜达达地来了.
Leakey is an infant, but old enough to amble through the canopy on his own.利基虽然是一个幼龄猩猩，但它也能在属于它自己的丛林上漫步。
Every evening,they amble along the bank.这匹马正在溜蹄行走。

ameliorate

[ə'miːliəreɪt], [ə'miːliəreɪt]


Image Search
vt. 使改善；使变好
vi. 改善；变好
make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better.
"the reform did much to ameliorate living standards"
Everyone wishes to ameliorate his own condition .改善自己境况的愿望人皆有之。
He works hard to ameliorate his family's poor circumstances.他努力地工作以改善家庭的穷困。
It is not clear what can be done to ameliorate the situation.不清楚我们能做些什么来改变这个情况。
Self-talk can thus ameliorate our status.因此，与自己对话可以改善我们的现状。
Steps have been taken to ameliorate the situation.已经采取措施以改善局面。
The situation has ameliorated.情况好转。

amiable

['eɪmiəbl], ['eɪmiəbl]


Image Search
adj. 和蔼的；亲切的
having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.
"an amiable, unassuming fellow"
The amiable countenance of Mr. Pickwick was fast recovering its customary expression.匹克威克先生的和蔼的脸孔在很快地恢复着平常的表情。
The hostess received her friends with an amiable smile.女主人带着亲切的微笑迎接朋友们的到来。
You can sort out any differences you have in an amiable manner.你可以以温柔亲切的主式澄清所有的误会。

amorphous

[ə'mɔːfəs], [ə'mɔːrfəs]


Image Search
adj. 无定形的；杂乱的；非结晶的
without a clearly defined shape or form.
vague; ill-organized; unclassifiable.
(of a group of people or an organization) lacking a clear structure or focus.
(of a solid) noncrystalline; having neither definite form nor apparent structure.
"amorphous blue forms and straight black lines"
"make explicit the amorphous statements"
"an amorphous and leaderless legislature"
It is an amorphous colorless or white powder.它是一种无定形的无色或白色粉末。
I really can't understand his amorphous ideas.我真的弄不懂他那些乱七八糟的想法。
Microscopically the ores are medium grained to amorphous.显微镜下，矿石为中粒至非晶质。

analyze

['ænəlaɪz], ['ænəlaɪz]


Image Search
vt. 分析；解析；研究
examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of (something, especially information), typically for purposes of explanation and interpretation.
discover or reveal (something) through detailed examination.
psychoanalyze (someone).
identify and measure the chemical constituents of (a substance or specimen).
resolve (a sentence) into its grammatical elements; parse.
"we need to analyze our results more clearly"
"I intend to analyze the sexism in such texts"
Can you analyze the structure of the sentence for me?你能给我分析一下这个句子的结构吗？
Let's analyze the problem and see what went wrong.让我们分析一下这道题，看什么地方出错了。
You should analyze the essence of the problem.你应该剖析问题的实质。
They will take the problem apart and analyze it.他们会深入剖析这个问题。
We must try to analyse the causes of the strike.我们得研究一下罢工的原因。

ancient

['eɪnʃənt], ['eɪnʃənt]


Image Search
adj. 古老的；古代的
n. 古人
belonging to the very distant past and no longer in existence.
having been in existence for a very long time.
showing or feeling signs of age or wear.
an old person.
a standard, flag, or ensign.
"the ancient civilizations of the Mediterranean"
"an ancient gateway"
"an ancient pair of jeans"
"a solitary ancient in a tweed jacket"
This is an ancient parable.这是一个古老的寓言。
It's an ancient tale which appears in various guises in several languages.那是一个以几种语言叙述的古老的故事。
Soldiers in ancient time used escutcheon to fight.古代的士兵用饰有花纹的盾作战。
This stone axe is a relic of ancient times.这把石斧是古代的遗物。
We will all have a course in ancient history this term.这个学期我们都有一门古代史课程。
The ancients believed that the sun and moon were planets.古人相信太阳和月亮都是星球。

androgynous

[æn'drɒdʒənəs], [æn'drɑːdʒənəs]


Image Search
adj. 雌雄同体的；雌雄同花的；兼有男女两性的
partly male and partly female in appearance; of indeterminate sex.
having the physical characteristics of both sexes; hermaphrodite.
In the last chapter Woolf touched the possibility of an androgynous mind.在最后一章，伍尔夫谈到了所谓“雌雄同体”的想法。
My look is very androgynous, and I consider myself a fashion chameleon.我的外表十分“中性化”，所以我觉得自己能成为时尚界的“变色龙”。
We are less threatened by the opposite sex within us and become more androgynous.我们较不会受到异性的威胁,而变得更中性化。

anecdotal

[ˌænɪk'dəʊtl], [ˌænɪk'doʊtl]


Image Search
adj. 轶事的；趣闻的
(of an account) not necessarily true or reliable, because based on personal accounts rather than facts or research.
characterized by or fond of telling anecdotes.
(of a painting) depicting small narrative incidents.
"while there was much anecdotal evidence there was little hard fact"
"her book is anecdotal and chatty"
"nineteenth-century French anecdotal paintings"
That book is pleasantly anecdotal.那本书中有许多有趣的轶事。
Evidence for a discovery is anecdotal.发现的证据只是一些奇闻轶事。
Their research was based largely on anecdotal evidence.他们的研究主要以趣闻为基础。

anguish

['æŋɡwɪʃ], ['æŋɡwɪʃ]


Image Search
n. 苦闷；痛苦
v. （使）极苦闷；（使）极痛苦
severe mental or physical pain or suffering.
be extremely distressed about something.
"she shut her eyes in anguish"
"he anguished over how to reply"
Physical disability causes mental anguish.生理伤残会引起心理苦闷。
I expected something with a terrible anguish that tortured my heart.在极度揪心的苦闷中我似乎在期待着某种东西。
The quarrel caused her great anguish.争吵给她造成了极大的痛苦。
Her mental anguish was beyond words.她内心的痛苦难以用言语形容。
I was in anguish until I knew she was still alive.我以前不知道她还活著，所以一直万分痛苦。
Physical disability causes mental anguish.生理伤残会引起心理苦闷。
Who can measure the anguish of my heart?谁会了解我内心的苦闷？
Her heart anguished within her.她的心中非常痛苦。

animosity

[ˌænɪ'mɒsəti], [ˌænɪ'mɑːsəti]


Image Search
n. 憎恶；仇恨
strong hostility.
"he no longer felt any animosity toward her"
As the years have passed, the animosity between the two has only grown.几年过去了，这种憎恶之感却在不断增加。
Celtic Football Club boss Gordon Strachan insists there is no animosity between him and Sir Alex Ferguson.凯尔特人队的主教练斯特拉坎坚称他和弗格森之间没有相互憎恶。
There is great animosity between the two classes.这两个阶级之间有很深的仇恨。
He has a strong animosity against his enemy.他对敌人有强烈的仇恨。

annex

[ə'neks], [ə'neks]


Image Search
vt. 并吞；附加；获得
n. 附件；附属物；附属建筑物
append or add as an extra or subordinate part, especially to a document.
add (territory) to one's own territory by appropriation.
take for oneself; appropriate.
add or attach as a condition or consequence.
a building joined to or associated with a main building, providing additional space or accommodations.
an addition to a document.
"the first ten amendments were annexed to the Constitution in 1791"
"the left bank of the Rhine was annexed by France in 1797"
"it was bad enough that Richard should have annexed his girlfriend"
"an annex to the report"
Japan annexed Korea in 1910.日本在1910年吞并了朝鲜。
In the years immediately preceding the outbreak of war in1939, Hitler succeeded in annexing various parts of Europe to Germany without firing a shot.在1939年大战爆发的前几年，希特勒没开一抢而成功地把欧洲许多地区并吞为德国领土。
Happiness is not always annexed to wealth.财富并不一定会带来幸福。
A new wing has been annexed to the hospital.医院已经增建了一个新侧楼。
She annexed the first prize in the speech contest.她在演讲比赛中获得头等奖。
Any annex is the integral part of this contract.本合同一切附件均为本合同的有效组成部分。
The annex has been built on to the main building.主楼配建有附属的建筑物。
We decided to cover in the passage between the main building and the annex.我们决定在主楼和建筑物之间的过道上加盖屋顶。

antagonistic

[ænˌtæɡə'nɪstɪk], [ænˌtæɡə'nɪstɪk]


Image Search
adj. 对抗性的；敌对的
showing or feeling active opposition or hostility toward someone or something.
relating to an antagonist or its action.
"he was antagonistic to the government's reforms"
His policy is antagonistic to our interests.他的政策兴我们的利益相抵触。
In ordinary circumstances, contradictions among the people are not antagonistic.在一般情况下，人民内部的矛盾不是对抗性的。
Cats and mouses are often antagonistic.猫和老鼠是敌对的。
Europe was antagonistic to the Unites States.欧洲对美国是敌对的。

antelope

['æntɪləʊp], ['æntɪloʊp]


Image Search
n. 羚羊；羚羊皮革
a swift-running deerlike ruminant with smooth hair and upward-pointing horns, native to Africa and Asia.
another term for pronghorn.
The hunter disembowelled the antelope.猎人取出羚羊的内脏。
Antelope live in Africa and Asia.羚羊生活在非洲和亚洲。

antennae

[æn'teniː], [æn'teniː]


Image Search
n. 天线；[动]触须；触角；直觉
名词antenna的复数形式.
either of a pair of long, thin sensory appendages on the heads of insects, crustaceans, and some other arthropods.
the faculty of instinctively detecting and interpreting subtle signs.
a rod, wire, or other device used to transmit or receive radio or television signals.
"he has the political antennae of a party whip"
He had to turn to adjust the antennae.然后他就得调整天线。
Radio antennae can also be incorporated into this layer.电台天线也可以被置入这一层。
Sometimes a creature uses a pair of antennae to swim.有时某些动物使用其一对触须来游泳。
Ants also have large heads, elbowed antennae, and powerful jaws.蚂蚁也有非常大的头，弯曲的触须，和强有力的下巴。
An insect's versatile antennae can move up and down or laterally.昆虫灵活的触角能够上下或向侧边自由转动。
Eyes and antennae barely reveal the head of the leaf insect Phyllium giganteum.眼睛和触角勉强显露出这只叶虫的头部。

anticipate

[æn'tɪsɪpeɪt], [æn'tɪsɪpeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 预期；提前使用；抢 ... 前
vi. 预言
regard as probable; expect or predict.
guess or be aware of (what will happen) and take action in order to be prepared.
look forward to.
act as a forerunner or precursor of.
come or take place before (an event or process expected or scheduled for a later time).
act before (someone) in expectation of what they will do; forestall.
"she anticipated scorn on her return to the theater"
"they failed to anticipate a full scale invasion"
"Stephen was eagerly anticipating the break from the routine of business"
"he anticipated Bates's theories on mimicry and protective coloration"
"I'm sorry, go on. I did not mean to anticipate you"
We anticipate that we will meet a certain amount of resistance to our plan.我们预料我们的计划会遇到一些人的反对。
I anticipate reading the book with great interest.我以极大的兴趣期待着读这本书。
It is unwise to anticipate your earnings by spending a lot of money.大量花钱提前使用自己的收入是不明智的。
They anticipate ours by just one month.他们比我们抢先了一个月。

antipathy

[æn'tɪpəθi], [æn'tɪpəθi]


Image Search
n. 憎恶；反感；不相容
a deep-seated feeling of dislike; aversion.
"his fundamental antipathy to capitalism"
Honest men have a natural antipathy to politicians.诚实的人对政客们有一种自然的嫌恶。
He showed a strong antipathy to this place.他对这个地方表示了强烈的反感。
The strong personal antipathy between the two scholars is very obvious.那两位学者之间的格格不入是很明显的。

anxious

['æŋkʃəs], ['æŋkʃəs]


Image Search
adj. 渴望的；忧虑的
experiencing worry, unease, or nervousness, typically about an imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome.
(of a period of time or situation) causing or characterized by worry or nervousness.
wanting something very much, typically with a feeling of unease.
"she was extremely anxious about her exams"
"there were some anxious moments"
"the company was anxious to avoid any trouble"
The whole country was anxious for peace.全国上下都渴望和平。
I am anxious to compare my fancy with reality.我焦切地把我的想象同现实作一番比较。
Small businesses are anxious to experiment with computers.小型企业都急于试用计算机。
She was anxious to enlighten me about the events that led up to the dispute.她急着要使我明白引起这场争执的那些事情。
I'm very anxious about the speech contest.我对此次演讲比赛十分忧虑。
The moderates have plenty to be anxious about.温和派有许多问题要担忧。
I was anxious about the children when they didn't come back home from school.孩子们放学后没有回家，我非常担心。

apparently

[ə'pærəntli], [ə'pærəntli]


Image Search
adv. 表面上；似乎；显然
as far as one knows or can see.
"the child nodded, apparently content with the promise"
Beneath that apparently calm surface is a man of fierce temper.文静的外表掩盖着的是一个火暴脾气的人。
Apparently,he is weak,but he has hidden strength.表面上他看起来软弱，但他有隐藏的力气。
The judge distinguished between cases apparently similar.法官在表面上差不多的案件之间进行鉴别。
About 24 hours ago, I apparently got hit with it.大约24小时前,我与它似乎有击中。
Apparently it's going to rain today.今天似乎要下雨。
The speaker is apparently unaware(that) dogs are a public nuisance.发言人显然没有注意到，狗是一种社会公害。
Apparently they're intending to put up the price of water.看来他们要提高水费了。
Apparently he never wrote a letter to her.显然，他一封信也没给她写。
He was apparently much surprised at the news.他对那个消息显然感到十分惊异。

append

[ə'pend], [ə'pend]


Image Search
vt. 附加；添加
add (something) as an attachment or supplement.
"the results of the survey are appended to this chapter"
Append additional data to the file object.在文件对象中附加上其他数据。
If you hand in your report late, append a note explaining the reason for the delay.如果你的报告迟交了，附加一便条解释你迟交的原因。
We will append the picture separately.我们将分开添加图片。

appliance

[ə'plaɪəns], [ə'plaɪəns]


Image Search
n. 器具；应用；装置；器械
a device or piece of equipment designed to perform a specific task, typically a domestic one.
an apparatus fitted by a surgeon or a dentist for corrective or therapeutic purpose.
the action or process of bringing something into operation.
"electrical and gas appliances"
"the appliance of science could increase crop yields"
The appliance carries a full-year guarantee.器具有一年的保证期。
These appliances are made of stainless iron.这些器具是用不锈钢制成的。
The appliance of electricity to household task makes housework much easier.电力应用于家务上使做家务事容易多了。
You'd better not install the appliance in a confined space.你最好不要把装置安装在密闭的地方。
The company offered the latest catalogue electrical appliance.那家公司提供了最新电力器械目录。

appreciate

[ə'priːʃieɪt], [ə'priːʃieɪt]


Image Search
vt. 欣赏；赏识；感激；领会；意识到
vi. 增值
recognize the full worth of.
be grateful for (something).
understand (a situation) fully; recognize the full implications of.
rise in value or price.
"she feels that he does not appreciate her"
"I'd appreciate any information you could give me"
"they failed to appreciate the pressure he was under"
"they expected the house to appreciate in value"
I really appreciate his complete absorption in his work.我很欣赏他对工作的极端专注。
I've decided to learn photography in order that I may better appreciate the beauty of nature.我决定学摄影以便能更好地欣赏自然的美。
Very few people really appreciate his works.没人赏识他的作品。
His talents are not fully appreciated in that company.他的才干在那家公司未受到充分赏识。
I deeply appreciate your concern.我非常感激你的关心。
I would greatly appreciate it if you would send me the application forms as soon as possible.若能尽快寄来申请表格,我将不胜感激。
It is at time like this that one really appreciates the kindness of a friend.只有在这样的时刻,一个人才会真正领会到朋友的深情厚意。
They failed to appreciate significance of the precautions.他们没有意识到这些预防措施的重要性。
Land will continue to appreciate.土地将继续增值。
Our house has appreciated by 50% in the last two years.在过去的两年中,我们的房子增值了50%25。

apprehension

[ˌæprɪ'henʃn], [ˌæprɪ'henʃn]


Image Search
n. 理解；忧惧；逮捕；了解
anxiety or fear that something bad or unpleasant will happen.
understanding; grasp.
the action of arresting someone.
"he felt sick with apprehension"
"the pure apprehension of the work of art"
"they acted with intent to prevent lawful apprehension"
The matter is beyond my apprehension.这件事我无法理解。
He felt some apprehension over the result.他对结果有点担心。
He looked around the room with apprehension.他恐惧地检查房间的四周。
The thief, after his apprehension, escaped.这贼被捕后又逃了。

appropriate

[ə'prəʊpriət ], [ə'proʊpriət]


Image Search
adj. 适当的；相称的
vt. 占用；拨出(款项)
suitable or proper in the circumstances.
take (something) for one's own use, typically without the owner's permission.
devote (money or assets) to a special purpose.
"a measure appropriate to a wartime economy"
"his images have been appropriated by advertisers"
"there can be problems in appropriating funds for legal expenses"
You will be informed of the details at the appropriate time.在适当的时候将把详情告诉你。
It is not easy to choose clothes which are appropriate to your beautiful figure.选择与你漂亮的体型相称的服装是不容易的。
She again entreated his forgiveness for so selfishly appropriating the cottage她为自己这么自私地占用了这座农舍而再次恳求他的原谅。
The government has appropriated some funds for education.政府拨出了一些款项用作教育基金。

approximate

[ə'prɒksɪmət], [ə'prɑːksɪmət]


Image Search
adj. 近似的；大约的
v. 接近；约等于
close to the actual, but not completely accurate or exact.
come close or be similar to something in quality, nature, or quantity.
estimate or calculate (a quantity) fairly accurately.
"the calculations are very approximate"
"a leasing agreement approximating to ownership"
"I had to approximate the weight of my horse"
This is just an approximate figure.这仅仅是个近似值。
We are entirely justified in using the approximate theory.我们用近似理论完全正当。
He spent approximate two hours searching the photo.他用了大约两小时来寻找这张照片.
The approximate number of students in the school is 300.这所学校的学生数大约为300人。
Production costs approximate to $100,000 .生产成本接近十万美元。
The color of the curtains approximates that of the rug.窗帘的颜色和地毯相近。
The cost of the project will approximate $10,000.这个项目的成本大约为一万美金。

aptitude

['æptɪtjuːd], ['æptɪtuːd]


Image Search
n. 天资；资质；才能；倾向
a natural ability to do something.
a natural tendency.
suitability or fitness.
"he had a remarkable aptitude for learning words"
"his natural aptitude for failure"
"aptitude of expression"
That student has an aptitude for mathematics.那个学生有数学方面的天赋。
He shows great aptitude in painting.他在绘画上表现出很高的才能。
He has little aptitude for a business career.他没有从事商业的资质。
He has an aptitude for languages.他具有学习语言的才能。
Edison had a remarkable aptitude for inventing new things.爱迪生具有发明创造的非凡才能。
Most school-leavers should take an aptitude test.大多数中学毕业生都应参加能力倾向测试。

arbitrary

['ɑːbɪtrəri], ['ɑːrbətreri]


Image Search
adj. 任意的；专制的；武断的；霸道的
based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.
(of power or a ruling body) unrestrained and autocratic in the use of authority.
(of a constant or other quantity) of unspecified value.
"his mealtimes were entirely arbitrary"
"arbitrary rule by King and bishops has been made impossible"
My choice was quite arbitrary.我的选择相当随意。
I'm not used to your arbitrary standards.我不习惯你们那些随心所欲的标准。
Dictators are arbitrary rulers.独裁者即独断专横的统治者。
This is an arbitrary decision.这是个武断的决定。

arid

['ærɪd], ['ærɪd]


Image Search
adj. 干燥的；不毛的；枯燥的；无趣的；没有生气的
(of land or a climate) having little or no rain; too dry or barren to support vegetation.
lacking in interest, excitement, or meaning.
"hot and arid conditions"
"his arid years in suburbia"
The broom grows down the arid sandhill.金雀草蔓延在干燥的沙丘下。
It is difficult to grow fruit in arid desert areas.在干燥的沙漠地带栽培水果很困难。
How can people make a living in this arid area?这片不毛之地上的人们怎么谋生呢？
The audience soon grew tired of his arid speech.没多久听众对他枯燥无味的演说就感到厌腻了。
He is tired of the arid studies that have produced nothing new.他对这些没有新意的枯燥乏味的研究感到厌倦。

arrears

[ə'rɪəz], [ə'rɪrz]


Image Search
n. 到期未付之债；拖欠的款项；待做的工作
名词arrear的复数形式.
money that is owed and should have been paid earlier.
"he was suing the lessee for the arrears of rent"
They were in arrears with their mortgage, so their home was repossessed.他们未按时还按揭贷款，所以房子被收回了。
I have fallen into arrears with my rent.我已经拖欠租金了。
As a result, the arrears stay unpaid.那些老板拖欠的工资至今尚未付清。
I have to clear off arrears of work and correspondence.我必须处理积压的工作和信件。
I'm in arrears with the housework.我的家务事还拖著呢。

artichoke

['ɑːtɪtʃəʊk], ['ɑːrtɪtʃoʊk]


Image Search
n. 洋蓟；朝鲜蓟；菊芋
a European plant cultivated for its large thistlelike flower heads.
the unopened flower head of this, of which the heart and the fleshy bases of the bracts are edible.
see Jerusalem artichoke.
I'll have creamed chicken, just the bread and the artichoke hearts.我点一份奶油煮鸡、面包和洋蓟菜心。
Another is made of artichoke and dandelion, can help rule out the toxins.还有一种是用 洋蓟和蒲公英制成，能够帮助排除体内毒素。
Another is made of artichoke and dandelion, which can help rule out the toxins.还有一种是用洋蓟和蒲公英制成
Artichoke leaf has been shown to lower cholesterol.朝鲜蓟可有效降低胆固醇。

ascent

[ə'sent], [ə'sent]


Image Search
n. 上升；上坡路；晋升；提升
a climb or walk to the summit of a mountain or hill.
an upward slope or path.
an instance of rising through the air.
a rise to an important position or a higher level.
"the first ascent of the Matterhorn"
"the ascent grew steeper"
"the first balloon ascent was in 1783"
"his ascent to power"
This was the third phase of his ascent.这是他上升的第三阶段。
They made a successful ascent of the mountain.他们成功地登上了山。
The last part of the ascent is very steep.最后一段上坡路很陡。
The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.这位老人攀登这条陡峭的上坡路有困难。
Getting ready for a slow ascent is more likely.作好准备慢慢地升迁的可能性更大。
His rapid ascent in the social scale was surprising.他的社会地位提高之迅速令人吃惊。
For if this occurred, it could interfere with the ascent of nature.因为如果这一切发生，就会妨碍大自然的提升。

ascertain

[ˌæsə'teɪn], [ˌæsər'teɪn]


Image Search
vt. 确定；查明；探知
find (something) out for certain; make sure of.
"an attempt to ascertain the cause of the accident"
I ascertain that he was murdered.我确定他是被谋杀的。
I ascertained the disease to be diphtheria.我确定该病为白喉。
The detective was trying to ascertain exactly who was at the party.这个侦探试图查明都有谁参加了聚会。
I'm going to ascertain the truth.我要查明真相。
It's difficult to ascertain the coal deposits.煤储量很难探明。
My purpose is to ascertain whether you are interested or not.我的目的是要弄清你是否感兴趣。

asparagus

There is even?a bonus disc?for creating asparagus.还有一个附赠的做芦笋的碟子。

aspect

['æspekt], ['æspekt]


Image Search
n. 方面；方位；外观；外貌
a particular part or feature of something.
a specific way in which something can be considered.
a particular appearance or quality.
the positioning of a building or thing in a specified direction.
the side of a building facing a particular direction.
a particular position of a planet or other celestial body relative to another, as measured by angular distance.
a grammatical category or form that expresses the way in which time is denoted by the verb.
(of a planet) form an aspect with (another celestial body).
"the financial aspect can be overstressed"
"from every aspect, theirs was a changing world"
"the air of desertion lent the place a sinister aspect"
"a greenhouse with a southern aspect"
"the front aspect of the hotel was unremarkable"
"the sun in Aries formed an adverse aspect with Uranus in Capricorn"
"the semantics of tense and aspect"
"the sun is superbly aspected by your ruler Mars on the 19th"
This is only one aspect of the problem.这只是问题的一个方面。
He has made progress in every aspect.他在各方面都有起色。
The building has a southern aspect.那座建筑是朝南的。
The open spaces differ according to aspect.开敞空地随方位而不同。
His brother is a man with a serious aspect.他的兄弟是一个外貌严肃的人。
The fierce aspect of the salesman frightened the customer off.那个店员的凶相把顾客吓走了。

the side of a building facing a particular direction.

"from every aspect, theirs was a changing world"

aspiration

[ˌæspə'reɪʃn], [ˌæspə'reɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 抱负；热望；志向；渴望
n. 吸引术；抽吸；吸气；发送气音
a hope or ambition of achieving something.
the object of one's hope or ambition; a goal.
the action or process of drawing breath.
the action of drawing fluid by suction from a vessel or cavity.
the action of pronouncing a sound with an exhalation of breath.
"he had nothing tangible to back up his literary aspirations"
"fabrics and oriental rugs were my aspirations"
His true aspiration is to become the President of the United States.他真正的抱负是想成为美国总统。
He nursed an aspiration to be a poet.他心怀当诗人的愿望。
The generalship was his aspiration.将官之职位是他梦寐以求的目标。
These are not just my goals, but our common aspiration.这些不仅仅是我的目标,而且是我们的共同志向。
Young Edison had a strong aspiration to be an inventor.年幼的爱迪生就渴望成为一名发明家。
Aspiration cytologic examination reealed a fibrocystic change.抽吸细胞学检查为纤维囊性变。
An aspiration psychrometer could destroy a delicate moisture balance.抽吸式干湿球温度计能够破坏细微的水分平衡。

assail

[ə'seɪl], [ə'seɪl]


Image Search
v. 使苦恼，纠缠；猛烈攻击；言语抨击
make a concerted or violent attack on.
(of an unpleasant feeling or physical sensation) come upon (someone) suddenly and strongly.
criticize (someone) strongly.
"the Scots army assailed Edward's army from the rear"
"she was assailed by doubts and regrets"
The thought came to assail me.这个想法使我困扰。
Then doubts and fears did assail the very strongest .疑惑和恐惧的确困扰过意志最坚强的人。
The enemy may assail our defense positions tomorrow.敌人可能明天就攻击我们的防守据点。
This book is not meant to assail Christianity.这本书的本意不是抨击基督教的。

assailant

[ə'seɪlənt], [ə'seɪlənt]


Image Search
n. 攻击者
a person who physically attacks another.
She was unable to get to grips with her assailant.她无力与袭击她的人扭打。
The doctor fought with his assailant until he ran away.医生和他的攻击者打起来，直到把那人打跑。

assent

[ə'sent], [ə'sent]


Image Search

vi. 赞成
the expression of approval or agreement.
official agreement or sanction.
express approval or agreement, typically officially.
"a loud murmur of assent"
"the governor has power to withhold his assent from a bill"
"Roosevelt assented to the agreement"
The government gave its assent to the new project.政府同意了新的工程项目。
I can never assent to such a request.我决不能同意这种要求。

assert

[ə'sɜːt], [ə'sɜːrt]


Image Search
vt. 断言；主张，坚持；生效；维护
state a fact or belief confidently and forcefully.
cause others to recognize (one's authority or a right) by confident and forceful behavior.
behave or speak in a confident and forceful manner.
"the company asserts that the cuts will not affect development"
"the good librarian is able to assert authority when required"
"it was time to assert himself"
She asserted that he was innocent.她断言，他是无罪的。
Upon inspection, we assert that the systems development process is empirical通过以上分析,我们断言系统开发过程是经验的
We encouraged him to assert his view of the matter.我们鼓励他坚持自己对此事的看法。
The laws of historical development will assert themselves.历史发展的规律是不可抗拒的。
They are agitating to assert autonomy.他们正在鼓吹实行自治。
Justice will assert itself .正义必将伸张。
The laws of historical development will assert themselves.历史发展的规律是不可抗拒的。

assess

[ə'ses], [ə'ses]


Image Search
v. 评定；评估；估算
evaluate or estimate the nature, ability, or quality of.
calculate or estimate the price or value of.
set the value of a tax, fine, etc., for (a person or property) at a specified level.
"the committee must assess the relative importance of the issues"
"the damage was assessed at $5 billion"
"all empty properties will be assessed at 50 percent"
He can quickly assess a person's character.他能很快地评定出某人的品质。
How do you assess your students?你如何评估学生们？
We will assess the damages caused by the flood.我们将对洪灾造成的损失进行评估。
She looked at the house and assessed its market value.她看了看房子并估算了其市场价值。

assistance

[ə'sɪstəns], [ə'sɪstəns]


Image Search

the action of helping someone with a job or task.
the provision of money, resources, or information to help someone.

We are ready to render them economic assistance.我们愿意向他们提供经济援助。
He gave the assistance to me when I was in trouble.我有麻烦时,他向我伸出援助之手。
You can not rely on his assistance.你不能指望他能帮助你。
I really appreciate your assistance.衷心感谢您的帮助。

assume

[ə'sjuːm], [ə'suːm]


Image Search
vt. 假定；设想；承担；(想当然的)认为；假装
suppose to be the case, without proof.
take or begin to have (power or responsibility).
seize (power or control).
take on (a specified quality, appearance, or extent).
take on or adopt (a manner or identity), sometimes falsely.
"you're afraid of what people are going to assume about me"
"he assumed full responsibility for all organizational work"
"the rebels assumed control of the capital"
"militant activity had assumed epidemic proportions"
"Oliver assumed an expression of penitence"
Let's assume it to be true.让我们假定这是真的。
We assume his guilt.我们假定他是有罪的。
They assumed their operational positions.他们设想了自己在实施中的作用。
I am not afraid to assume the responsibility.我不怕承担责任.
She was in arrogance to assume she would win every time.她认为每次都能赢，未免太自大了。

assumptions

[ə'sʌmpʃnz], [ə'sʌmpʃnz]


Image Search
n. 假设，臆测（名词assumption的复数形式）
a thing that is accepted as true or as certain to happen, without proof.
the action of taking or beginning to take power or responsibility.
the reception of the Virgin Mary bodily into heaven. This was formally declared a doctrine of the Roman Catholic Church in 1950.
the feast in honor of this, celebrated on August 15.
arrogance or presumption.
"they made certain assumptions about the market"
"the assumption of an active role in regional settlements"
These assumptions are clearly contrary to realism.这些假设显然是与现实不符的。
My assumptions about this show were wrong.我对这个表演的假设是错的。

assured

[ə'ʃʊəd], [ə'ʃʊrd]


Image Search
adj. 确实的；保障的；有自信的
动词assure的过去式和过去分词.
confident.
protected against discontinuance or change.
tell someone something positively or confidently to dispel any doubts they may have.
make (someone) sure of something.
make (something) certain to happen.
cover (a person) with life insurance.
secure the future payment of (an amount) with insurance.
"“Certainly not,” was her assured reply"
"an assured tenancy"
"Tony assured me that there was a supermarket in the village"
"you would be assured of a fine welcome"
"victory was now assured"
Please rest assured that repayment is ensured.请您放心，还款是有保障的。

astonish

[ə'stɒnɪʃ], [ə'stɑːnɪʃ]


Image Search
vt. 使惊讶；使吃惊
