She astonished me with her beautiful handwriting.她以其秀丽的书法而使我惊异。
A matter of repeated occurrence like this will not astonish people.重复出现的事物不会使人吃惊。

astute

[ə'stjuːt], [ə'stuːt]


Image Search
adj. 机敏的；精明的；狡猾的
having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.
"an astute businessman"
But by this point, any astute businessperson has a new product waiting in the wings, ready to hit the market and revitalize his business.但到了此时，任何机敏的业主都已经开发出新产品，准备好重新进入市场开始自己新的生意。
Only Parmalat's seemingly astute ability to rapidly grow earnings and revenues with acquisitions had placated those concerns.不过，帕玛拉特所拥有似乎很机敏的能力，可以通过收购快速提高利润和收入，才打消市场疑虑。
Astute salesmen know how to invest emotionally.精明的商人懂得如何感情投资。
Zhou Enlai was too astute to rail against reality.周恩来是一个非常精明的人，他不会诅咒现实。
Despite his primitive dress and thuggish demeanor, Yavid was actually an astute field commander, drawing on strategies he had learned in his military studies as a youth.尽管衣着原始，行为凶蛮，亚维德却是个狡猾的战地指挥官，他年轻时受过军事教育，懂得制订战略。

atmosphere

['ætməsfɪə(r)], ['ætməsfɪr]


Image Search
n. 大气；空气；气氛；气压
the envelope of gases surrounding the earth or another planet.
the air in any particular place.
a unit of pressure equal to mean atmospheric pressure at sea level, 101,325 pascals.
the pervading tone or mood of a place, situation, or work of art.
a pleasurable and interesting or exciting mood.
"part of the sun's energy is absorbed by the earth's atmosphere"
"we couldn't breathe in the dusty atmosphere of his apartment"
"the hotel is famous for its friendly, welcoming atmosphere"
"a superb restaurant, full of atmosphere"
The burning of fossil fuels results in the pollution of the atmosphere.矿物燃料的燃烧导致了大气污染。
The atmosphere of the city is very much polluted.那个城市的空气受到严重污染。
The atmosphere is very stuffy here and can we open a window?这里的空气很闷,咱们能打开一扇窗吗？
The atmosphere changed as soon as she walked in.她一进来气氛就变了。
The atmosphere over dinner was warm and friendly.用餐时洋溢著热情友好的气氛。
The atmosphere pressure gradient is an inverse measure of the spacing of the isobars on a weather map.气压梯度与天气图上等压线的间隔大小成反比。
The water droplets ejected by the gun expand in the atmosphere because it is at lower pressure than the air used to make the droplets.由于大气气压比造雪炮中气压低，雪炮中的水滴被喷射到空气中。

atrocity

[ə'trɒsəti], [ə'trɑːsəti]


Image Search
n. 暴行；残暴
an extremely wicked or cruel act, typically one involving physical violence or injury.
a highly unpleasant or distasteful object.
"war atrocities"
"the house was a split-level atrocity"
People were annoyed by his atrocity.他的暴行激怒了人们。
This atrocity shocked the world opinion.这暴行使全世界舆论感到震惊。
I am shocked by the atrocity of this man's crimes.这个人行凶手段残忍狠毒使我震惊。

audible

['ɔːdəbl], ['ɔːdəbl]


Image Search
adj. 听得见的
able to be heard.
a change in the offensive play called by the quarterback at the line of scrimmage.
"ultrasound is audible to dogs"
He sang with no visible or audible strain.听上去和看起来，他唱得不费劲。
The shot was clearly audible in the silence.寂靜中枪声听得很清楚。
Their voices were audible to the neighbors.他们的声音邻居都听得到。
Her voice was scarcely audible above the noise of the wind.在风中她的声音几乎听不见。
A subdued impassioned murmur was audible in the room beyond.可以听得见那边屋子里有一阵低低的、激动的交谈声。

auspicious

[ɔː'spɪʃəs], [ɔː'spɪʃəs]


Image Search
adj. 吉利的；幸运的；有利的
conducive to success; favorable.
giving or being a sign of future success.
characterized by success; prosperous.
"it was not the most auspicious moment to hold an election"
"they said it was an auspicious moon—it was rising"
"he was respectful to his auspicious customers"
The publication of my first book was an auspicious beginning of my career.我的第一本书的出版是我事业吉祥的开始。
The new boy had an auspicious first day in the elementary school.这个新来的男孩在小学校里有幸运的第一天。
Among historians of science, that's what is known as a rollicking and auspicious start.在科学历史学家中，这就是所谓的快乐而幸运的开始。
The project had an auspicious beginning.这个计划有一个良好的开端。
It's an auspicious time to ask for a raise in salary.这是一个要求增加工资的有利时机。

austere

[ɒ'stɪə(r)], [ɔː'stɪr]


Image Search
adj. 简朴的；严厉的；苦行的；紧缩的
severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance.
(of living conditions or a way of life) having no comforts or luxuries; harsh or ascetic.
having an extremely plain and simple style or appearance; unadorned.
(of an economic policy or measure) designed to reduce a budget deficit, especially by cutting public expenditure.
"an austere man, with a rigidly puritanical outlook"
"conditions in the prison could hardly be more austere"
"the cathedral is impressive in its austere simplicity"
The room was furnished in austere style.这间屋子陈设得简单朴素。
Father was an austere man, very strict with his children.父亲是个严厉的人,对子女十分严格。
Monks are leading simple, austere lives.僧侣们过着清苦的生活。
We led an austere life in the mountains.我们在山区过着艰苦的生活。
Many people are in favor of the government's austere economic policies.很多民众支持政府的经济紧缩政策。

authentic

[ɔː'θentɪk], [ɔː'θentɪk]


Image Search
adj. 真正的；真实的；可信的；可靠的
of undisputed origin; genuine.
made or done in the traditional or original way, or in a way that faithfully resembles an original.
based on facts; accurate or reliable.
(in existentialist philosophy) relating to or denoting an emotionally appropriate, significant, purposive, and responsible mode of human life.
(of a church mode) comprising the notes lying between the principal note or final and the note an octave higher.
"the letter is now accepted as an authentic document"
"the restaurant serves authentic Italian meals"
"an authentic depiction of the situation"
This is an authentic medieval sword.这是一把真正的中世纪剑。
He found out the most authentic restaurants.他找到了最正宗的餐馆。
The details of the costume were totally authentic.这件古装的每个小地方都完全真实。
He's got an authentic letter by Shakespeare.他弄到了一封莎士比亚的亲笔信。
The screen saver is accompanied by authentic Didgeridoo music.屏幕保护程序被伴随着可信的澳大利亚土著居民的管乐器音乐。
Next, patients in the first group received authentic acupuncture with needles placed in established "acupoints.然后，第一组患者接受了可信的针灸疗法，将针放置在确定的针灸穴位。
They demanded to be shown the authentic documents.他们要求出示真实可靠的文件。

authoritative

[ɔː'θɒrətətɪv], [ə'θɔːrəteɪtɪv]


Image Search
adj. 权威性的；命令式的
able to be trusted as being accurate or true; reliable.
(of a text) considered to be the best of its kind and unlikely to be improved upon.
commanding and self-confident; likely to be respected and obeyed.
proceeding from an official source and requiring compliance or obedience.
"clear, authoritative information and advice"
"the authoritative study of mollusks"
"she had an authoritative air"
"authoritative directives"
This is an authoritative biography.这是一本具有权威性的传记。
They have not yet relinquished the childish need for an authoritative father.他们还没有消除儿童对一个权威性的父亲的需要。
I make no claims that either are authoritative or independent.我没有提出任何命令式的或者独立的权利主张。

authorize

['ɔːθəraɪz], ['ɔːθəraɪz]


Image Search
vt. 批准；委托；授权
give official permission for or approval to (an undertaking or agent).
"the government authorized further aircraft production"
The committee authorized the payment of the money.委员会批准该款之支付。
I've been authorized by the court to repossess this property.我得到法庭认可重新拥有这笔财产。
I have authorized him to act for me while I am away.我已经委托他当我不在的时候代我处理。
He confidentially authorized me to act for him while he was abroad.他信任地委托我在他出国期间代行他的职务。
The President authorized him to do that.总统授权他办那件事。

avalanche

['ævəlɑːnʃ], ['ævəlæntʃ]


Image Search
n. 雪崩；大量
v. 雪崩
a mass of snow, ice, and rocks falling rapidly down a mountainside.
a large mass of any material moving rapidly downhill.
a sudden arrival or occurrence of something in overwhelming quantities.
a cumulative process in which a fast-moving ion or electron generates further ions and electrons by collision.
(of a mass of snow, ice, and rocks) descend rapidly down a mountainside.
engulf or carry off by an avalanche.
undergo a rapid increase in conductivity due to an avalanche process.
"an avalanche of mud"
"we have had an avalanche of applications"
"the climbers were avalanched down the south face of the mountain"
The avalanche whelmed the small mountain village.雪崩淹没了小山村。
Three climbers are safe after the avalanche.雪崩过后，三个登山者平安无事。
He was buried by an avalanche and had to be dug out.他遇雪崩被埋住了，得把他挖出来。
What a precarious situation we were in when the avalanche started!雪崩发生的时候我们的处境多么危险啊！
They were killed by an avalanche in the Swiss Alps.他们在瑞士阿尔卑斯山的一次雪崩中罹难。
The editorial office received an avalanche of mail.编辑部收到大量的信件。
Higher still the snow was ready to avalanche.在更高处积雪随时都会崩塌。

avenge

[ə'vendʒ], [ə'vendʒ]


Image Search
vt. 为 ... 报复； 报仇
inflict harm in return for (an injury or wrong done to oneself or another).
inflict harm on behalf of (oneself or someone else previously wronged or harmed).
"his determination to avenge the murder of his brother"
"we must avenge our dead"
How was he to avenge the one without outraging the other?怎样才能为这一个进行报复而不冒犯那一个呢？
Avenge the slain forefather by vanquishing Major Duke.报复杀害的祖先主要由击败杜克。
He swore by Jupiter to avenge his father's death.他对天发誓，要给他爸爸报仇。
He will avenge the people on their oppressor.他将为人民向压迫者报仇。

avocado

[ˌævə'kɑːdəʊ], [ˌævə'kɑːdoʊ]


Image Search
n. [植]鳄梨；鳄梨树
a pear-shaped fruit with a rough leathery skin, smooth oily edible flesh, and a large stone.
a light green color like that of the flesh of avocados.
the tropical evergreen tree that bears the avocado. It is native to Central America and widely cultivated elsewhere.
"serve with slices of avocado"
She always looked forward to the avocado season.她总是很期待鳄梨旺季。
The cheese and avocado dip is absolutely delicious.奶酪和鳄梨的调味酱简直就是人间美味。
This article will give you a few tips for pruning avocado trees.这篇文章会给你一些关于修剪鳄梨树的提示。
The rich and creamy avocado has been called the "chocolate" of fruits.这种富含营养和奶油色的鳄梨被称为水果中的“巧克力”。
The Aztecs also cultivated the avocado.阿兹特克人也经常种植鳄梨树。

balk

[bɔːk], [bɔːk]


Image Search
v. 阻止；突然停止；退缩；拒绝
n. 障碍；错误；失败
n. 梁木
[棒球]佯投； 犯规动作； [游戏]开球区.
hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or undertaking.
thwart or hinder (a plan or person).
prevent a person or animal from having (something).
(of a horse) refuse to go on.
miss or refuse (a chance or invitation).
(of a pitcher) make an illegal motion, penalized by an advance of the base runners.
an illegal motion made by a pitcher that may deceive a base runner.
a roughly squared timber beam.
any area on a pool or billiard table in which play is restricted in some way.
a ridge left unplowed between furrows.
"any gardener will at first balk at enclosing the garden"
"the utmost of his influence will be invoked to balk the law"
"the lions, fearing to be balked of their prey"
"the rookie balked and permitted Robinson to score"
Professor Xu Benli, of the Shanghai University of Sport, says successful sportspeople should not balk at turning over half of their earnings.上海体育学院徐本力教授表示，功成名就的运动员不应拒绝上缴一半的收入。
The high price is a balk to me.对我来说，价格太高是一个障碍。
There are small holes in the balk of a field, where crabs and fish accumulate in the rainy season.田间的梁木上有小洞口，螃蟹和鱼在雨季的时候会聚集在里面。
A player with ball in hand must play from the balk.拿球的选手必须从开球区开始打。

banal

[bə'nɑːl], [bə'nɑːl]


Image Search
adj. 陈腐的；平庸的
so lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring.
"songs with banal, repeated words"
Chris' banal advice was no help to us in solving our problem.克里斯陈腐的劝告对于解决我们的问题完全没有帮助。
Even if you are saying something banal, it will seem original if you make it vague, open-ended, and sphinxlike.哪怕你是在说一些很平庸陈腐的东西，说得越模糊，越显得独创而有哲理。
It involves systematic yet banal design, and blunt reportage.它使用系统的，然而平庸的设计和迟钝的新闻报道。

barrage

['bærɑːʒ], [bə'rɑːʒ]


Image Search
n. 弹幕；掩护炮火
n. 拦河坝
vt. 以密集火力进攻
a concentrated artillery bombardment over a wide area.
a concentrated outpouring, as of questions or blows.
bombard (someone) with something.
"she was not prepared for his barrage of questions"
"his doctor was barraged with unsolicited advice"
Make your opponents spin and crash as you bombard them with a barrage of weapons.向你的竞争对手们进行弹幕式的炸掉袭击，让他们团团转并一一被摧毁。

barren

['bærən], ['bærən]


Image Search
adj. 贫瘠的；无效的；不育的
n. 荒地
(of land) too poor to produce much or any vegetation.
(of a tree or plant) not producing fruit or seed.
(of a woman) unable to have children.
(of a female animal) not pregnant or unable to become so.
showing no results or achievements; unproductive.
(of a place or building) bleak and lifeless.
empty of meaning or value.
devoid of.
a barren tract or tracts of land.
"much of philosophy has been barren"
"the sports hall turned out to be a rather barren concrete building"
"those young heads were stuffed with barren facts"
"the room was barren of furniture"
"crossing the barrens was no easy feat"
No one could raise crops on this barren land.没人能够在这么贫瘠的土地上种庄稼。
Life is a barren field frozen with snow.生命就像是被雪覆盖的荒芜土地。
We shall turn this piece of barren land into wheat fields.我们要把这块不毛之地变为麦田。
He was engaged in a barren argument with Paul.他在同保罗作无用的争论。
Barren women are rejected by the tribesmen.不孕的妇女被部落的男人遗弃。

barrier

['bæriə(r)], ['bæriər]


Image Search
n. 栅栏；障碍物；屏障
a fence or other obstacle that prevents movement or access.
a circumstance or obstacle that keeps people or things apart or prevents communication or progress.
the starting gate of a racecourse.
a gate at a parking lot that controls access by being raised or lowered.
a long narrow island lying parallel and close to the mainland, protecting the mainland from erosion and storms.
"a language barrier"
The ice skater rammed into the barrier.溜冰者撞到护栏上了。
Heavy duties on imports and exports are a barrier to international trade.进出口的高关税是国际贸易的障碍。
The Sahara Desert is a natural barrier between north and central Africa.撒哈拉沙漠是北非与中非之间的天然屏障。

bashful

['bæʃfl], ['bæʃfl]


Image Search
adj. 害羞的；羞怯的；羞愧的
reluctant to draw attention to oneself; shy.
"don't be bashful about telling folks how you feel"
The bashful boy was nervous with strangers.那个害羞的小男孩遇到陌生人就紧张。
He suddenly became bashful the minute the girl he liked showed up.那个他喜欢的女生一出现他就变得非常害羞。
She is bashful about speaking in public.她在公开场合讲话会羞怯。
Out with it. Don't be affectedly bashful.有话快说，别扭扭捏捏的。
He because of bashful but low head.他因羞愧而低下了头。

basil

['bæzl], ['bæzl]


Image Search
n. 罗勒(芳香的草本植物)；留兰香（形似薄荷的香料）
Basil.
n. 巴兹尔(男子名)
an aromatic annual herb of the mint family, native to tropical Asia.
the leaves of the basil plant used as a culinary herb, especially in Mediterranean dishes.
The doctor wrote sweet basil in his prescription.医生给他的药方里有罗勒这味药。
The smells of black pepper and basil tempt you to take another sip.黑胡椒、罗勒的香味让人还想再尝一口。

bastion

['bæstiən], ['bæstiən]


Image Search
n. 棱堡；堡垒
a projecting part of a fortification built at an angle to the line of a wall, so as to allow defensive fire in several directions.
a natural rock formation resembling a bastion.
an institution, place, or person strongly defending or upholding particular principles, attitudes, or activities.
"the last bastion of male privilege"
These clubs are the last bastions of male privilege.这些俱乐部是男性特权的最后棱堡。
Pearl Harbor was the principal American bastion in the Pacific.珍珠港是美国在太平洋地区的主要棱堡。
The British public schools are bastion of privilege.英国的公学是特权的堡垒。
Their battle line is not solid and is anything but a bastion of iron.他们的战线不巩固，并不是铜墙铁壁。

beacon

['biːkən], ['biːkən]


Image Search
n. 烽火；灯塔；基地
a fire or light set up in a high or prominent position as a warning, signal, or celebration.
(often in place names) a hill suitable for beacon of fire or light.
a light or other visible object serving as a signal, warning, or guide, especially at sea or on an airfield.
a radio transmitter whose signal helps to fix the position of a ship, aircraft, or spacecraft.
"a chain of beacons carried the news"
"Ivinghoe Beacon"
The beacon fire shines on the capital.烽火照西京。
We climb the hill by day to watch for beacon fires and water horses by riverside when day expires.白日登山望烽火，黄昏饮马傍交河。
These beacons on the coast are to warn and guide ships.这些海滩上的信号灯是用来提醒和指示船舶的。
A beacon flamed out against the night sky.灯塔在夜空衬托下闪亮。
The blink of beacon could be seen for miles.灯塔的光亮在数英里之外都能看见。
Plane F103 has homed in on the radio beacon.F103号飞机已按照无线电信号飞回基地了。

beet

[biːt], [biːt]


Image Search
n. 甜菜根；甜菜
a herbaceous plant widely cultivated as a source of food for humans and livestock, and for processing into sugar. Some varieties are grown for their leaves and some for their large nutritious root.
the edible root of a kind of beet that is typically dark red and spherical and eaten as a vegetable.
the variety of beet that produces a dark red edible root, eaten as a vegetable.
Beets are Hank's favorite vegetable.甜菜根是汉克最爱吃的蔬菜。
They planted many beets this year.他们今年种了许多甜菜。
Now we are going to unload the beet pulp pellet overside into the barges.现在我们要把外档的甜菜渣卸到驳船上。

befuddle

[bɪ'fʌdl], [bɪ'fʌdəl]


Image Search
vt. 使昏迷；使迷惑；使烂醉
make (someone) unable to think clearly.
"he has an air of befuddled unworldliness"
The new arrival was befuddled by the rapid-fire conversation.新到达者被连珠炮似的谈话弄糊涂了。
Don't befuddle me with all those masses of detail.不要拿一大堆琐事把我搞迷糊。
He also fabricates sensational lies to befuddle world opinion.他也编造耸人听闻的谎言欺骗世界舆论。
John is very amusing when he is completely befuddled.当约翰喝得完全糊涂了的时候，他非常有趣儿。
The wine had befuddled them.他们喝葡萄酒已喝得酩酊大醉了。

bell pepper


Image Search
another term for sweet pepper.
Here is the fried beef with green pepper and onion, madam.这是您的青椒洋葱炒牛肉，女士。
Let me have your beef with pepper on your lunch specials and a bowl of wanton soup.我吃午餐特色菜牛肉炒青椒，再来一碗馄饨汤。

belligerent

[bə'lɪdʒərənt], [bə'lɪdʒərənt]


Image Search

n. 交战国；交战者
hostile and aggressive.
engaged in a war or conflict, as recognized by international law.
a nation or person engaged in war or conflict, as recognized by international law.
"a bull-necked, belligerent old man"
Tom always said some very belligerent things.汤姆他老是说些十分挑衅性的话。
The belligerent countries are having difficulties funding the war.交战国在为战争提供资金上有困难。
The belligerents were due to try to settle their differences.交战双方是由于试图解决他们之间的分歧。

bemoan

[bɪ'məʊn], [bɪ'moʊn]


Image Search
v. 悲叹；哀叹；叹息；为 ... 惋惜；认为遗憾
express discontent or sorrow over (something).
"single women bemoaning the absence of men"
He often bemoaned his sad fate.他总哀叹他的命苦。
Purists bemoan the corruption of the language.主张语文纯正的人哀叹语言趋于不纯。
He always bemoans the shortage of funds for research.他总是叹息研究经费不足。
The rich especially the older rich will bemoan the great refuge for secret stashes.富人们（尤其是那些较年长的富人）将对失去这个用于存放秘密资金的地方感到惋惜。

benefice

['benɪfɪs], ['benɪfɪs]


Image Search

v. 使获得有俸圣职
a permanent Church appointment, typically that of a rector or vicar, for which property and income are provided in respect of pastoral duties.
The Church instituted the young man into a benefice .教会任命这个年轻人担任牧师一职。

benevolent

[bə'nevələnt], [bə'nevələnt]


Image Search
adj. 仁慈的；乐善好施的
well meaning and kindly.
(of an organization) serving a charitable rather than a profit-making purpose.
"a benevolent smile"
"a benevolent fund"
The original designers of the human body were benevolent beings.人类身体的最初设计者是仁慈的生命体。
His benevolent nature prevented him from refusing any beggar who accosted him.他生性仁慈的，对任何一个向他乞讨的乞丐都慷慨解囊。
But can some EU members continue to treat Russia as a benevolent ally?但是，是否一些欧盟成员国仍可以把俄罗斯当作是一个乐善好施的盟友？
A benevolent employer has a sincere interest in the welfare of his employees.一个乐善好施的老板对于做好自己员工的福利待遇是真心实意的。

benign

[bɪ'naɪn], [bɪ'naɪn]


Image Search
adj. 仁慈的；温和的；良性的
gentle; kindly.
(of a climate or environment) mild and favorable.
not harmful to the environment.
(of a disease) not harmful in effect: in particular, (of a tumor) not malignant.
"her face was calm and benign"
"an ozone-benign refrigerant"
My mother's character is very benign.我母亲非常慈祥。
The heat, the bureaucracy, the confusion and complications of his job, had reduced him in seven years to a blob of benign jelly.炎热的天气，官僚政治和他工作的错综复杂和混乱，在七个年头里已使他变成一个仁慈的和稀泥老手。
The benign weather brought North America a bumper crop.温和的气候给北美带来大丰收。
After tests the tumor was found to be benign.检测发现肿瘤是良性的。

bequest

[bɪ'kwest], [bɪ'kwest]


Image Search
n. 遗产；遗赠物
a legacy.
the action of bequeathing something.
"her $135,000 was the largest bequest the library ever has received"
"a painting acquired by bequest"

We must note to protect our national bequest.我们必须注意保护自己的民族遗产。
The picture was acquired by bequest in 1921.这幅画是在1921年通过遗赠获得的。

berserk

Image Search
adj. 狂暴的；狂怒的
out of control with anger or excitement; wild or frenzied.
"after she left him, he went berserk, throwing things around the apartment"

He suddenly went berserk with rage.他突然狂怒起来。
My husband will go berserk if he finds you here.要是我丈夫发觉你在这里，他会气疯的。

besiege

[bɪ'siːdʒ], [bɪ'siːdʒ]


Image Search

surround (a place) with armed forces in order to capture it or force its surrender; lay siege to.

be inundated by large numbers of requests or complaints.
"the guerrillas continued to besiege other major cities to the north"
"she spent the whole day besieged by newsmen"
"the television station was besieged with calls"
When they came to besiege Kir Haraseth, Mesha did an abominable thing.当他们来围攻吉珥哈列设时，米沙做了一件可憎的事。
The city was besieged by the enemy for a few days.这座城市被敌人围困了几天。

betray

[bɪ'treɪ], [bɪ'treɪ]


Image Search
vt. 背叛；出卖；泄露；显露
expose (one's country, a group, or a person) to danger by treacherously giving information to an enemy.
treacherously reveal (secrets or information).
be disloyal to.
unintentionally reveal; be evidence of.
"a double agent who betrayed some 400 British and French agents to the Germans"
"many of those employed by diplomats betrayed secrets and sold classified documents"
"his friends were shocked when he betrayed them"
"she drew a deep breath that betrayed her indignation"
He betrayed his country.他背叛了他的国家。
He promised never to betray the organization.他发誓永不背叛组织。
He was seduced to betray his friend.他受唆使而出卖朋友。
As long as you don't betray me, I'll do whatever you ask me to.只要你不出卖我,要我做什么我都愿意。
A friend does not betray confidences.朋友是不会泄露秘密的
It's illegal to betray government secrets.泄露政府秘密是犯法的。
His accent betrayed the fact that he was foreign.他的口音显露出他是外国人。
The smoke from cooking betrayed the presence of the enemy.炊烟暴露了敌人的存在。

bewilder

[bɪ'wɪldə(r)], [bɪ'wɪldər]


Image Search
vt. 使迷惑； 使 ... 不知所措
cause (someone) to become perplexed and confused.
"she seemed frightened and bewildered"
You bewildered me.你把我搞糊涂了。
Big city traffic bewilders me.大城市的交通使我晕头转向。

biased

['baɪəst], ['baɪəst]


Image Search
adj. 有偏见的
unfairly prejudiced for or against someone or something.
cause to feel or show inclination or prejudice for or against someone or something.
give a bias to.
"we will not tolerate this biased media coverage"
"readers said the paper was biased toward the conservatives"
"bias the ball"
This periodical carries a biased report on China.这本期刊登了一篇对中国有偏见的报道。
The biased comments and propaganda from Canadian media will do no good to any party.加拿大媒体有偏见的评论和宣传对任何政党也没有好处。

bigot

['bɪɡət], ['bɪɡət]


Image Search
n. (宗教、政治等的)盲信者；顽固者
a person who is intolerant toward those holding different opinions.
"don't let a few small-minded bigots destroy the good image of the city"
His words stamped him to be a bigot.他讲的话表明他是个偏执的人。
Pretty soon everyone in his dorm labels him as an intolerant bigot.很快他就被宿舍其他人打上“偏执的盲目信仰者”的标签。
When you try to impose them on others, you make yourself into a self-righteous bigot.当你试图把这些向他人推行时，你让你自身变成了一个伪善的老顽固。

billow

['bɪləʊ], ['bɪloʊ]


Image Search
n. 巨浪；如巨浪翻腾的东西
v. （像巨浪般）汹涌；波动；使翻腾
a large undulating mass of something, typically cloud, smoke, or steam.
a large sea wave.
(of fabric) fill with air and swell outward.
(of smoke, cloud, or steam) move or flow outward with an undulating motion.
"her dress billowed out around her"
"smoke was billowing from the chimney"
The billow of the atlantic dash high on the rock during a storm.暴风雨时，大西洋的巨浪冲撞岩石掀得很高很高。
Billows of flame swept through the forest.熊熊烈火席卷森林。
The wind blew hard and the sea was billowing.疾风劲吹，海浪汹涌。
A door shuts with a bang and curtains billow into the room.房门砰地一声关上了，窗帘被风翻卷着吹向屋内。

blatant

['bleɪtnt], ['bleɪtnt]


Image Search
adj. 明目张胆的；炫耀的；公然的；喧闹的
(of bad behavior) done openly and unashamedly.
completely lacking in subtlety; very obvious.
"blatant lies"
"forcing herself to resist his blatant charm"
I have never encountered such blatant disregard for the Bill of Rights .我从来没有见过这种明目张胆践踏人权法案的现象。
Our teacher is guilty of blatant favouritism.我们老师有明显的偏心错误。
You don't have to be blatant about it.你不必为这事吵吵嚷嚷。

blight

[blaɪt], [blaɪt]


Image Search
n. 枯萎病；导致破坏的因素
v. (使）枯萎；摧毁
a plant disease, especially one caused by fungi such as mildews, rusts, and smuts.
a thing that spoils or damages something.
an ugly, neglected, or rundown condition of an urban area.
infect (plants or a planted area) with blight.
spoil, harm, or destroy.
subject (an urban area) to neglect.
"the vines suffered blight and disease"
"her remorse could be a blight on that happiness"
"the depressing urban blight that lies to the south of the city"
"a peach tree blighted by leaf curl"
"the scandal blighted the careers of several leading politicians"
"plans to establish enterprise zones in blighted areas"
Blight is a disease incident to plants.植物容易患枯萎病。
The apple crop was wiped out by blight.枯萎病使苹果全无收成。
There is a blight on all his efforts.他的一切努力都遭到挫折。
The accident cast a blight on our happiness.那场意外事故使我们的幸福生活蒙上了一层阴影。
Such a blight was fallen over my literary career.我的文学生涯受到极大挫折。
Too much rain may blight the garden with mold.雨水太多会令花园因长真菌而枯萎。
Her life was blighted by ill health.她的一生被疾病所摧残。
Let us heal the world and blight its pain.让我们拯救世界，让伤痛枯萎。
I wish to foster, not to blight; to earn gratitude, not to wring tears of blood.我希望培育，不希望损坏--希望赢得感激，不希望挤出血泪。

blunt

[blʌnt], [blʌnt]


Image Search
adj. 钝的；迟钝的；直率的
v. 使迟钝；变钝
(of a knife, pencil, etc.) having a worn-down edge or point; not sharp.
having a flat or rounded end.
(of a person or remark) uncompromisingly forthright.
a hollowed-out cigar filled with marijuana.
make or become less sharp.
weaken or reduce (something).
"a blunt knife"
"the blunt tip of the leaf"
"he is as blunt as a kick in the shins"
"wood can blunt your ax"
"their determination had been blunted"
Blunt scissors don't cut cleanly.钝剪刀剪不齐。
My pencil is blunt, could you lend me a knife to sharpen it?我的铅笔钝了，你能借我把刀子削一削吗？
It involves systematic yet banal design, and blunt reportage.它使用系统的，然而平庸的设计和迟钝的新闻报道。
He's very blunt and will tell you what he thinks about anything.他的个性非常直率,会把他所想的都说出来。
The opinions of the article are too blunt.文章的观点过于直露。
His mind was blunted by boredom.他的头脑因厌烦而变得迟钝。
You 'll blunt the scissors if you use them to cut cards.用剪刀剪硬纸板,你会把剪刀弄钝的。

bluster

['blʌstə(r)], ['blʌstər]


Image Search
v. 咆哮；(风)狂吹；夸口
n. 狂风声；咆哮；大话
talk in a loud, aggressive, or indignant way with little effect.
(of a storm, wind, or rain) blow or beat fiercely and noisily.
loud, aggressive, or indignant talk with little effect.
"you threaten and bluster, but won't carry it through"
"a winter gale blustered against the sides of the house"
"their threats contained a measure of bluster"
He blustered his way through the crowd.他吆喝着挤过人群。
They blustered about how they would beat us all up.他们威胁说他们要如何痛打我们大家。
The gale blustered all night.大风刮了一夜。
The storm is blustering northeastward across the open Atlantic.风暴正向东北方向移动，吹向广袤的大西洋。
He always tries to bluster his way out of difficult situations.他总是自吹自擂以摆脱困境。
Instead of admitting when we do not know something, we bluff and bluster.我们总不愿意承认我们的无知，而是能吹则吹，能唬则唬。
We could hear the bluster of the wind and rain.我们能听到狂风暴雨的吹打声。
Much of his bluster rose from timidity.他的吵嚷大都是由于怯懦。
I wasn't frightened by what he said, it was just bluster.他说的话吓不倒我——不过是雷声大，雨点小。
He impressed no one by his bluster.他的大话没有给任何人留下印象。

boisterous

['bɔɪstərəs], ['bɔɪstərəs]


Image Search
adj. 喧闹的；狂暴的
(of a person, event, or behavior) noisy, energetic, and cheerful; rowdy.
(of wind, weather, or water) wild or stormy.
"the boisterous conviviality associated with taverns of that period"
"the boisterous wind was lulled"
But a boisterous freedom was in the air.但空气中弥漫着放纵喧闹的气氛。
We can hear their boisterous laughter in the next room.我们可以听到他们在隔壁房间的喧闹的笑声。
The infinite sky is motionless overhead and the restless water is boisterous.头上是静止的无垠的天空,不息的海水狂暴。

bok choy

[ˌbɒk'tʃɔɪ], [ˌbɑːk'tʃɔɪ]


Image Search
Chinese cabbage of a variety with smooth-edged tapering leaves.
Celery, bok choy, and rhubarb look like bones. 芹菜、白菜看起来就像是人的骨头。
Heat some oil, stir-fry bok choy and ginger. 先用少许油起镬，放姜片及白菜入内略炒。
CeleryCelery, Bok Choy, Rhubarb and many more look just like bones. 西芹、白菜、大黄和别的许多东西看起来就象是骨头。
Celery, Bok Choy, Rhubarb and many more look just like bones. 芹菜、青菜、大黄茎和其他很多菜看起来就像骨头。
Celery Bok Choy Rhubarb and more look just like bones. （芹菜、青菜、大黄茎等等看起来很像骨头。
Discard the foam floating on the surface of the soup, add bok choy and cook until done. Add salt to taste and sprinkle with pepper. Remove and serve. 撇掉浮在汤面的泡沫，加入青江菜煮熟，并加盐调味，最后撒下胡椒粉即可盛出食用。

bolster

['bəʊlstə(r)], ['boʊlstər]


Image Search
n. 长枕；靠垫
vt. 支持；鼓励
a long, thick pillow that is placed under other pillows for support.
a part of a vehicle or tool providing structural support.
a short timber cap over a post designed to increase the bearing of the beams it supports.
support or strengthen; prop up.
provide (a seat) with padded support.
"the fall in interest rates is starting to bolster confidence"
"I snuggled down into the heavily bolstered seat"
There is a bolster across the head of the bed.床头上有一个长枕垫。
Both sides offered statistics to bolster their arguments.双方都拿出统计数字来支持他们的论点。
We always bolster up the government in its struggle against terrorism我们始终支持政府的反恐怖主义的斗争。
They bolstered their morale by singing.他们以唱歌来鼓舞士气。
It bolstered my belief.这增强了我的信念。
The woman took some gin to bolster up her courage.那名妇女喝些杜松子酒壮胆。

bombastic

[bɒm'bæstɪk], [bɒm'bæstɪk]


Image Search
adj. 夸大的
high-sounding but with little meaning; inflated.
"bombastic rhetoric"
The orator spoke in a bombastic manner.这位演说家的讲话言过其实。
The candidate spoke in a bombastic way of all that he would do if elected.候选人大肆吹嘘,一旦他当选将要如何如何。
The chairperson of this commission criticised that the police had adoped bombast gestures.该委员会的主度批评了警方采取的高调姿态。

brash

[bræʃ], [bræʃ]


Image Search
adj. 鲁莽的；自以为是的；无礼的；俗气的；易碎的
n. 胃灼热；骤雨；碎石堆
self-assertive in a rude, noisy, or overbearing way.
strong, energetic, or irreverent.
(of a place or thing) having an ostentatious or tasteless appearance.
a mass of fragments, in particular.
loose broken rock or ice.
"he could be brash, cocky, and arrogant"
"I like brash, vibrant flavors"
"the cafe was a brash new building"

His brash answers annoyed the interviewers.他回答问题自以为是，面试的人感到很不痛快。
Don't you think that suit's a bit brash for a funeral?难道你不认为那套衣服对于葬礼而言有点无礼吗？
He was wearing a rather brash tie.他系著一条颇为显眼的领带。

brazen

['breɪzn], ['breɪzn]


Image Search
adj. 厚颜无耻的；明目张胆的；响而刺耳的；黄铜(制)的
v. 厚着脸皮做；使变得无耻；无耻地对待
bold and without shame.
made of brass.
harsh in sound.
endure an embarrassing or difficult situation by behaving with apparent confidence and lack of shame.
"he went about his illegal business with a brazen assurance"
"the music's brazen chords"
It was brazen of him to say so.他这样说真是无耻。
Her toleration of his brazen attitude is enough to show her great tolerance.她容忍了他厚颜无耻的态度,足以显示她的宽容。
They showed a brazen disregard for her privacy.他们明目张胆地无视她的隐私权。
The case of the pesticide plant reflects brazen discrimination.杀虫剂厂的案例反映了一种明目张胆的歧视态度。
He was startled by the brazen notes of the horns.喇叭洪亮的声音把他吓了一跳。
Some people prefer to brazen a thing out rather than admit defeat.有的人不愿承认失败，而是宁肯厚着脸皮干下去。

bream

[briːm], [briːm]


Image Search
n. 鲤科淡水鱼
v. 打扫；清除
a greenish-bronze deep-bodied freshwater fish native to Europe, popular with anglers.
used in names of other fishes resembling or related to this, e.g., sea bream.
clear (a ship or its bottom) of weeds, shells, or other accumulated matter by burning and scraping it.
If my bream comes true, I will have lots of money. 如果我的梦想成真，我将有很多钱。
Steamed sea bream, pay attention to tasty, flavor. 清蒸加吉鱼，讲究鲜美、原味。
Dip sea bream fillets and other ingredients in tempura batter. 把金目鲷鱼柳及其他材料沾上天妇罗粉浆。
Total yields of red sea bream and Ulva lactuca were 55?900g and 358?000g respectively. ind-1,总产量为55 900g; 石莼生长茂密,沥干鲜藻总产量达到358 000g。
A study of the toxication of Cu , Zn , Cd on larval red sea bream and larval blacksea bream was conducted. 研究了Cu、Zn、Cd三种重金属对真鲷幼鱼和黑鲷幼鱼的毒性作用。
Heat oil in wok. Cut each sea bream into half. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. 把镬烧热。金目鲷鱼柳切半，以盐及胡椒调味。

brittle

['brɪtl], ['brɪtl]


Image Search

n. 果仁薄脆糖
hard but liable to break or shatter easily.

a candy made from nuts and set melted sugar.
"her bones became fragile and brittle"
"a brittle laugh"
"her manner was artificially bright and brittle"
"peanut brittle"
The ice is brittle as the thin glass.这些冰像薄的玻璃一样易碎。
The pond was covered in a brittle layer of ice.池塘覆盖了一层易碎的冰。
Constant stress has made our nerves brittle.我们长期处于紧张状态，神经已经吃不消了。
The orchestra was brittle in tone.管弦乐队演奏的曲调尖利刺耳。
Constant stress had made our nerves brittle.持续的紧张让我们的精神很脆弱。
We are not satisfied with his brittle promise.我们对他所做的靠不住的诺言不满意。

broccoli

['brɒkəli], ['brɑːkəli]


Image Search
n. 西兰花；花椰菜；甘蓝花
a cabbage of a variety similar to the cauliflower, bearing heads of green or purplish flower buds. It is widely cultivated as a vegetable.
I ate noodles and broccoli for lunch.我吃面条和西兰花作午餐。
For dinner, he likes chicken and broccoli.正餐他喜欢吃鸡肉和花椰菜。
Divide the broccoli into florets and wash them thoroughly.把花椰菜掰成一块块小花,然后仔细地把它们洗干净。
Would you like another helping of broccoli?再给您盛一些甘蓝好吗?

broccolini


Image Search
布罗科利尼
a vegetable that is a hybrid of broccoli and kale, with small florets on slender stalks.
In a pot filled with 2 inches of water, steam the broccoli or Broccolini until the stems are just tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a platter. 在一锅充满了2升的水，蒸，使青花菜或椰菜直到茎刚变软，4至5分钟。然后放到一个大盘子。
My selection of Char Siu Duck breast was a standout dish, great flavour, great texture in the duck and cooked to perfection simply served with a bunch of broccolini. 我选了叉烧鸭脯，果然出众，鸭肉风味和质地均佳，烹制一流，菜上配有西兰花。

[ˌbrʌslz'spraʊt], [ˌbrʌslz'spraʊt]


Image Search
a vegetable consisting of the small compact bud of a variety of cabbage.
the plant which yields Brussels sprouts, bearing many along a tall single stem.

buff

[bʌf], [bʌf]


Image Search
n. 浅黄色；光身子；爱好者
vt. 抛光；缓冲
a yellowish-beige color.
a stout, dull yellow leather with a velvety surface.
a stick, wheel, or pad used for polishing or smoothing.
polish (something).
give (leather) a velvety finish by removing the surface of the grain.
being in good physical shape with fine muscle tone.
a person who is enthusiastically interested in and very knowledgeable about a particular subject.
"a buff envelope"
"he buffed the glass until it gleamed"
"a computer buff"
The red coat changed for one of blue and buff.红色上衣换成了一件蓝黄色的衣服。
Fine rain wets out her buff hair and tanned clothes.细雨打湿她的暗黄色的头发和深褐色的衣服。
You must not bathe here in the buff.你不能光着身子在这里游泳。
The doctor ordered him to strip and there he stood in nature's buff.医生命令他脱掉衣服，于是他一丝不挂地站在哪儿。
He is a sports buff.他是一个体育运动爱好者。
When I was a student, I was a real movie buff.我当学生的时候是个道地的电影狂。
He buffs his shoes to make them shine.他要把皮鞋擦得铮亮。

bumbling

['bʌmblɪŋ], ['bʌmblɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 常出差错的；笨手笨脚的；装模作样的；妄自尊大的
n. 犯错
动词bumble的现在分词形式.
acting in a confused or ineffectual way; incompetent.
move or act in an awkward or confused manner.
speak in a confused or indistinct way.
(of an insect) buzz or hum.
"he's a bumbling fool"
"they bumbled around the house"
"the succeeding speakers bumbled"
"she watched a bee bumble among the flowers"
The bumbling waiter spilled water on a customer.那位笨手笨脚的服务生把水泼在客人的身上了。
If I were a banker,I would be laughing discreetly at the bumbling efforts of governments to change my behaviour.我要是银行家，肯定会对各国政府为促使我改变行为而采取的装模装样的努力而窃笑不已。
The bumbling of our salesman cost us the account.推销员所犯的错误使我们失去了那位客户。

Otherwise, it will bungle deepens reform, block up economy grows.否则,它将会贻误深化改革,阻碍经济发展。
The whole job was a gigantic bungle.整件工作都糟透了。

buoy

[bɔɪ], [bɔɪ]

an anchored float serving as a navigation mark, to show reefs or other hazards, or for mooring.
keep (someone or something) afloat.
cause to become cheerful or confident.
cause (a price) to rise to or remain at a high level.
mark with a buoy.
"I let the water buoy up my weight"
"the party was buoyed by an election victory"
"the price is buoyed up by investors"
"a buoyed channel"
The can buoy was submerged underwater.罐状浮标没于水下。
At turns, everybody bunches up as close to the buoy as they can.在转弯的地方，大家都尽可能往浮标的地方挤。
A tail buoy is connected to the far end of the cable.电缆的末端与一个尾随浮筒相连。
Take a life buoy with you when you go swimming.下午去游泳的时候把救生圈带上。

candid

['kændɪd], ['kændɪd]


Image Search
adj. 率直的；坦诚的；公正的；偷拍的
truthful and straightforward; frank.
(of a photograph of a person) taken informally, especially without the subject's knowledge.
"his responses were remarkably candid"
His words are always more candied than candid.他话语中阿谀多于诚恳。
To be perfectly candid, I think you acted foolishly.十分坦率地说，我认为你做得很愚蠢。
He is a very candid man and never talks in a roundabout way.他生性坦直，说话办事从来不会拐弯抹角。
He was quite candid about the way the case had been handled.对于这个案子的处理手法他直言不讳。
Give me a candid hearing.请你公正地听我说。
These photographers take candid photos of celebrities by following them to private and public activities.这些摄影师尾随名人前去参加私人和公开的活动，偷拍他们的照片。

candor

['kændə], ['kændə]


Image Search
n. 坦白；直率
the quality of being open and honest in expression; frankness.
"a man of refreshing candor"
Their candor is a very pleasing feature.他们的坦白是很愉快的特征。
He spared no one's feelings and expressed his views with great candor.他在不伤害他人的感情下，把自己的意见表示得很坦白。
He has earned a reputation for candor and integrity.他以直率和正直著称。
Mullen already is on record expressing his war worries with an unusual degree of candor.穆林已经是有史以来以最不寻常的的直率来表达他对战争的担心。

capricious
