The secured area should meet all life safety code egress requirements.受保护区域要满足所有的生命安全法规对出口的要求。

either

['aɪðə(r)], ['iðər]


Image Search
adj. 任一的；两方的
pron. 任一
adv. 也（用于否定句中）
conj. 或者（常用于either...or...的结构中）
used before the first of two (or occasionally more) alternatives that are being specified (the other being introduced by “or”).
used to indicate a similarity or link with a statement just made.
for that matter; moreover (used to add information).
one or the other of two people or things.
each of two.
"either I'll accompany you to your room, or I'll wait here"
"you don't like him, do you? I don't, either"
"I was too tired to go. And I couldn't have paid my way, either"
"there were no children of either marriage"
"the road was straight with fields of grass on either side"
The thief was put in the police car with a policeman on either side of him.窃贼被送到警车上，身旁各坐着一个警察。
You may take either of the roads.两条路你随便走哪一条。
It's not as heavy, either.这也不那么重。
If you do not go, I shall not go either.你不去，我也不去。
I will go on business either this week or next week.我将在这星期或下星期出差。
Either we will find a supply, or we will make the goods.我们或是寻求供货，或者自己制造。

elegant

['elɪɡənt], ['elɪɡənt]


Image Search
adj. 优雅的；雅致的
pleasingly graceful and stylish in appearance or manner.
(of a scientific theory or solution to a problem) pleasingly ingenious and simple.
"she will look elegant in black"
"the grand unified theory is compact and elegant in mathematical terms"
He strolled about, looking very debonair in his elegant new suit.他穿了一身讲究的新衣服逛来逛去，显得颇为惬意。
He proudly promenaded his elegant companion in the park.他得意地领著他那标致的伴侣遛公园。
We all wonder how you always look so young and beautiful and elegant!我们都很想知道,为什么你总是那么优雅年轻。
The lady wears an elegant dark suit.那位女士穿着雅致的深色套装。
I like my clothes to be simple but elegant.我喜欢朴素但漂亮雅致的衣服。

elegy

['elədʒi], ['elədʒi]


Image Search
n. 悲歌；哀歌；挽歌
a poem of serious reflection, typically a lament for the dead.
(in Greek and Roman poetry) a poem written in elegiac couplets, as notably by Catullus and Propertius.
Critics have spent entire books interpreting Gray's "Elegy.批评家们整本整本的书长篇累牍的来诠释格雷的“挽歌”。

elements

['elɪmənts], ['elɪmənts]


Image Search
n. 要素，元素；基本原则；恶劣天气
element的复数形式
a part or aspect of something abstract, especially one that is essential or characteristic.
a small but significant presence of a feeling or abstract quality.
the rudiments of a branch of knowledge.
a group of people of a particular kind within a larger group or organization.
an entity that is a single member of a set.
each of more than one hundred substances that cannot be chemically interconverted or broken down into simpler substances and are primary constituents of matter. Each element is distinguished by its atomic number, i.e., the number of protons in the nuclei of its atoms.
any of the four substances (earth, water, air, and fire) regarded as the fundamental constituents of the world in ancient and medieval philosophy.
one of the four substances (earth, water, air, or fire) considered as a person's or animal's natural environment.
the weather, especially strong winds, heavy rain, and other kinds of bad weather.
(in church use) the bread and wine of the Eucharist.
a part in an electric teapot, heater, or stove that contains a wire through which an electric current is passed to provide heat.
on some electric typewriters, a ball with raised letters that print when the keys are pressed.
"the death had all the elements of a great tabloid story"
"it was the element of danger he loved in flying"
"legal training may include the elements of economics and political science"
"extreme right-wing elements in the army"
"for the islanders, the sea is their kingdom, water their element"
"there was no barrier against the elements"
Water is composed of the elements hydrogen and oxygen.水是由氢元素和氧元素组成的。
What a sensational story! It has all the elements of a soap opera.多麽耸人听闻的事! 具备连续剧的一切要素。
The two elements are synthesized by a chemical process.这两种元素已经化学合成。
These are inactive elements.这些是惰性元素。
Honesty, industry and kindness are elements of a good life.诚实、勤劳和善良是幸福生活的要素。
Battle was joined, shortly after ten o'clock, with advance elements of two enemy divisions.10点钟过后不久，就同敌方两个师的先遣部队接上了火。
If the atoms of all these elements just stayed apart from each other, there be only about105 different things in the world.如果所有这些元素的原子都彼此不组合的话，世界上大约就只有105种不同的东西了。
You must understand the elements of mathematics before we can proceed further.你必须先弄懂数学基础知识，我们才能进一步学习。

eliminate

[ɪ'lɪmɪneɪt], [ɪ'lɪmɪneɪt]


Image Search
v. 除去；剔除；忽略；淘汰
completely remove or get rid of (something).
exclude (someone or something) from consideration.
murder (a rival or political opponent).
exclude (a person or team) from further participation in a sporting competition following defeat or inadequate results.
remove (a variable) from an equation, typically by substituting another that is shown by a different equation to be equivalent.
generate or remove (a simple substance) as a product in the course of a reaction involving larger molecules.
expel (waste matter) from the body.
"a policy that would eliminate inflation"
"the police have eliminated Larry from their inquiries"
"security agents have started a campaign to eliminate some of the government's opponents"
"the Bears were eliminated from the playoffs in the first round"
You must eliminate an unknown quantity.你必须消去一个未知数。
Let us eliminate all uncertain on thought.让我们从思想上消除一切疑惑。
We must eliminate unnecessary steps and get directly to the point.我们必须忽略不必要的步骤,直接切入主题。
Their team was eliminated in the first round.他们队在第一轮就被淘汰了。

elongate

['iːlɒŋɡeɪt], [ɪ'lɔːŋɡeɪt]


Image Search
v. 延长；伸长
adj. 延长了的；细长的
make (something) longer, especially unusually so in relation to its width.
grow longer.
long in relation to width; elongated.
"elongate, fishlike creatures"
We plan to elongate the cooperation with that company in Australia.我们打算延长与澳洲那家公司的合作关系。
Lines will elongate when height is increased.线可随着深度的增加而拉长。
These elongate sand bodies are attached to a bulge of the mainland.这些长条形砂体连接于主陆的突出部位。

eloquent

['eləkwənt], ['eləkwənt]


Image Search
adj. 雄辩的；有口才的；动人的
fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
clearly expressing or indicating something.
"an eloquent speech"
"the touches of fatherliness are eloquent of the real man"
He addressed the audience in an eloquent speech.他向听众发表了雄辩的演说。
Eloquent elephants telephoned other eloquent elephants.雄辩的大象打电话给其他雄辩的大象。
Such an eloquent man will easily talk us down.这样一个有口才的人很容易把我们驳得无话说。
An eloquent speaker is one skilled in the use of words.有口才的人善于用词。
She turned her eloquent eyes upon him.她那双动人的眼睛瞟向他。

elusive

[i'luːsɪv], [i'luːsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 难懂的；难捉摸的；难找的；逃避的
difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
difficult to remember or recall.
"success will become ever more elusive"
"the elusive thought he had had moments before"
Number is a crucial but elusive concept in English teaching and learning.数是英语教学中的一个关键而又难以捉摸的概念。
The Abominable Snowman who haunts the imagination of climbers in the Himalayas is hardly more elusive.常使喜马拉雅山的攀登者浮想联翩的雪人也不比此更难以捉摸。
Men like to pursue an elusive woman, like a cake of wet soap in a bathtub- even men who hate bath.男人们喜欢追逐那些象浴缸里的湿肥皂般难以捉摸的女人，即使是讨厌洗澡的男人也无不如此。
He spent a year prospecting for the elusive metal.他花了一年的功夫去勘探那种很难到手的金属。
Interpol have searched all the corners of the earth for the elusive hijackers.国际刑警组织已在世界各地搜查在逃的飞机劫持者。

embodiment

[ɪm'bɒdimənt], [ɪm'bɑːdimənt]


Image Search
n. 化身；体现
a tangible or visible form of an idea, quality, or feeling.
the representation or expression of something in a tangible or visible form.
"she seemed to be a living embodiment of vitality"
"it was in Germany alone that his hope seemed capable of embodiment"
She's the embodiment of kindness.她是慈祥的化身。
The new factory is the embodiment of the very latest ideas.这座新工厂是那些最新设想的体现。
If there is a French exception, Mr Chirac is its embodiment.如果说，存在一个法国例外，希拉克就是其体现。

embryonic

[ˌembri'ɒnɪk], [ˌembri'ɑːnɪk]


Image Search
adj. 胚胎的；萌芽期的
relating to an embryo.
(of a system, idea, or organization) in a rudimentary stage with potential for further development.
"the plan is still in its embryonic stages"
Embryonic stem cells are totipotent.胚胎干细胞是两性的。
Market economy was in its embryonic stages as early as feudalist society.市场经济，在封建社会时期就有了萌芽。
The plan, as yet, only exists in embryonic form.这个计划迄今为止还只是在酝酿之中。

emphasis

['emfəsɪs], ['emfəsɪs]


Image Search
n. 强调；重点；[语]加强语气
special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
stress laid on a word or words to indicate special meaning or particular importance.
vigor or intensity of expression.
"they placed great emphasis on the individual's freedom"
"he spoke with emphasis and with complete conviction"
They put emphasis on making to quota this quarter.他们强调要达到这一季的配额。
Our English course places great emphasis on conversational skills.我们的英语课程非常重视会话技能。
In recent years, the emphasis has moved away from punishing drug addicts towards helping them.最近几年,重点从惩罚吸毒者转移到救助他们。
You put too much emphasis on the last syllable.你把最后一个音节读得太重。

emphasize

['emfəsaɪz], ['emfəsaɪz]


Image Search
vt. 强调；着重；使突出
give special importance or prominence to (something) in speaking or writing.
lay stress on (a word or phrase) when speaking.
make (something) more clearly defined.
"he jabbed a finger into the tabletop to emphasize his point"
"a one-piece bathing suit that emphasized her build"
He emphasized the importance of careful driving.他强调小心驾驶的重要性。
We cannot emphasize too much the importance of learning English.我们再怎样强调学英文的重要性也不为过。
Which word should I emphasize?我应该重读哪个词?
I would like to emphasize that we are ready to meet the management at any time.我想着重指出，我们愿意在任何时候与管理部门会谈。
Jane's short hair emphasized her cheekbones.简的短发使她的颧骨更突出。

emphatically

[ɪm'fætɪkli], [ɪm'fætɪkli]


Image Search
adv. 断然地；强调地
in a forceful way.
without doubt; clearly.
"Jane, though born in California, feels emphatically Canadian"
He has always emphatically denied the allegations.他一直断然否认这些指控。
'Certainly not,' he replied emphatically.“当然不。”他断然回答道。
The house detective shook his head emphatically.侦探长断然地摇了摇头。
She is emphatically opposed to the proposals.她坚决反对这些建议。
He is emphatically a retiring and unassuming man.他的确是一个与世无争和谦虚纯朴的人。
He states emphatically that he never seems to miss a trick with his staff.他强调他对下属是明察秋毫,无所不知。
It must be emphatically pointed out that these views are wrong.应该着重指出，这些观点是错误的。

employee

[ɪm'plɔɪiː], [ɪm'plɔɪiː]


Image Search
n. 雇员
a person employed for wages or salary, especially at nonexecutive level.
This employee was dismissed for laziness.这名雇员因为懒惰而被解雇。
Their situations are now reversed as employee has become employer.他们双方的地位转换了，雇员成了雇主。
The boss struck off 100 dollars from the salary of the employee as fine.老板从这个雇员的工资里扣除100美元作为罚款。

empower

[ɪm'paʊə(r)], [ɪm'paʊər]


Image Search
vt. 授权；使能够
give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
"nobody was empowered to sign checks on her behalf"
"movements to empower the poor"
The lawyer was empowered to pay all her bills.律师已被授权偿付她的一切帐单。
The new laws empower the police to stop anybody in the street.新法令授予警察可以在街上截停任何人的权利。
The new laws empower the police to search private house.新的法律使警察得以搜查私人住宅。
Modern science and technology empower human beings to control natural forces more effectively.现代科学技术使人类能更有效地制服自然。

emulsion

[ɪ'mʌlʃn], [ɪ'mʌlʃn]


Image Search
n. 乳状液；感光乳剂
a fine dispersion of minute droplets of one liquid in another in which it is not soluble or miscible.
a fine dispersion of one liquid or pureed food substance in another.
a water-based paint used for walls.
a light-sensitive coating for photographic films and plates, containing crystals of a silver compound dispersed in a medium such as gelatin.
"ravioli with pea and ginger emulsion"
After cooling, the emulsion flows into a centrifuge.冷却后，乳状液流入离心分离机。
The device can be considered as a useful tool in study on the emulsion stability.这种显微图像装置在乳状液稳定性研究领城有广阔的应用前景。
You can ask the photographer for some emulsion.你可以找摄影师要点感光乳剂。
Their images were captured on plates of glass on which the photographer had spread an emulsion.影像拍摄在摄影师涂上了感光乳剂的玻璃板上。

encompass

[ɪn'kʌmpəs], [ɪn'kʌmpəs]


Image Search
vt. 围绕；包围；包括；完成
surround and have or hold within.
include comprehensively.
cause (something) to take place.
"a vast halo encompassing the Milky Way galaxy"
"no studies encompass all aspects of medical care"
"an act designed to encompass the death of the king"
The prison is encompassed by high walls.监狱被高墙围绕着。
The voices of people and sounds of cars encompass his path.他在路上听见四面八方都是人声车声。
The general arts at the university encompass a wide range of subjects.大学文科包括的科目非常广泛。

encounter

[ɪn'kaʊntə(r)], [ɪn'kaʊntər]


Image Search
n. 意外的相见；邂逅；遭遇
v. 遭遇；遇到；偶然碰到
unexpectedly experience or be faced with (something difficult or hostile).
meet (someone) unexpectedly.
an unexpected or casual meeting with someone or something.
a confrontation or unpleasant struggle.
"we have encountered one small problem"
"his close encounter with death"
If both participate, it may be an actual encounter of bodiless consciousness.如果是双向的，这会是一个真实的与灵魂的相见。
A fortunate encounter brought us together.一次幸运的邂逅使我们相识。
It was a bloody encounter between the two armies.这是那两军之间的一次激烈的遭遇战。
Don't be afraid to encounter risks.不要害怕遭遇危险。
Otherwise, we will encounter grave difficulties.否则便将遇到极大的困难。
I encountered an old friend at Rome.我在罗马邂逅了一个老朋友。

endanger

[ɪn'deɪndʒə(r)], [ɪn'deɪndʒər]


Image Search
vt. 危及；危害
put (someone or something) at risk or in danger.
"he was driving in a manner likely to endanger life"
It was foolish to endanger your life in that way.用那种方式危及你的生命是愚蠢的。
Development of the area would endanger wildlife.开发这一地区将会危及到野生生物。
Overworking can endanger your health.工作过度可能会危害你的健康。
He did it in the knowledge that it might endanger his life.他做那件事时知道它可能危害他的生命。

endeavor

[ɪn'devə], [ɪn'devər]


Image Search
n. 尽力；努力
v. 尽力；努力；力图
try hard to do or achieve something.
an attempt to achieve a goal.
earnest and industrious effort, especially when sustained over a period of time.
an enterprise or undertaking.
"he is endeavoring to help the Third World"
"an endeavor to reduce serious injury"
"enthusiasm is a vital ingredient in all human endeavor"
"a political endeavor"
Please make every endeavor to be early.请尽量早点儿。
He failed in convincing the buyer despite endeavor.尽管他已经尽力了,还是无法说服买主。
Where there is no hope, there can be no endeavor.哪里没有希望,哪里就不可能有努力。
His success came from endeavor rather than opportunity.他的成功与其说是由于机遇
The man endeavored to please his beloved wife.那人尽量使他深爱的妻子快乐。
You must endeavor to improve your work.你必须努力改进自己的工作。
They endeavor to achieve the goal.他们力图完成目标。

endemic

[en'demɪk], [en'demɪk]


Image Search
adj. 风土的；地方的
n. 地方病；风土病
(of a disease or condition) regularly found among particular people or in a certain area.
denoting an area in which a particular disease is regularly found.
(of a plant or animal) native or restricted to a certain country or area.
an endemic plant or animal.
"areas where malaria is endemic"
"a marsupial endemic to northeastern Australia"
Endemic diseases are common in this area.这个地区地方病流行。
With the efforts for many years, great achievements have been made in the prevention of the endemic diseases.经过多年的努力，地方病防治工作取得了很大成绩。

engage

[ɪn'ɡeɪdʒ], [ɪn'ɡeɪdʒ]


Image Search
v. 雇佣；啮合；与……交战；答应；订婚；预定；参加；从事
occupy, attract, or involve (someone's interest or attention).
cause someone to become involved in (a conversation or discussion).
arrange to employ or hire (someone).
pledge or enter into a contract to do something.
reserve (accommodations, a place, etc.) in advance.
participate or become involved in.
establish a meaningful contact or connection with.
(with reference to a part of a machine or engine) move into position so as to come into operation.
(of fencers or swordsmen) bring (weapons) together preparatory to fighting.
enter into conflict or combat with (an enemy).
(of a writer, artist, or their works) morally committed to a particular aim or cause.
"he plowed on, trying to outline his plans and engage Sutton's attention"
"he was engaged as a trainee copywriter"
"he engaged to pay them $10,000 against a bond"
"he had engaged a small sailboat"
"organizations engage in a variety of activities"
"the teams needed to engage with local communities"
"the clutch will not engage"
The restaurant decide to engage a pop singer.餐馆决定雇用一名流行歌手。
If the big gear did not engage with the small one,the machine would refuse to work.如果大齿轮与小齿轮不相啮合的话，机器就不会工作。
Our orders are to engage (the enemy) immediately.我们的命令是立即(与敌军)开战。
I will engage to manage the business if you will engage to provide the capital.如果你答应出资本，我答应经管这个生意。
Jack and Anne are engaged.杰克和安妮订婚了。
I have engaged a room at this hotel.我已经在这个旅馆里预订了一个房间。
I have no time to engage in the debate.我没时间参加辩论。
Is it wise to engage in active sports at your age?我这样的年纪积极参加体育活动是否明智？
They engage in the study of music.他们从事音乐研究。
Those who engage in mental work are also workers.从事脑力劳动的人也是劳动者。

engulf

[ɪn'ɡʌlf], [ɪn'ɡʌlf]


Image Search
vt. 吞没；席卷；吞噬
(of a natural force) sweep over (something) so as to surround or cover it completely.
eat or swallow (something) whole.
"the cafe was engulfed in flames"
"the toad can engulf nestling birds"
The waves engulfed the boat.大浪吞没了小舟。
The stormy sea engulfed the small motor sailboat.汹涌的大海吞没了那艘小机帆船。
The country was engulfed in civil war.该国陷入内战。
A wave of grief engulfed them.一阵悲伤吞噬了他们。

enigma

[ɪ'nɪɡmə], [ɪ'nɪɡmə]


Image Search
n. 难以理解的事物；谜；谜一般的人
a person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
I've known him for many years, but he remains something of an enigma to me.我与他相识多年，他仍然难以捉摸。
It is an enigma to me.它对我来说是个迷。
It is the enigma of life itself that you desire me to solve.你要我解决的是人生之谜。
Faraway space is an enigma to people.遥远的太空对人类来说是一个谜。
The queer behavior of the child was an enigma, even to its parents.那个孩子古怪的行为，甚至对其父母亲来说都是个谜。
He is an enigma to all of us.对我们而言，他是个神秘莫测的人物。
She never yielded and never became an enigma.她从不屈服，从来没有成为一个不可思议的人。

ensure

[ɪn'ʃʊə(r)], [ɪn'ʃʊr]


Image Search
vt. 担保；保证；使安全；确保
make certain that (something) shall occur or be the case.
make certain of obtaining or providing (something).
make sure that (a problem) shall not occur.
"the client must ensure that accurate records be kept"
"she would ensure him a place in society"
We have worked closely with the Deaf community first, on passage of ADA, and most recently, to ensure that the Act is enforced.我们最近经常在ada路边的聋人社会附近工作，可以担保该法案得到了实施。
I can't ensure that he will be there on time.我不能担保他会及时到那儿。
This medicine will ensure you a good night's sleep.这药保证能让你好好睡一觉。
People should wash regularly to ensure personal hygiene.人们应经常洗澡以保证个人卫生。
The doctors were zealous in their efforts to ensure the survival of premature babies.医生们在努力保证早产婴儿成活方面热情很高。
We must ensure the purity of drinking water.我们必须确保饮用水的纯净。
If you want to ensure that you catch the plane, take a taxi.你要想确保能赶上那班飞机，就坐出租车去吧。

entrust

[ɪn'trʌst], [ɪn'trʌst]


Image Search
vt. 信赖；信托；交托
assign the responsibility for doing something to (someone).
put (something) into someone's care or protection.
"I've been entrusted with the task of getting him safely back"
"you persuade people to entrust their savings to you"
I hope we can entrust each other.我希望我们能彼此相互信任。
I know I can entrust you with my secret.我知道我能把我的秘密告诉你。
I wouldn't advise you to entrust anything of value to him.我劝你不要把任何贵重的东西托付给他看管。
You are a magistrate, and the only person I can entrust this matter to.你是法官，这件事我只信托你一个人。
I entrust my cat to a friend while I am away.我不在家时把猫托给朋友照料。
He's entrusted his children to my care for a day.他托我照看一天孩子。

enumerate

[ɪ'njuːməreɪt], [ɪ'nuːməreɪt]


Image Search
vt. 数；列举；枚举
mention (a number of things) one by one.
establish the number of.
"there is not space to enumerate all his works"
"the 2000 census enumerated 10,493 households in the county"
We found more children at the circus than we could enumerate.我们见到数不清的孩子在看马戏。
Can you enumerate the capitals of the50 states?你能把五十州的首府列举出来吗？
Let me enumerate many flaws in your hypothesis.让我列举你前提中的许多谬误。
Provide the path of the root folder to enumerate.提供要枚举的根文件夹的路径。
An error occurred while trying to enumerate all available policies.试图枚举所有可用的策略时出错。

envy

['envi], ['envi]


Image Search
v. 羡慕；妒忌
n. 羡慕；(妒忌的)对象
a feeling of discontented or resentful longing aroused by someone else's possessions, qualities, or luck.
a person or thing that inspires envy.
desire to have a quality, possession, or other desirable attribute belonging to (someone else).
desire for oneself (something possessed or enjoyed by another).
"she felt a twinge of envy for the people on board"
"their national health service is the envy of many in Europe"
"he envied people who did not have to work on weekends"
"a lifestyle that most of us would envy"
They envy him his good fortune.他们羡慕他的好运气。
I envy her ability to dance in front of a crowd.她在众人面前所展现的的舞技令我羡慕不已。
Don't envy anyone who lives better than you.不要妒忌比你日子过得好的任何人。
He was filled with envy at my success.他对我的成功满怀羡慕。
His new house was the envy of all his friends.他的新居成了所有朋友羡慕的对象。

ephemeral

[ɪ'femərəl], [ɪ'femərəl]


Image Search
adj. 短暂的；朝生暮死的
n. 生存极短时间的事物
lasting for a very short time.
(chiefly of plants) having a very short life cycle.
an ephemeral plant.
"fashions are ephemeral"
Most newspapers are of ephemeral interest.多数报纸只能引起读者短暂的注意。
Slang words are often ephemeral.俚语往往只流行于一时。
Such novels came forward to enjoy ephemeral popularity only.这样的小说只是昙花一现的东西而已。

epic

['epɪk], ['epɪk]


Image Search
n. 史诗；叙事诗
adj. 史诗的；叙事诗的；宏大的；壮丽的
a long poem, typically one derived from ancient oral tradition, narrating the deeds and adventures of heroic or legendary figures or the history of a nation.
the genre of epic poems.
a long film, book, or other work portraying heroic deeds and adventures or covering an extended period of time.
relating to or characteristic of an epic or epics.
heroic or grand in scale or character.
particularly impressive or remarkable.
"the romances display gentler emotions not found in Greek epic"
"a Hollywood biblical epic"
"England's national epic poem Beowulf"
"his epic journey around the world"
"the gig last night was epic"
That movie was an epic about the Roman Empire.那电影是一部有关罗马帝国的史诗般的作品。
The Odyssey is an epic of ancient Greece.《奥德塞》是古希腊的一首史诗。
It is still the beginning of the home epic.它依然是一篇家庭叙事诗的开端。
It is perhaps the best of epic fantasies.这也许是史诗奇幻小说中最好的。
Scott described the making of an epic film.斯科特介绍了这一史诗般影片的制作过程。
It is still the beginning of the home epic.它依然是一篇家庭叙事诗的开端。
These epic processes melted and reprocessed vast amounts of rock and concentrated chemical elements in new ways.在这个宏大的过程中，岩石被融化，再生，以新方式聚集化学元素。

epidermis

[ˌepɪ'dɜːmɪs], [ˌepɪ'dɜːrmɪs]


Image Search
n. 表皮；上皮
the outer layer of cells covering an organism, in particular.
the surface epithelium of the skin of an animal, overlying the dermis.
the outer layer of tissue in a plant, except where it is replaced by periderm.
That part of the epidermis on his hand is damaged.他手上那块表皮受到损伤。
We may say that the epidermis protects the dermis.我们可以说是表皮保护了真皮。
All debris and detached epidermis must be removed.一切碎屑和分离的老皮必须清除。

epitome

[ɪ'pɪtəmi], [ɪ'pɪtəmi]


Image Search
n. 缩影；化身；摘要（古）
a person or thing that is a perfect example of a particular quality or type.
a summary of a written work; an abstract.
a thing representing something else in miniature.
"she looked the epitome of elegance and good taste"
The divisions we see in this school are the epitome of those occurring throughout the whole country.我们在这所学校中看到的各个部门是全国各校的缩影。
The Bund is a symbol of Shanghai and an epitome of Shanghai's modern history.外滩是上海的象征，亦是上海近代史的缩影。
My cat is the epitome of laziness.我的猫是懒惰的化身。
He is the epitome of diligence.他是勤勉的典型。

equity

['ekwəti], ['ekwəti]


Image Search
n. 公平；公正
n. 衡平法；权益；产权；(无固定利息的)股票
the quality of being fair and impartial.
a branch of law that developed alongside common law in order to remedy some of its defects in fairness and justice, formerly administered in special courts.
(in the US, UK, and several other countries) a trade union to which most professional actors belong.
the value of the shares issued by a company.
stocks and shares that carry no fixed interest.
the value of a mortgaged property after deduction of charges against it.
"equity of treatment"
"he owns 62% of the group's equity"
The equity of the referee's decision was accepted by everyone.大家都同意裁判员的公正裁判.
They shared the work of the house with perfect equity.他们很公平地分担屋内的工作。
He seeks after equity all life long.他一生都在追求公正。
The judge has become a model of justice and equity.这位法官已经成了公正正义的楷模。
This became the characteristic idea of classical equity.这成了典型的衡平法所具备的特殊观念。
When the existing laws fail to render a satisfactory judgment, equity applies.当现存的法律不能作出令人满意的判决时衡平法就生效。
The equity of the house needed to be re-valued.这所房子的权益需要进行重新评估。
Thus, owners' equity is equal to the total assets minus the liabilities.因此，所有者权益就等于资产总值减去负债的数额。
Equity theory has a relatively strong following in many countries.产权理论有一相对地强跟随在许多国家。
Property rights reform, decentralization of equity, rational structure.产权改革，使股权分散，结构合理。
Equity fund Money market fund investing in equity stocks.股本基金指投资于股票的货币市场基金。
October was a mixed month for global equity markets.对全球股票市场来说，十月是一个充满变数的月份。

equivalent

[ɪ'kwɪvələnt], [ɪ'kwɪvələnt]


Image Search
adj. 等价的 相等的
n. 相等物
equal in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
having the same or a similar effect as.
belonging to the same equivalence class.
a person or thing that is equal to or corresponds with another in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
the mass of a particular substance that can combine with or displace one gram of hydrogen or eight grams of oxygen, used in expressing combining powers, especially of elements.
"one unit is equivalent to one glass of wine"
"some regulations are equivalent to censorship"
"the French equivalent of the FBI"
Is there a French word that is the exact equivalent of the English word `home'?法语中有没有和英语home完全一样的对应词?

eradicate

[ɪ'rædɪkeɪt], [ɪ'rædɪkeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 根除；根绝；消灭
destroy completely; put an end to.
"this disease has been eradicated from the world"
He eradicated weeds in his garden.他把花园中的杂草根除了。
They attempted to eradicate crime.他们力图根除罪恶。
The disease has now been successfully eradicated from the world.这种疾病已经成功地从世界上根除了。
Smallpox has almost been eradicated.天花几乎已经被消灭了。

erratic

[ɪ'rætɪk], [ɪ'rætɪk]


Image Search
adj. 古怪的；飘忽不定的；不稳定的
not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable.
a rock or boulder that differs from the surrounding rock and is believed to have been brought from a distance by glacial action.
"her breathing was erratic"
He was like a stormy, erratic boy.他好象是个性急的古怪的孩子。
Though occasionally chatty, his moods were erratic.他虽然有时健谈，但是他的脾气却很难捉摸。
An erratic mind jump from one idea to another.心意不定的人反复无常。
They no longer fear the erratic behavior of the market.他们永远不害怕市场飘忽不定的行为。
This clock is rather erratic.这个钟不太准。
Deliveries of goods are erratic.不按规定送货。

escarpment

[ɪ'skɑːpmənt], [ɪ'skɑːrpmənt]


Image Search
n. 长而陡的坡或悬崖
a long, steep slope, especially one at the edge of a plateau or separating areas of land at different heights.
Warm tip: Watch out for escarpment.温馨敬告：坡陡，注意安全。
The fox went to ground under a rocky escarpment.狐狸钻进了石崖下面的洞里。
There was an escarpment about 150 meters to our right.在我们右侧大约150米的地方是一处悬崖。

esoteric

[ˌesə'terɪk], [ˌesə'terɪk]


Image Search
adj. 秘传的；神秘的；难懂的
intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest.
"esoteric philosophical debates"
I asked, but he said he couldn't tell me the recipe because it was esoteric.我问了，但是他说他不能告诉我那药方，因为那是秘传的。
Certain kinds of armor are made according to arcane and esoteric methods that involve weaving magic into the substance of the armor.有一些护甲在制造的过程中用秘传的方法和神秘的技艺将魔法编织在护甲之上。
Like many esoteric pursuits, this has been facilitated by the internet.像好多神秘的追求嗜好一样，互联网也已经为此提供了便利。
There are no esoteric formulas or secret states of mind that produce good designs effortlessly.没有任何奥妙的公式或神秘的心境可毫不费力地提出好的设计方案。
Eventual consistency is not some esoteric property of extreme distributed systems.最终一致性不是那些被过度分布的系统中存在的晦涩难懂的属性。

essential

[ɪ'senʃl], [ɪ'senʃl]


Image Search
adj. 本质的；必要的；重要的
n. 要素；必需品
absolutely necessary; extremely important.
fundamental or central to the nature of something or someone.
(of an amino acid or fatty acid) required for normal growth but not synthesized in the body and therefore necessary in the diet.
(of a disease) with no known external stimulus or cause; idiopathic.
a thing that is absolutely necessary.
the fundamental elements or characteristics of something.
"it is essential to keep up-to-date records"
"the essential weakness of the plaintiff's case"
"essential hypertension"
"we had only the bare essentials in the way of gear"
"he was quick to grasp the essentials of an opponent's argument"
This is of course still the essential method.这当然仍是本质的方法。
This is desirable but by no means essential to the primary objective of validating mathematical models of aircraft behaviour.对于验证飞机性能的数学模型这一主要目的来说，这是必须的，但决不是最本质的.
Concentration is essential if you want to do a good job.如果你想把事情做好,专心是必要的。
Mass education is essential in promoting democracy.民众教育对提倡民主是非常重要的。
What are the essentials of good teaching?成功教学的要素是什么?
The first essential, of course, is to know what you want.第一要素当然是知道自己想要什么。
We only had time to pack a few essentials.我们只来得及装上几件必需品。
A man should never neglect these social essentials.一个人决不该疏忽了这些社交上的必需品。

esteem

[ɪ'stiːm], [ɪ'stiːm]


Image Search
n. 尊敬
vt. 尊敬；认为
respect and admiration, typically for a person.
respect and admire.
consider; deem.
"he was held in high esteem by colleagues"
"many of these qualities are esteemed by managers"
"I should esteem it a favor if you could speak to them"
We all have great esteem for you.我们都非常敬重您。
All his students held him in high esteem.他的学生对他都很尊敬。
No one can esteem you more than I do.没有人会比我更敬重你。
He is esteemed for his courage.他因有勇气而受人尊敬。
We esteem him to be worthy of trust.我们认为他值得信任。
She esteemed that she knew what life was.她认为自己懂得什么是生活。

ethos

['iːθɒs], ['iːθɑːs]


Image Search
n. 民族精神；道德风貌；气质
the characteristic spirit of a culture, era, or community as manifested in its beliefs and aspirations.
"a challenge to the ethos of the 1960s"
We must develop an ethos of cost consciousness.我们必须提高人们在成本意识方面的精神素质。
The day could not be far distant when naturalism would dominate the ethos of American literature.自然主义将支配美国文学风气的时日，已经为期不远。
They cultivated a subversive alternative ethos.他们培育了一种破坏性的交替的民族气质。

euphemism

['juːfəmɪzəm], ['juːfəmɪzəm]


Image Search
n. 委婉语
a mild or indirect word or expression substituted for one considered to be too harsh or blunt when referring to something unpleasant or embarrassing.
"“downsizing” as a euphemism for cuts"
"Pass away" is a euphemism for "die"."过世"是"死"的委婉语。
Euphemism is a very common and complicated linguistic phenomenon.委婉语是一种十分常见而又非常复杂的语言现象。

evacuate

[ɪ'vækjueɪt], [ɪ'vækjueɪt]


Image Search
v. 疏散；撤出；排泄
remove (someone) from a place of danger to a safe place.
leave or cause the occupants to leave (a place of danger).
(of troops) withdraw from (a place).
remove air, water, or other contents from (a container).
empty (the bowels or another bodily organ).
discharge (feces or other matter) from the body.
deprive (something) of contents, value, or force.
"several families were evacuated from their homes"
"fire alarms forced staff to evacuate the building"
"the last American troops evacuated the Canal Zone"
"when it springs a leak, evacuate the pond"
"he evacuated time and history of significance"
There's been a bomb threat we need to evacuate.有人威胁说在这安放了炸弹 我们需要紧急疏散
Please evacuate the building immediately.请立刻自大楼疏散。
The first priority shall be to evacuate the bus.汽车着火后的第一要务是疏散乘客。
All people would evacuate the area.所有人员也都全部撤离这一地区。

evade

[ɪ'veɪd], [ɪ'veɪd]


Image Search
v. 逃避；躲避；规避
escape or avoid, especially by cleverness or trickery.
(of an abstract thing) elude (someone).
avoid giving a direct answer to (a question).
avoid dealing with or accepting; contrive not to do (something morally or legally required).
escape paying (tax or duty), especially by illegitimate presentation of one's finances.
defeat the intention of (a law or rule), especially while complying with its letter.
"friends helped him to evade capture for a time"
"sleep still evaded her"
"he denied evading the question"
"difficulties to be faced and not evaded"
He could not evade the law.他逃避不了法律。
They evade paying taxes by living abroad.他们住在国外以逃避交税。
In order to evade the persecution of fascists, he had to escape abroad.为躲避法西斯的迫害，他不得不流徙到国外。
Give me a direct answer, and stop evade the issue.给我一个直截了当的回答，不要回避这一问题。
The question could not be evaded.那个质问无法规避。

evident

['evɪdənt], ['evɪdənt]


Image Search
adj. 明白的；明显的
plain or obvious; clearly seen or understood.
"she ate the cookies with evident enjoyment"
Now it became evident that he spoke two languages at once.现在我才明白，原来他心里一套表面一套。
Inertia is evident in our every day experiences.惯性在我们日常生活中是很常见的。
The purpose may not be immediately evident.这种目的不一定显而易见。
The rationale for the present study is evident.该研究的理论基础是明显的。
He looks at twelve children with evident pride.他带着明显的得意看着12个儿女。

evince

[ɪ'vɪns], [ɪ'vɪns]


Image Search
v. 表明；表示
reveal the presence of (a quality or feeling).
be evidence of; indicate.
"his letters evince the excitement he felt at undertaking this journey"
"man's inhumanity to man as evinced in the use of torture"
The boy evinces great intelligence.这个男孩表现出很高的智慧。
The intrinsic value of tussle is to evince one's aversion.斗争的本质就是表明自己的厌恶之情。
He evinced great sorrow for what he had done.他对自己的所作所为深表歉疚。
She at last condescended to evince awareness of his proximity.最后她才纡贵屈尊地表示出她注意到他在旁边。

eviscerate

[ɪ'vɪsəreɪt], [ɪ'vɪsəreɪt]


Image Search
v. 取出内脏；除去精华
disembowel (a person or animal).
deprive (something) of its essential content.
remove the contents of (a body organ).
"the goat had been skinned and neatly eviscerated"
"myriad little concessions that would eviscerate the project"
Save your cold blood eviscerate as a finisher. 留着你的冷血剔骨做为最后一击。
Or a Rogue in 2 Hemos and an Eviscerate. 或者是盗贼两个出血一个剔骨就死了。
Lethality will no longer affect the Eviscerate ability. 致命伤不再影响剔骨攻击。
Eviscerate demolition meat, cut into the meat section. 拆肉剔骨，将肉切成条。
Improved Eviscerate (Assassination) now increases damage by 7/14/20%. 强化剔骨现在增加剔骨伤害7/14/20%25。
Eviscerate: Manual of Eviscerate (Rank 9) now drops somewhere in the world. 剔骨：9级剔骨现在可以掉落。

exalt

[ɪɡ'zɔːlt], [ɪɡ'zɔːlt]


Image Search
v. 赞扬；提升；加强
hold (someone or something) in very high regard; think or speak very highly of.
raise to a higher rank or a position of greater power.
make noble in character; dignify.
"the party will continue to exalt its hero"
"this naturally exalts the peasant above his brethren in the same rank of society"
"romanticism liberated the imagination and exalted the emotions"
All the people of whom you and I are the rag-tag and bobtail, all the camp followers of western civilization, we have taken it for granted that even if we did not live up to those exalted ethical standards, we did a great deal better than anyone else.我们所有的人，包括你和我这样的下层平民，以及所有西方文明的依附者都认为，即使我们尚未达到那些崇高的道德标准，我们也还是是比别的任何人都干得好得多。
He was exalted to the position of general manager.他被提升到总经理的职位。

exasperate

[ɪɡ'zæspəreɪt], [ɪɡ'zæspəreɪt]

That child exasperates me.那孩子真让我生气。
She was exasperated at his stupidity.她因为他的愚笨而发怒。
He shouted in an exasperate voice.他以愤怒的声音嚷着。

excavate

['ekskəveɪt], ['ekskəveɪt]


Image Search

make (a hole or channel) by digging.
dig out material from (the ground).

"the ground was largely excavated by hand"

I let him excavate around the mine.我准许他在金矿周围挖掘。
They plan to excavate a large hole.他们计划挖个大洞。
The archaeologists excavated a buried city.考古学家发掘出一个埋在地下的城市。

excel

[ɪk'sel], [ɪk'sel]


Image Search
vt. 优于；超过
vi. 胜出
n. [计] 电子表格（软件名称）
be exceptionally good at or proficient in an activity or subject.
"a sturdy youth who excelled at football"
He excels in painting.他擅长绘画。
His wife excels him in strategical ability.他的妻子在战略上胜过他。
We strive to excel in bringing out our clients vision and style.我们努力在带给我们的客户不同的观念和风格上优于他人。
They each excel in their respective fields.他们在各自领域里都是出类拔萃的。
He excels all other composers of his period.他超过了同时期的所有其他作曲家。
He is working hard to excel his predecessors.他正努力超越他的前任。
He always hopes that his son will excel over him someday.他总是希望他的儿子有天能胜过他.
Excel is widely applied in the vacuum metrology.在真空计量领域中，Excel电子表格软件得到了广泛的应用。
Excel mainly provides electric sheet.Excel提供的主要是电子表格功能。

excerpt

['eksɜːpt], ['eksɜːrpt]


Image Search
n. 摘录
vt. 摘录；引用
a short extract from a film, broadcast, or piece of music or writing.
take (a short extract) from a text.
take an excerpt or excerpts from (a text).
"the notes are excerpted from his forthcoming biography"
This is an excerpt from a novel.这是一部小说的摘录。
I've seen a short excerpt from the film on television.我在电视上看过这部影片的片段。
You can excerpt passages from a book.你可以从一本书中摘录几段。
Can you excerpt something from the newspaper?你能从报纸上选录些东西吗?
You should clarify where the words come from, if you excerpt them.如果写作时引用了他人的话，应当注明出处。

exemplify

[ɪɡ'zemplɪfaɪ], [ɪɡ'zemplɪfaɪ]


Image Search
vt. 例证；示范
be a typical example of.
give an example of; illustrate by giving an example.
make an attested copy of (a document) under an official seal.
"rock bands that best exemplify the spirit of the age"
I will exemplify my point with a story.我会用一个故事举例说明我的观点。
To exemplify this theory,let us examine some species of insect.为举例说明这种理论，我们来检查一些种类的昆虫。
The plays of Wilds exemplify the comedy of manners.王尔德的戏剧是风尚喜剧的典范。
The recent oil price rises exemplify the difficulties which the motor industry is now facing.最近的石油涨价是汽车工业正面临的困难的一个例子。
This painting exemplifies the artist's early style.这幅画是该画家早期艺术风格的典型。

exert

[ɪɡ'zɜːt], [ɪɡ'zɜːrt]


Image Search
vt. 运用；施加
apply or bring to bear (a force, influence, or quality).
make a physical or mental effort.
"the moon exerts a force on the Earth"
"he needs to exert himself to try to find an answer"
He exerted all his influence to make them accept his plan.他用尽一切影响力使他们接受他的计划。
He doesn't have to exert himself on my behalf.他不必为我费那么大力气。
You have to exert more efforts if you want to catch up with your classmates.你要想赶上你的同学的话,就得多花些功夫。
His teachings still exert a strong influence.他的教导仍在产生巨大影响。

exhibit

[ɪɡ'zɪbɪt], [ɪɡ'zɪbɪt]


Image Search
v. 展览；陈列；展示；表现
n. 展品；展览
publicly display (a work of art or item of interest) in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
(of an artist) display one's work to the public in an art gallery or museum.
publicly display the work of (an artist) in an art gallery or museum.
manifest or deliberately display (a quality or a type of behavior).
show as a sign or symptom.
an object or collection of objects on public display in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
an exhibition.
a document or other object produced in a court as evidence.
"only one sculpture was exhibited in the artist's lifetime"
"she was invited to exhibit at several French museums"
"no foreign painters were exhibited"
"he could exhibit a saintlike submissiveness"
"patients with alcoholic liver disease exhibit many biochemical abnormalities"
"the museum is rich in exhibits"
"people flocked to the exhibit in record-breaking numbers"
Many unearthed cultural relics were exhibited at the museum.博物馆展出了许多出土文物。
He was given a whole room to exhibit his paintings.整个房间用来展览他的画作。
She exhibited great powers of endurance during the climb.她在攀登过程中表现出极大的耐力。
They deprecated the new exhibit.他们很不赞成新展品。
The exhibit will be open through February, 2004.展览将一直开放到2004年2月。

exhilarating

[ɪɡ'zɪləreɪtɪŋ], [ɪɡ'zɪləreɪtɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 令人振奋的；令人兴奋的；令人高兴的
making one feel very happy, animated, or elated; thrilling.
make (someone) feel very happy, animated, or elated.
"an exhilarating two-hour rafting experience"
"the children were exhilarated by a sense of purpose"
And it has been an exhilarating and eventful time.这是一个令人激动的并且重要的时间。
I had more exhilarating fun coming back this summer than I had had before.这个夏天的回归我所得到的振奋和乐趣远比以往为多。
Our first parachute jump was an exhilarating experience.我们第一次跳伞感到兴奋莫名。
Jason: The most exhilarating day in my life.杰森：今天是我一生中最最兴奋的日子。
And it's been an exhilarating and eventful time.那是一段令人愉快和波折的时光。”

exile

['eksaɪl], ['ekzaɪl]


Image Search
n. 放逐；流放；被放逐者
vt. 放逐；流放
the state of being barred from one's native country, typically for political or punitive reasons.
a person who lives away from their native country, either from choice or compulsion.
another term for Babylonian Captivity.
expel and bar (someone) from their native country, typically for political or punitive reasons.
"he knew now that he would die in exile"
"the return of political exiles"
"a corrupt dictator who had been exiled from his country"
The king was sent into exile.国王遭到放逐。
He was publicly disgraced and sent into exile.他被当众贬谪，放逐异乡。
Everyone is born king,and most people die in exile.每个人生下来都是王，而大多数人却在放逐中死去。
Exile was for him a living death.他遭流放是进了活地狱。
He had been five years in exile.他过流放生活已经五年了。
He was condemned to lifelong exile.他被判处终身流放。
He returned after 40 years of exile.他流放40年后归来。
He was in the unenviable position of having to choose between imprisonment or exile.他已陷於进退维谷的地步，不是坐牢就是流放，必须在两者间做出抉择。
He has been an exile for ten years.他已经流亡十年。
He was exiled from the country for one year.他被放逐一年。
He was condemned to exile for treason .他因叛国罪被判处流放。

expend

He has expended much time and energy on that experiment.他已经花费许多时间、金钱在那实验上。
The soldiers expended all their ammunition in that fight.士兵在那场战斗中用尽了所有的弹药。
I had expended much time on the work but they told me it's useless.我花了很多时间在这件工作上，他们却告诉我说这是无用的。

[ˌekspə'reɪʃn], [ˌekspə'reɪʃn]

"the expiration of three years"
This Contract shall be terminated on the expiration date.劳动合同期满，即行终止。
A contract subject to a time of expiration is extinguished at such time.附终止期限的合同，自期限届满时失效。
The expiration of contract is coming.合同快到期了。
When is the expiration of your driving license?你的驾驶执照何时到期？
This ticket has passed its expiration date, and so it is now invalid.这张票已过了有效期，现在作废了。

expressly

[ɪk'spresli], [ɪk'spresli]


Image Search
adv. 清楚地；特意地；专门地
explicitly; clearly.
for a specific purpose; solely.
"she was expressly forbidden to use the stove"
"the house was expressly built for entertaining"
I expressly told him I wouldn't go.我清楚地告诉他,我不愿去。
I told you expressly to lock the door.我明白地对你说过要锁上门。
You were expressly told not to touch my papers.已经明确地告诉过你不要动我的文件。
The rule was introduced expressly for this purpose.这项规则是为此特意提出的。
This ship was designed expressly for exploring the Arctic waters.这艘船是为考察北极水域而特意设计的。
Icame expressly to bring it to you.我是专门来给你送东西的。
We came here expressly to see the sunrise.我们到这里来就是为了看日出。
It is an article written expressly for the paper.这是专门为该报而撰写的文章。

An extinct volcano can no longer erupt.一个灭绝的火山已不能再爆发。
My hope of getting some employment was extinct.我要找到工作的希望落空了。

derive (an idea or the evidence for it) from a body of information.
calculate (a root of a number).
a short passage taken from a piece of writing, music, or film.
a preparation containing the active ingredient of a substance in concentrated form.
"the decayed tooth will have to be extracted"

"lead was extracted from the copper"
"the table is extracted from the report"

He tried to extract his pole from the mud.他试图用力将杆子从泥中拔出来。

Bratti means to extract the utmost possible amount of pleasure.布拉蒂决计从生活里榨出尽可能多的快乐来。
I would like to quote two extracts from the book.我很想引用这本书的两段文字。
The following extract is taken from her new novel.下面一段摘自她的新小说。

Moisture dry skin with natural ingredients, apricot kemel oil and dewberry extract.含黑莓和杏仁天然萃取精华。

The explosion accident caused several fatalities.爆炸事故使数人死亡。
There was a strange fatality about their both losing their jobs on the same day.他们两人同一天失去工作，真是天意叵测。
The most serious form of skin cancer has a 30% fatality rate.皮肤癌的最严重情况有30%25的致死率。

fatigue

[fə'tiːɡ], [fə'tiːɡ]


Image Search

v. （使）疲劳

extreme tiredness, typically resulting from mental or physical exertion or illness.
a reduction in the efficiency of a muscle or organ after prolonged activity.
weakness in materials, especially metal, caused by repeated variations of stress.
a lessening in one's response to or enthusiasm for something, typically as a result of overexposure to it.
a group of soldiers ordered to perform menial, nonmilitary tasks, sometimes as a punishment.
loose-fitting clothing, typically khaki, olive drab, or camouflaged, worn by soldiers.
cause (someone) to feel tired or exhausted.
reduce the efficiency of (a muscle or organ) by prolonged activity.
weaken (a material, especially metal) by repeated variations of stress.
"he was nearly dead with fatigue"
"metal fatigue"
"museum fatigue"
"battle fatigues"
"they were fatigued by their journey"

He was beaten out with fatigue when he got home.他回到家里时已是疲惫不堪。
Who is on fatigue duty today?今天谁担任杂役?
The patient fatigues easily.病人容易疲劳。
The exercises fatigued her.操练使她感到很疲乏。
They were shedding their fatigue.身上疲劳的感觉渐渐都消失了。
His body was in rebellion against fatigue.他的身体正在发出疲劳的信号。

People may feign incapability to fraudulently claim the benefits, thus depriving the really needy.人可能假装无能欺诈索赔的好处，从而剥夺了真正有需要的。

To feign frankness is a ruse of war.装作坦白，是为了作战的目的。

fertile

['fɜːtaɪl], ['fɜːrtl]


Image Search
adj. 肥沃的；富饶的；能繁殖的；多产的；（创造力）丰富的
(of soil or land) producing or capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops.
(of a seed or egg) capable of becoming a new individual.
(of a person, animal, or plant) able to conceive young or produce seed.
(of a person's mind or imagination) producing many new and inventive ideas with ease.
(of a situation or subject) fruitful and productive in generating new ideas.
(of nuclear material) able to become fissile by the capture of neutrons.
"fields along the fertile flood plains of the river"
"Barbara carefully calculated the period when she was most fertile"
"a series of fertile debates within the social sciences"
There are fertile fields in the Nile Delta.尼罗河三角洲土地肥沃。
We have irrigated the desert area to make it fertile.我们已经灌溉了荒芜地区使它肥沃。
It was a pleasant fertile spot, well wooded and rich in pasture.那是一个富饶的，使人愉快的地方，材木苍然，牧草丰富。
This fertile land bears the hopes of the farmers.这块富饶的土地,孕育着庄稼人的希望！
Tilapia are very fertile, and reproduce several offspring every year.罗非鱼一年能够繁殖数代,生殖能力很强。
The rotation of crops keeps the soil healthy and fertile.谷物轮种使土壤保持了肥力和高质。
His paper was remarkably simple and fertile.他的评论异常简单而且内容丰富。

['fɪkl], ['fɪkl]

It's the third time that he changed his mind; he's so fickle!他改变主意已经是第三回了,他这人太反复无常了！

He turned out to be fickle - he has left me.他原来是个善变的人 - 他离开我了。

fidelity

"he sought only the strictest fidelity to justice"
"the 1949 recording provides reasonable fidelity"
Waley was much more interested in readability than fidelity.韦利在翻译该书时更加关注译文的可读性，而非忠实程度。
His fidelity and industry brought him speedy promotion.他的忠于职守和勤于工作使他得到迅速晋级。
She praised his servant for his fidelity.她称赞他仆人的忠诚。
They betokened their fidelity to the leader with a vow.他们以宣誓来表示他们对领袖的忠诚。
History is more full of examples of the fidelity of dog than of friend.历史上狗儿忠诚的事例较诸朋友忠诚的事例多得多。
To achieve the requirement of high fidelity listen respectfully, rated power should be pressed according to sound of optimal listen respectfully will decide.为了达到高保真聆听的要求,额定功率应根据最佳聆听声压来确定。

flaccid

['flæsɪd], ['flæsɪd]


Image Search

"she took his flaccid hand in hers"
"the flaccid leadership campaign was causing concern"

His breathing was hoarse, his face livid, his limbs flaccid, his belly prominent.他的呼吸声沙哑，脸色苍白，双腿无力，肚子鼓胀。

flange

[flændʒ], [flændʒ]


Image Search
n. 凸缘；边缘；轮缘；【机械】法兰（使管子与管子及和阀门相互连接的零件，连接于管端）
v. 装凸缘
a projecting flat rim, collar, or rib on an object, serving to strengthen or attach or (on a wheel) to maintain position on a rail.
"the flanges that held the tailpipe to the aircraft"
Every lens has a mounting flange with which it is attached to the camera body.每个透镜都有一个安装凸缘，依靠它才能把透镜安装到相机上。
The bottom flange and the diaphragms must be selected carefully to match the product.为与产品匹配，需仔细选择底部边缘和隔膜。
Tnis measure method supplies reliable data for security analysis and designing installed flange of steam turbine' s vane.此项技术可为汽轮机叶片安装轮缘的设计和安全性分析提供可靠依据。

flatter

['flætə(r)], ['flætər]


Image Search
v. 奉承；恭维；取悦；显得好看
lavish insincere praise and compliments upon (someone), especially to further one's own interests.
give an unrealistically favorable impression of.
make (someone) feel honored and pleased.
make oneself feel pleased by believing something favorable about oneself, typically something that is unfounded.
(of a color or a style of clothing) make (someone) appear more attractive or to the best advantage.
please (the ear or eye).
smooth and even; without marked lumps or indentations.
(of land) without hills.
(of an expanse of water) calm and without waves.
not sloping.
having a broad level surface but little height or depth; shallow.
(of the foot) having an arch that is lower than usual.
(of shoes) without heels or with very low heels.
lacking interest or emotion; dull and lifeless.
(of a person) without energy; dispirited.
(of a market, prices, etc.) showing little activity; sluggish.
(of a sparkling drink) having lost its effervescence.
(of something kept inflated, especially a tire) having lost some or all of its air, typically because of a puncture.
(of a color) uniform.
(of a photographic print or negative) lacking contrast.
(of paint) without gloss; matte.
(of a fee, wage, or price) the same in all cases, not varying with changed conditions or in particular cases.
(of a denial, contradiction, or refusal) completely definite and firm; absolute.
(of musical sound) below true or normal pitch.
(of a note) a semitone lower than a specified note.
(of a key) having a flat or flats in the signature.
relating to flat racing.
"she was flattering him to avoid doing what he wanted"
"the portraitist flatters his sitter to the detriment of his art"
"I was very flattered to be given the commission"
"I flatter myself I'm the best dressed man here"
"the muted fuchsia shade flattered her pale skin"
"the beauty of the stone flattered the young clergyman's eyes"
"a flat wall"
"thirty-five acres of flat countryside"
"the flat roof of a garage"
"a flat rectangular box"
"“I'm sorry,” he said, in a flat voice"
"his sense of intoxication wore off until he felt flat and weary"
"cash flow was flat at $214 million"
"flat champagne"
"you've got a flat tire"
"the dress was a deadly, flat shade of gray"
"a $30 flat fare"
"his statement was a flat denial that he had misbehaved"
"the double basses' opening low E-flat"
"the Flat season"
My boss likes it when we flatter him.我的老板喜欢我们奉承他。
Friends who flatter you to your face are not true friends.凡是当面奉承你的朋友不是真朋友。
He flattered her about her cooking.他恭维她的烹调手艺。
It's impossible for you to ask a girl to teach you how to flatter another.你不可能让一个女孩教你如何取悦另一个女孩。
This photograph flatters you.这照片比你本人漂亮。
The picture certainly doesn't flatter her.这张照片当然不及她本人好看。

fledgling

['fledʒlɪŋ], ['fledʒlɪŋ]


Image Search
n. 刚会飞的幼鸟；尚缺乏经验的人
adj. 刚开始的；无经验的
=fledgeling.
a young bird that has just fledged.
a person or organization that is immature, inexperienced, or underdeveloped.
"the fledgling democracies of eastern Europe"
The pressure on the fledgling entrepreneur is intense.这个没有经验的企业家压力很大。
China's fledgling gold market is still evolving.中国的初期黄金市场仍在发展中。
The fledgling man always offends his boss.这个没经验的人总是顶撞他的老板。

fleeting

['fliːtɪŋ], ['fliːtɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 短暂的；疾驰的
动词fleet的现在分词形式.
lasting for a very short time.
move or pass quickly.
pass (time) rapidly.
fade away; be transitory.
"hoping to get a fleeting glimpse of a whale underwater"
"a variety of expressions fleeted across his face"
"the cares of boyhood fleet away"
He made only a fleeting reference to his resignation.他只提了一下他辞职的事。
The prime of life is that fleeting time between green and overripe.人生盛年是处于青涩和过孰之间的短暂时光。
They fired at a fleeting enemy.他们向正在逃跑的敌人开火。

flimsy

['flɪmzi], ['flɪmzi]


Image Search
adj. 轻而薄得；易坏的；不足信的
n. 复写纸；薄纸副本
comparatively light and insubstantial; easily damaged.
(of clothing) light and thin.
(of a pretext or account) weak and unconvincing.
a document, especially a copy, made on very thin paper.
very thin paper.
"voyagers who crossed the sea in flimsy boats"
"I wore flimsy clothes and needed warming"
"a pretty flimsy excuse"
"credit-card flimsies"
"sheets of yellow flimsy"
She wore a flimsy dress.她穿一件薄连衣裙。
It is a flimsy cardboard box.那是一个不结实的纸箱。
The evidence against him was flimsy.指控他的证据不足信。
A close inspection of this argument would reveal how flimsy it is.仔细想想这个问题就会发现它其实毫无根据。

flotsam

['flɒtsəm], ['flɑːtsəm]


Image Search
n. (遇难船的)漂流货物；不值钱的零碎物；无业游民
the wreckage of a ship or its cargo found floating on or washed up by the sea.
people or things that have been rejected and are regarded as worthless.
"the room was cleared of boxes and other flotsam"
After the storm, the sea was covered with flotsam and jetsam.暴风雨后，海上漂浮着遇难船只的残骸和货物。
The beaches are wide and filled with interesting flotsam and jetsam.海滩宽阔，到处是有趣的被冲上岸的零碎什物。

flourish

['flʌrɪʃ], ['flɜːrɪʃ]


Image Search
v. 茂盛；繁荣；挥舞；活跃
n. 挥舞；花样；炫耀；华丽词藻
(of a person, animal, or other living organism) grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way, especially as the result of a particularly favorable environment.
develop rapidly and successfully.
(of a person) be working or at the height of one's career during a specified period.
(of a person) wave (something) around to attract the attention of others.
a bold or extravagant gesture or action, made especially to attract the attention of others.
an instance of suddenly performing or developing in an impressively successful way.
an elaborate rhetorical or literary expression.
an ornamental flowing curve in handwriting or scrollwork.
a fanfare played by brass instruments.
an ornate musical passage.
an improvised addition played especially at the beginning or end of a composition.
"wild plants flourish on the banks of the lake"
"the organization has continued to flourish"
"the caricaturist and wit who flourished in the early years of this century"
"“Happy New Year!” he yelled, flourishing a bottle of whiskey"
"with a flourish, she ushered them inside"
"the Bulldogs produced a late second-half flourish"
"spiky gothic letters with an emphatic flourish beneath them"
"a flourish of trumpets"
There were two or three palm trees flourishing in the promenade garden.街心花园里有两三棵枝繁叶茂的棕榈树。
Plants will not flourish without water.没有水植物就不会长得茂盛。
These plants flourish in a damp climate.这些植物在潮湿的气候下长势茂盛。
Our business seemed to flourish.我们在生意看上去很兴隆。
No new business can flourish in the present economic climate.在目前的经济气候中，任何新生意都兴旺不起来。
She rushed in flourishing a document.她急匆匆地走了进来，手里挥舞着一份文件。
The banner flourished in the wind.旗帜在空中飞舞
Chaucer flourished at the end of 14th century.乔叟在14世纪末享有盛名。
In Germany the baroque style of art flourished in the 17th and 18th centuries.在德国，巴罗克艺术风格在17和18世纪非常盛行。
She rode by with a flourish of her whip.她骑马挥鞭而过。
He opened the door for her with a flourish.他潇洒地为她打开了门。
He went away with a flourish of his hat.他挥帽而去。
He underlined his signature with a little flourish.他挥笔在签名下画了一条线。
He showed us his new design with much flourish.他炫耀地向我们展示他的新设计。
The doctor showed us about his hospital with much flourish.这位医生颇为炫耀地带着我们参观了他的医院。
His is a cut-and-thrust style without any flourish.他的文章风格犀利明快，没有任何华丽的词藻。
Her speech was full of flourish.她的演讲充满了华丽的词藻。

fluctuate

['flʌktʃueɪt], ['flʌktʃueɪt]


Image Search
vi. 波动；动摇；起伏
vt. 使动摇
rise and fall irregularly in number or amount.
"trade with other countries tends to fluctuate from year to year"
Fruit prices fluctuate with the seasons.水果价格随着季节波动。
Some investors panic when stock prices fluctuate wildly.当股票价格大幅波动时,一些投资者便开始恐慌起来。
While the psychological unbalance may fluctuate the individual's original philosophy and regular act tendency which make conditions for the naissance of aberrance.而心理的失衡极大地动摇了个体原有的人生观和行为定势 ,为越轨行为的产生创造了条件。
Both the light and radio outputs fluctuate markedly.光和无线电的输出都引人注目地起伏变化。

fluent

['fluːənt], ['fluːənt]


Image Search
adj. 流利的；流畅的
(of a person) able to express oneself easily and articulately.
(of a person) able to speak or write a particular foreign language easily and accurately.
(of a foreign language) spoken accurately and with facility.
(of speech, language, movement, or style) smoothly graceful and easy.
able to flow freely; fluid.
"a fluent speaker and writer on technical subjects"
"she became fluent in French and German"
"he spoke fluent Spanish"
"his style of play was fast and fluent"
"a fluent discharge from the nose"
She speaks fluent and idiomatic French.她说得一口又流利又地道的法语。
She likes him all the better for his fluent spoken English.正因为他操一口流利的英语，她更爱他。
His work is rather fluent and felicitous.他的作品十分流畅，措辞巧妙。
Her fluent movements surprised us.她那协调优美的动作让我们惊奇。

foe

[fəʊ], [foʊ]


Image Search
n. 敌人；仇敌
an enemy or opponent.
Friends of the Earth.
"join forces against the common foe"
The knight was murdered by his foes.那位骑士被他的敌人谋杀了。
A courageous foe is better than a cowardly friend.勇敢的敌人胜过懦怯的朋友。
She was unsure as yet whether he was friend or foe.她还不确定他究竟是敌是友。
They were all humbled by kobe who is their foe.视他为仇敌的对手在他面前依旧得低头。
Blood of the enemy forcibly taken, you will resurrect your foe.强行夺取的仇人之血，将使你的仇敌复活！

foil

[fɔɪl], [fɔɪl]


Image Search
n. 钝头剑；箔；陪衬物；（击剑运动用的）花剑
vt. 挫败；击退；阻挠
prevent (something considered wrong or undesirable) from succeeding.
frustrate the efforts or plans of.
(of a hunted animal) run over or cross (ground or a scent or track) in such a way as to confuse the hounds.
the track or scent of a hunted animal.
a setback in an enterprise; a defeat.
metal hammered or rolled into a thin flexible sheet, used chiefly for covering or wrapping food.
a person or thing that contrasts with and so emphasizes and enhances the qualities of another.
a thin leaf of metal placed under a precious stone to increase its brilliance.
a leaf-shaped curve formed by the cusping of an arch or circle, typically occurring in groups of three or more in Gothic tracery.
a light fencing sword without cutting edges but with a button on its point.
each of the winglike structures fitted to a hydrofoil's hull to lift it clear of the water at speed.
"a brave policewoman foiled the armed robbery"
"Errol Flynn was a dashing Mountie foiling Nazi agents in Canada"
"aluminum foil"
"the earthy taste of grilled vegetables is a perfect foil for the tart bite of creamy goat cheese"
The foil is a thrusting weapon with no cutting edge.花剑，没有劈杀用的剑刀，是刺戳用兵器。
Our foil packets seal the flavour in.我们用锡纸包装以保持原味。
Aluminum foil can be used for wrapping food.铝箔用于包装食物。
This box of chocolate was wrapped round with foil.这盒巧克力用箔纸包着。
In the play, a wicked old uncle acts as a foil to the noble young prince.在剧中,邪恶年老的叔父为高尚年轻的王子扮演陪衬者的角色。
In foil and saber,only the attacking fencer can score a point.在花剑和佩剑比赛中，只有进攻方才能得分。
Only confident, people will never foil.只要有信心，人永远不会挫败。
Mr. Wang foiled their plans of inventing a new machine.王先生否决了他们关于发明新机器的计划。

foolhardy

['fuːlhɑːdi], ['fuːlhɑːrdi]

recklessly bold or rash.
"it would be foolhardy to go into the scheme without support"

The foolhardy Zaarin even had the audacity to strike against the Emperor himself.有勇无谋的扎林甚至厚脸皮到了反击帝国的地步。

foray

['fɒreɪ], ['fɔːreɪ]


Image Search

n. 突袭；尝试
a sudden attack or incursion into enemy territory, especially to obtain something; a raid.

make or go on a foray.
"the garrison made a foray against Richard's camp"
"my first foray into journalism"
"the place into which they were forbidden to foray"
They forayed into enemy territory.他们对敌军领土进行了突袭。
The officer sent a few of his men on a foray.军官送了一些他的人去突袭。
This is the company's first foray into the computer market.这是该公司打入计算机市场的首次尝试。

forego


Image Search
v. 放弃；在……之前
=forgo.
variant spelling of forgo.
precede in place or time.
omit or decline to take (something pleasant or valuable); go without.
refrain from.
"she wanted to forgo the dessert and leave while they could"
"we forgo any comparison between the two men"
Mickey agreed to forego his holiday.米基同意放弃他的假期。
Here, three Santas forego their sleighs in favor of an underground commute.这里，三个圣诞老人放弃了他们的雪橇而选择地铁。
Schumacher elected to forego a break and to test for two days in Vallelunga last week, which was chosen because it is quite similar in character to Imola.舒马赫选择了在比赛之前休息，并在上周的瓦莱伦加赛道进行了为期两天的测试。做出如此选择的原因是那里和伊莫拉非常相似。

foreseen

[fɔː'siːn], [fɔː'siːn]

动词foresee的过去分词.
be aware of beforehand; predict.
"we did not foresee any difficulties"
It appears not all is as you had foreseen.似乎不是所有都按照你们预知的。

forge

[fɔːdʒ], [fɔːrdʒ]


Image Search
vt. 锻造；伪造；建立
vi. 伪造；做铁匠
n. 锻炉；铁匠铺；锻造车间
make or shape (a metal object) by heating it in a fire or furnace and beating or hammering it.
create (a relationship or new conditions).
produce a copy or imitation of (a document, signature, banknote, or work or art) for the purpose of deception.
a blacksmith's workshop; a smithy.
a furnace or hearth for melting or refining metal.
a workshop or factory containing a furnace for refining metal.
move forward gradually or steadily.
"the two women forged a close bond"
"he forged through the crowded side streets"
These machine parts have been forged with the finest steel.这些机器零件得用优质的钢锻造。
George was forced to forge a signature.乔治被迫伪造签名。
They forged their manager's signature on the cheque.他们在支票上伪造了经理的签名。
They tried to forge an alliance.他们试图建立同盟。
Some people forge official documents.有些人伪造公文。
Donald be forced to forge a signature.唐纳德被迫伪造签字。
He began to heat, like iron in the forge.他象锻炉里的铁一样热起来。
The blacksmith came out of the forge to fit the horse shoe.铁匠从工场出来安装马蹄铁。
In the past kitchen knives were made in a forge.过去厨房用刀是在锻造厂打出来的。

formulate

['fɔːmjuleɪt], ['fɔːrmjuleɪt]


Image Search
v. 用公式表示；系统地阐述；规划；制订
create or devise methodically (a strategy or a proposal).
express (an idea) in a concise or systematic way.
"economists and statisticians were needed to help formulate economic policy"
"the argument is sufficiently clear that it can be formulated mathematically"
Survey the material first to get a sense of it: formulate some questions.考查原始材料首先要了解它的意义：用公式解答问题。
He formulated his thought clearly.他清楚确切地表达了自己的思想。
He struggled to formulate an answer.他努力字斟句酌地回答。
He thought it time to formulate some plan of action.他认为这是该筹划一些行动计划的时候了。
We can then formulate the following rules.我们可以作出下列规定。

forsake

[fə'seɪk], [fər'seɪk]


Image Search
v. 放弃；断念；抛弃
abandon (someone or something).
renounce or give up (something valued or pleasant).
"he would never forsake Tara"
"I won't forsake my vegetarian principles"
Because he chose to forsake eternal life for knowledge.因为他为了选择知识而放弃了永生。
Forsake your greed, abandon your appetites of ostentation.除去你的贪心，放弃你所炫耀的爱好。
Forsake learning, and you will ruin yourself.抛弃了学问便是毁了你们自己。
She pleaded with her husband not to forsake her.她恳求丈夫不要抛弃她。

fortification

[ˌfɔːtɪfɪ'keɪʃn], [ˌfɔːrtɪfɪ'keɪʃn]
