He likes to glean the bamboo telegraph.他喜欢收集小道消息。

glint

[ɡlɪnt], [ɡlɪnt]


Image Search
n. 闪烁
v. 闪耀；闪闪发光
give out or reflect small flashes of light.
(of a person's eyes) shine with a particular emotion.
a small flash of light, especially as reflected from a shiny surface.
a brightness in someone's eyes seen as a sign of enthusiasm or a particular emotion.
"her glasses were glinting in the firelight"
"his eyes glinted angrily"
"the glint of gold in his teeth"
"she saw the glint of excitement in his eyes"
There was a glint of humor in his eyes.他的眼里闪出幽默的神情。
He had a wicked glint in his eyes.他眼睛里闪着坏坏的神色。
With inward dismay I noted his eyes glint with interest.我内心惊愕地注意到他的眼神中闪烁着充满兴趣的光芒。
The gold was glinting in the sunlight.金子在阳光下闪闪发光。

gloat

[ɡləʊt], [ɡloʊt]


Image Search
v. 满足地看；沾沾自喜；幸灾乐祸
contemplate or dwell on one's own success or another's misfortune with smugness or malignant pleasure.
an act of gloating.
"his enemies gloated over his death"
Chinese leaders have another reason not to gloat over the KMT's victory.中国领导人亦有其他理由不去满足国民党的选举胜利。
Stop gloating just because you won the game!别因为赢了就扬扬得意！
A friend is someone to gloat with during the good times.朋友是你得意时和你分享快乐的人.
It's nothing to gloat about.没有什麽可幸灾乐祸的。
I will not gloat over my enemies' predicatment before killing them.当我的敌人陷入困境，在我杀了他们之前，我不会幸灾乐祸.

global

['ɡləʊbl], ['ɡloʊbl]


Image Search
adj. 全球性的；总的；球状的
relating to the whole world; worldwide.
relating to or embracing the whole of something, or of a group of things.
operating or applying through the whole of a file, program, etc.
"the downturn in the global economy"
"some students may prefer to be given a global picture of what is involved in the task"
"global searches"
The green campaign is a global phenomenon.绿色运动是全球性的现象。
Air pollution is a global problem.空气污染是全球性的问题。
The shortage of water has become a global problem.水能短缺已经是全球性的问题了。
We have the responsibility to keep the global strategic balance and stability.我们有义务维持全球战略的平衡肯稳定。
The global output of the factory has increased these days.今日来,这个工厂的总产量已经提高了。

glum

[ɡlʌm], [ɡlʌm]


Image Search
adj. 闷闷不乐的；阴郁的；阴沉的
n. 闷闷不乐；忧郁
looking or feeling dejected; morose.
"they looked glum but later cheered up"
Don't look so glum!别那样闷闷不乐。
Faced with all this, no wonder Americans are glum.世道艰难，无怪乎美国人民要闷闷不乐了。
When the opposition scores, he looks glum.当对手进球的时候，他一脸忧郁。
The doctor had assured him it was nothing serious, but he was looking very glum.医生说不要紧，但莱蒙的脸色很阴沉。
He was a charming mixture of glum and glee.他是一个很有魅力的人，时而忧伤时而欢笑。

gory

['ɡɔːri], ['ɡɔːri]


Image Search
adj. 血淋淋的；血腥的
involving or showing violence and bloodshed.
covered in blood.
"a gory horror film"
I shuddered when I heard the gory details.我听到血淋淋的详情,战栗不已。
A gory knife had been found close to the murdered man,据传闻，人们在死人的附近发现了一把带血的刀，
The newspaper account of the accident gave all the gory details.报纸上报道了这次事故中所有骇人听闻的细节。
He was busy inventing a gory horror story to frighten all the girls.他正在忙着编一个血淋淋的恐怖故事来吓唬女孩们。

graceful

['ɡreɪsfl], ['ɡreɪsfl]


Image Search
adj. 优雅的；得体的
having or showing grace or elegance.
"she was a tall girl, slender and graceful"
Her every movement is very graceful.她的一举一动都很优美。
We admired the graceful poise of the dancer.我们很欣赏那位舞蹈演员的优美舞姿。
His refusal was worded in such a graceful way that we could not be offended.他的拒绝是那样委婉得体，所以我们并未感到不快。
He made a graceful speech accepting the award.他作了一个得体的获奖演说。
Her apology was so graceful that we forgave her.她的道歉很得体, 我们只好原谅了她。

granary

['ɡrænəri], ['ɡrænəri]


Image Search
n. 谷仓；谷物仓；谷产丰富的地区
a storehouse for threshed grain.
a region producing large quantities of corn.
That remote barren land has blossomed into rich granaries.过去的穷乡僻壤变成了富饶的谷仓。
But now they have been adapted for use as storehouses or granaries.不过现在它们已经被改建，用作库房或粮仓了。
The Northeast is the granary of the country.东北是祖国的粮仓。
The Midwest is often called the granary of the US.美国中西部地区常被喻为美国的粮仓。

grapefruit

['ɡreɪpfruːt], ['ɡreɪpfruːt]


Image Search
n. 葡萄柚；葡萄柚树
a large, round, yellow citrus fruit with an acid, juicy pulp.
the tree bearing the grapefruit.
This grapefruit is not very juicy.这个葡萄柚汁不多。
I have an orange and a grapefruit.我有一个橙子和一个葡萄柚。
Through grafting, the grapefruit tree is another plant that depends on grafting to reproduce.通过嫁接，葡萄柚树是另外一种通过嫁接生殖的植物。

gratified

['ɡrætɪfaɪ], ['ɡrætɪfaɪ]


Image Search
v. 使满足；使高兴
give (someone) pleasure or satisfaction.
indulge or satisfy (a desire).
"I was gratified to see the coverage in May's issue"
"not all the sexual impulses can be gratified"
Now that she has a job in France she can gratify her desire to see Europe.既然现在她在法国工作，那就可以满足她游览欧洲的愿望了。
I was gratified to see how much my birthday present was appreciated.看到我的生日礼物受到极大的赞赏，我感到高兴。

grievances

[ɡ'riːvnsɪz], [ɡ'riːvnsɪz]


Image Search
n. 委屈，冤情；苦状
grievance的复数形式
a real or imagined wrong or other cause for complaint or protest, especially unfair treatment.
an official statement of a complaint over something believed to be wrong or unfair.
a feeling of resentment over something believed to be wrong or unfair.
"failure to redress genuine grievances"
"three pilots have filed grievances against the company"
"he was nursing a grievance"

grieve

[ɡriːv], [ɡriːv]


Image Search
vt. 使伤心；使悲伤
vi. 悲伤；伤心
suffer grief.
feel grief for or because of.
cause great distress to (someone).
"she grieved for her father"
"she did not have the opportunity to grieve her mother's death"
"what grieves you, my son?"
It grieves me to see him in such bad health.看见他的健康状况如此不佳，我很伤心。
It grieves me to hear how disobedient you've been.听说你很不听话，使我感到非常难过。
She was grieving for the dead baby.她为死去的孩子悲伤。
It's no use grieving about past errors.为过去的错误懊悔不已是无济于事的。
I grieve very much for what I have done.我为自己的行为感到痛心。

grit

[ɡrɪt], [ɡrɪt]


Image Search
n. 砂砾；粗砂石；勇气；决心
vt. 覆以砂砾；咬紧牙关
vi. 发出刺耳声
small, loose particles of stone or sand.
(with numeral) indicating the grade of fineness of an abrasive.
a coarse sandstone.
courage and resolve; strength of character.
clench (the teeth), especially in order to keep one's resolve when faced with an unpleasant or painful duty.
move with or make a grating sound.
"she had a bit of grit in her eye"
"220-grit paper"
"layers of impervious shales and grits"
"he displayed the true grit of the navy pilot"
"Congress must grit its teeth and take action"
"fine red dust that gritted between the teeth"
Grit is spread on roads to make them less slippery in icy weather.在结冰的天气，在路上撒上砂砾心免路面太滑。
Because all the gears are enclosed within the hub, road grit can't get inside to abrade the metal parts.因为所有的齿轮都套在轮毂内，路面上的砂石不会跑进齿轮之间磨损金属部件。
The soldiers showed that they had plenty of grit.士兵们表现得很有勇气。
Mountaineering in a blizzard needs a lot of grit.在暴风雪中登山需要极大的勇气和毅力。
I have had a front row seat to his candidacy, and I have seen his strength and determination, his grace and his grit.对他的候选人资格我有最直观的感受，我见到他的力量与决心，他的优雅风度与勇气。
My answer showed that I had the drive and grit to serve Goldman Sachs faithfully - at least for the length of the two-year dogsbody analyst program.我的回答显示出，我有忠诚服务于高盛的勇气和决心，至少能在两年辛苦的分析师项目期间如此。
You have to grit your teeth and work hard.你一定要咬紧牙关，努力工作。
Mr Jones called me incompetent but, as he was the boss, I had to grit my teeth and accept it.琼斯先生说我无能，不过因为他是我的老板，所以我只得咬紧牙关认了。

gross

[ɡrəʊs], [ɡroʊs]


Image Search
adj. 总的；粗鲁的；公然的；荒唐的；令人讨厌的
n. 总量；总额
vt. 总共赚得
adv. 总共地
(especially of wrongdoing) very obvious and unacceptable; blatant.
(of income, profit, or interest) without deduction of tax or other contributions; total.
(of weight) including all contents, fittings, wrappings, or other variable items; overall.
(of a score in golf) as actually played, without taking handicap into account.
very rude or coarse; vulgar.
unattractively large or bloated.
very unpleasant; repulsive.
general or large-scale; not fine or detailed.
without tax or other contributions having been deducted.
produce or earn (an amount of money) as gross profit or income.
an amount equal to twelve dozen; 144.
a gross profit or income.
"gross human rights abuses"
"the gross amount of the gift was $1,000"
"a projected gross takeoff weight of 500,000 pounds"
"the duties we felt called upon to perform toward our inferiors were only gross, material ones"
"I feel fat, gross—even my legs feel flabby"
"it's disgusting and gross, but it's a fact"
"at the gross anatomical level"
"the film went on to gross $8 million in the U.S"
"fifty-five gross of tins of processed milk"
"the box-office grosses mounted"
The gross national product had increased 5 percent last year.去年的国民生产总值提高了百分之五。
You can tell from his gross language that the man was uneducated.从他那粗俗的语言可以看出，这个人没受过教育。
They were accused of gross negligence.他们因公然渎职而被指控。
That is a gross distortion of the truth.这是对真相的荒唐歪曲。
His gross words and behaviors always irritate his classmates.他的言行很令人讨厌,总是会使他的同学大为光火。
The goods are to be sold by the gross.这些货物是要趸批出售的。
The gross of his income last year was $60,000.去年他的总收入为六万美元。
The new movie grossed an estimated $36.4 million at the box office.这部新电影总共收获了3640万美元的票房成绩。
He earned $60,000 gross.他总共赚了6万美元。

grotto

['ɡrɒtəʊ], ['ɡrɑːtoʊ]


Image Search
n. 洞穴；岩穴
a small picturesque cave, especially an artificial one in a park or garden.
an indoor structure resembling a cave.
Currently the grotto is not accessible.一般来说洞穴是不可进入。
We reached a beautiful grotto, whose entrance was almost hid by the vines.我们到达了一个美丽的洞穴,洞的进口几乎被藤蔓遮掩著。
The cry proceeded from the grotto.那声音是从地洞那面传过来的。
Here is the most eye-catching Binglingsi Grotto.这里最引人注目的就是炳灵寺石窟。

groundless

['ɡraʊndləs], ['ɡraʊndləs]


Image Search
adj. 无根据的
not based on any good reason.
"your fears are quite groundless"
Facts have proved these worries groundless.事实证明，这些忧虑是没有根据的。
She maintains that the accusation is groundless.她坚持该指控是毫无根据的。
These groundless words can never convince anyone.这些没有根据的话，不能服人。

grubby

['ɡrʌbi], ['ɡrʌbi]


Image Search
adj. 生蛆的；肮脏的；污秽的；卑鄙的
dirty; grimy.
disreputable; sordid.
"the grubby face of a young boy"
"grubby little moneylenders"
I always feel grubby in the morning.我在早上总是觉得脏兮兮的。
His shirt was clean but his shoes were grubby.虽然他的衬衣很干净，但是鞋子却很脏。
Those grubby urchins ran to me and asked for candy.那群邋遢的小淘气们向我跑过来要糖果。
Their grubby success will make business look dirtier still.但他们肮脏的发迹仍然会让商业看着更肮脏些。
Prostitution may be a grubby business, but it's not the government's concern.卖淫也许是个污秽的行当，但却不关政府的事。

gullible

['ɡʌləbl], ['ɡʌləbl]


Image Search
adj. 易受骗的；轻信的
easily persuaded to believe something; credulous.
"an attempt to persuade a gullible public to spend their money"
Bill's so gullible that you could sell him anything.比尔非常容易上当，你骗他什么他都相信。
He must have been pretty gullible to fall for that old trick.他准是有点儿傻，才落入那惯用的圈套。
We 're so gullible as to believe him.我们真愚蠢，竟然相信了他。
Being gullible and belittling others should both be avoided.轻信别人的话跟轻看别人都是不好 的。

guttural

['ɡʌtərəl], ['ɡʌtərəl]


Image Search
adj. 喉咙的；咽喉的；喉音的
n. 〈语言学〉软腭音
v. 使发喉音
(of a speech sound) produced in the throat; harsh-sounding.
(of a manner of speech) characterized by the use of guttural sounds.
a guttural consonant (e.g., k, g ) or other speech sound.
"his parents' guttural central European accent"
Cordelia imitated his guttural tones.科迪莉娅模仿了他那奇怪的腔调。
"It is a great pitty," began Jeremy in a low guttural voice.“真是不幸得很,”杰里米用他那重浊的喉音说。
It is rough, it is guttural and it is even humorous.它意思简约，用喉咙发音，甚至还很幽默。
The glottal stop and uvular "r" and "ch" in German "bach" are guttural sounds.德语词“bach”中的声门塞音、小舌音“r”和 “ch”都是喉音。

haphazard

[hæp'hæzəd], [hæp'hæzərd]


Image Search
adj. 偶然的；随意的；杂乱无章的
adv. 杂乱地；任意地
n. 偶然
lacking any obvious principle of organization.
"the kitchen drawers contained a haphazard collection of silver souvenir spoons"
Meetings occurred in a somewhat haphazard fashion.会见是以多少有点偶然的方式进行的。
I don't like the haphazard way he does things.我不喜欢他随意的办事方式。
Why did you put the volumes of the encyclopedia in haphazard order?你为何把这套百科全书放得杂乱无章?
It is just a thing done at haphazard.这只是件偶然为之的事情。

hardship

['hɑːdʃɪp], ['hɑːrdʃɪp]


Image Search
n. 艰难；困苦
severe suffering or privation.
"intolerable levels of hardship"
We are ready to face any hardship.我们准备好了面对任何艰难。
He will not shrink from any hardship.他不会因任何艰难而畏缩。
A strong man will bear hardship without complaining.一个坚强的人会忍受困苦而不抱怨。
His health broke after years of hardship.多年的困苦生活使他的身体垮了。

hasten

['heɪsn], ['heɪsn]


Image Search
v. 催促；赶快；加速
be quick to do something.
move or travel hurriedly.
cause (something) to happen sooner than it otherwise would.
"he hastened to refute the assertion"
"we hastened back to Paris"
"a move that could hasten peace talks"
Please hasten them to send the sample.请催促他们寄来样品。
Do not hasten to bid me adieu.不要告别得那样匆忙。
She hastened home after hearing the news.听到这个消息后，她匆匆忙忙地回家。
Let me hasten to say that I could never do such a thing!让我赶快说我永远不能做这样的事情！
Fascism served only to hasten its destruction.法西斯主义只是加速了它的毁灭。
An electric typewriter would hasten the work .电动打字机会加速这项工作。

haughty

['hɔːti], ['hɔːti]


Image Search
adj. 傲慢的；自大的；骄傲的
arrogantly superior and disdainful.
"a look of haughty disdain"
It is hard for a haughty man to swallow his words.要一个傲慢的人认错是很困难的。
The nobles treated the common people with haughty contempt.王公贵族以不屑一顾的傲慢态度对待平民百姓。

hazard

['hæzəd], ['hæzərd]


Image Search
n. 危险；冒险；危害
vt. 冒险；赌运气
阿扎尔（英超切尔西队球员）
a danger or risk.
a potential source of danger.
a permanent feature of a golf course that presents an obstruction to playing a shot, such as a bunker or stream.
chance; probability.
a gambling game using two dice, in which the chances are complicated by arbitrary rules.
venture to say (something).
put (something) at risk of being lost.
"the hazards of smoking"
"a health hazard"
"he hazarded a guess"
"the cargo business is too risky to hazard money on"
The car had its hazard warning lights on.这辆汽车亮起了危险信号灯。
He had put his own life in hazard.他是在拿自己的生命来冒险。
There are many serious health hazards associated with smoking.许多危害健康的情况都与吸烟有关。
He hazarded all his money in the attempt to save the business.他为挽救这家企业，不惜冒险投入他的全部金钱。
I'll hazard a dollar on the bingo game.我在这局宾果游戏上赌一元钱。

hazardous

['hæzədəs], ['hæzərdəs]


Image Search
adj. 危险的；冒险的；碰运气的
risky; dangerous.
"we work in hazardous conditions"
Everybody said that it was a hazardous investment.大家都说那是一次危险的投资。
Dry-cleaners deal with many hazardous chemicals.干洗工要跟很多危险的化学品打交道。
Nothing rewarded the hazardous experiment.这个冒险的举动没有引起任何反应。
In this area arable farming is a hazardous practice.在这个地区，可耕种的作物完全是碰运气的。

headstrong

['hedstrɒŋ], ['hedstrɔːŋ]


Image Search
adj. 顽固的；刚愎的；任性的
self-willed and obstinate.
"I am headstrong and like getting my own way"
Mrs. Ferrars is a very headstrong, proud woman.费拉尔斯太太是个非常顽固、傲慢的妇人。
The headstrong impetuous man rushed into things without forethought.这个顽固的莽汉，不预先考虑，仓促行事。
She's hopelessly headstrong; she always gets up against people in authority.她刚愎自用到了不可挽救的地步，老是与主管人员发生冲突。
We cannot tolerate his headstrong actions.我们不能容忍他的任性行为。
You have no idea how headstrong she can be.你不知道她会多么任性。

hectic

['hektɪk], ['hektɪk]


Image Search
adj. 忙乱的；兴奋的；[医]发热的；发红的
full of incessant or frantic activity.
relating to, affected by, or denoting a regularly recurrent fever typically accompanying tuberculosis, with flushed cheeks and hot, dry skin.
a hectic fever or flush.
"a hectic business schedule"
I had a hectic day in the office.我在办公室里忙乱了一天。
It can be a hectic life on a 24-hour news channel.24小时新闻频道的生活可能非常忙乱。
The journalist leads a hectic life.新闻记者过着紧张兴奋的生活。
Hectic phobophobia can be cured.赤面恐怖症是可以治疗的。
There is hectic flush on her cheeks.她的双颊出现痨病性潮红。

heron

['herən], ['herən]


Image Search
n. 苍鹭
a large fish-eating wading bird with long legs, a long S-shaped neck, and a long pointed bill.
The heron flapped slowly off across the lake.那白鹭振翅向湖对岸慢慢飞去。
Just then he saw a heron passing by.就在那时，他看见一只苍鹭经过。
A grey heron makes its way to the reed.一只灰色的苍鹭制造着它到芦苇从中的路。

hesitate

['hezɪteɪt], ['hezɪteɪt]


Image Search
vi. 犹豫；不情愿；口吃
pause before saying or doing something, especially through uncertainty.
be reluctant to do something.
"she hesitated, unsure of what to say"
"he hesitated to spoil the mood by being inquisitive"
Do not hesitate to tell us if you have a problem .你有问题就直截了当地告诉我们。
I would hesitate to get involved in this adventure.我犹豫是否参加这次探险。
She hesitated to hurt the child's feelings.她不想伤害孩子的感情。
I hesitate to spend so much money on clothes.我舍不得把这麽多钱花在穿衣服上.
Embarrassment caused the speaker to hesitate.困窘使演讲人话语吞吐。

hideous

['hɪdiəs], ['hɪdiəs]


Image Search
adj. 丑陋的；可怕的；可憎的；令人惊骇的
ugly or disgusting to look at.
extremely unpleasant.
"his smile made him look more hideous than ever"
"the whole hideous story"
They wear hideous clothes to cover their mostly monstrous bodies.他们穿着丑陋的衣服以便掩盖畸形的身躯。
As punishment, she transformed him into a hideous beast and placed a spell on everyone in the castle.为了惩罚王子，她把王子变成了一头丑陋的野兽，还对城堡里的每个人都施了魔法。
The hideous tale made the children cry.那个可怕的故事把孩子们吓哭了。
I had walked straight into a hideous trap.我一下子踏进了一个可怕的陷阱里。

hinder

['hɪndə(r)], ['hɪndər]


Image Search
v. 阻碍；打扰
adj. 后面的
create difficulties for (someone or something), resulting in delay or obstruction.
(especially of a bodily part) rear; hind.
"various family stalemates were hindering communication"
"the hinder end of its body"
The crowd hindered him from leaving.人群使他无法脱身。
Heavy snow hindered the construction work.大雪妨碍了这项建筑工程的进行。
Don't let me hinder you from going.别让我妨碍了你走。
Don't hinder me.不要妨碍我。
Help out, don't hinder.帮帮忙，不要碍事。
I won't hinder you since you are busy.既然你很忙,我就不打扰你了。
Don't hinder me when I am trying to work.我要工作的时候别打扰我。
The hinder leg of this horse was broken.这匹马的后腿断了。

hoard

[hɔːd], [hɔːrd]


Image Search
n. 贮藏
v. 贮藏；储存
a stock or store of money or valued objects, typically one that is secret or carefully guarded.
an ancient store of coins or other valuable artifacts.
an amassed store of useful information or facts, retained for future use.
amass (money or valued objects) and hide or store away.
reserve in the mind for future use.
"he came back to rescue his little hoard of gold"
"a hoard of Romano-British bronzes"
"a hoard of secret information about his work"
"thousands of antiques hoarded by a compulsive collector"
"a year's worth of hoarded resentments and grudges"
The squirrel kept his hoard in a tree.这只松鼠把吃的东西藏在树里。
His final card remains on my bulletin hoard today.父亲最后给我的那张卡片至今仍留在我的记事板上。
They dug up a hoard of Roman coins.他们挖出了一批埋藏的古罗马硬币。
A large number of animals hoard plant seeds.许多动物有贮藏植物种子的行为。
Money is not something to hoard.金钱不是用来贮藏得东西。
We should hoard more winter vegetables like cabbages.像白菜这种冬令蔬菜还是要多储存一些。
Not surprisingly, some governments choose to hoard aid rather than spend it.一些政府选择将援助储存起来而不是花销出去也就毫不奇怪了。

homely

['həʊmli], ['hoʊmli]


Image Search
adj. 家常的；平凡的；相貌平庸的；简单且好的
(of a person) unattractive in appearance.
(of a place or surroundings) simple but cozy and comfortable, as in one's own home.
unsophisticated and unpretentious.
"a modern hotel with a homely atmosphere"
"homely pleasures"
We had a homely meal of bread and cheese.我们吃了一顿面包加乳酪的家常便餐。
That in those homely sayings was couched the collective wisdom of generations.那些朴实的话语表达了一代又一代人的集体智慧。
I was very disappointed to see her sister; she was a homely girl.我看到她的妹妹很失望,她是一个相貌平平的女孩。
This hotel is a homely and comfortable establishment.这家旅馆亲切而舒适。

hump

[hʌmp], [hʌmp]


Image Search
n. 驼背；圆形隆起物；土墩；肿块；碰撞；恼火
v. 使隆起；碰撞；敲击成圆丘形；弓起
a rounded protuberance found on the back of a camel or other animal or as an abnormality on a person's back.
a rounded raised mass of earth or land.
a mound over which railroad vehicles are pushed so as to run by gravity to the required place in a switchyard.
lift or carry (a heavy object) with difficulty.
move heavily and awkwardly.
make hump-shaped.
have sexual intercourse with.
"he continued to hump cases up and down the hotel corridor"
"it was late morning by the time I finally humped into camp"
"the cat humped himself into a different shape and purred"
So does he have a hump and a hairpiece?他既驼背又带假发？
That gives me the hump.那使我心烦。
I've got the hump over what he said to me.我已经对他所说的很不耐烦了。
A cat often humps its back.猫常弓起背部。

hypocrite

['hɪpəkrɪt], ['hɪpəkrɪt]


Image Search
n. 伪君子；伪善者
a person who indulges in hypocrisy.
According to thinking he is a hypocrite.据认为他是一个伪君子。
A hypocrite is an actor, one who puts on a false face.一个伪善者就像一个演员，戴着假的面具而已。
The moral hypocrite, by contrast, has convinced himself that he is acting virtuously even when he does something he would condemn in others.道德伪善者却不同，他们总是严于律人，宽于律己，认为自己的行为最合乎道德标准。

idolize

['aɪdəlaɪz], ['aɪdəlaɪz]


Image Search
v. 把 ... 当偶像崇拜； 极度爱慕
admire, revere, or love greatly or excessively.
"he idolized his mother"
He is an only child, and the idol of his parents. 他是个独子，是他父母的宠儿。
The pop singer is the idol of young people. 这位流行歌手成为年轻人崇拜的偶像。
The youngsters greeted their idol with a hail. 那群年轻人向他们的偶像欢呼致敬。
The baby boy was the idol of his family. 这小男孩是他家的宠儿。
As an only child he was the idol of his parents. 他是独生子，是父母的宠儿。
An image of a female supernatural being; an idol. 女性偶象一超自然的女性偶象; 偶象

ignoble

[ɪɡ'nəʊbl], [ɪɡ'noʊbl]


Image Search
adj. 平民的；卑贱的；卑鄙的；不光彩的
not honorable in character or purpose.
of humble origin or social status.
"ignoble feelings of intense jealousy"
"ignoble savages"
Some very great men have come from ignoble families.有些伟人出身低微。
He is an ignoble man.他是一个卑鄙的小人。
He has achieved whatever work it was in him to do, the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.完成了他份内要做的所有工作，怕死就有点儿卑鄙和不光彩了。

ignorance

['ɪɡnərəns], ['ɪɡnərəns]


Image Search
n. 无知；愚昧
lack of knowledge or information.
"he acted in ignorance of basic procedures"
He tried to veil his contempt at my ignorance.他试图掩饰对我的无知的蔑视。
I guess ignorance must be a sin.我认为无知是一种罪。
I regret my ignorance on the subject.我对自己对这个课题的无知感到遗憾。
Knowledge makes humble; ignorance makes proud.[谚]知识使人谦虚，无知使人骄傲。
It is not good to trade on another's ignorance.利用他人的无知是不应该的。
Poverty and ignorance are the enemies of progress.贫穷和愚昧是进步的敌人。

illicit

[ɪ'lɪsɪt], [ɪ'lɪsɪt]


Image Search
adj. 非法的；违禁的；不正当的
forbidden by law, rules, or custom.
"illicit drugs"
The police chief was talking about the illicit sale of drugs.警长在讲毒品的非法贩卖。
Illicit trades should be outlawed.非法交易应被取缔。
He makes a lot of money by traffic illicit merchandise.他做违禁商品买卖赚了许多钱。
He had an illicit association with Jane.他和简曾有过不正当关系。

illuminate

[ɪ'luːmɪneɪt], [ɪ'luːmɪneɪt]


Image Search
vt. 照明；阐释；说明
light up.
decorate (a building or structure) with lights for a special occasion.
decorate (a page or initial letter in a manuscript) with gold, silver, or colored designs.
help to clarify or explain (a subject or matter).
"a flash of lightning illuminated the house"
"a most illuminating discussion"
plastic food
A sudden smile illuminated her face.突然的微笑使她容光焕发。
Footnotes illuminate the difficult passage of the book.脚注中解释了书中许多难懂的道理。
Our interesting teacher could illuminate almost any subject we studied.我们这位有趣的老师几乎能解释清楚我们所学的所有科目。
This article mostly illuminate the importance of brand innovation.本文章主要说明品牌创新的重要作用。

illusion

[ɪ'luːʒn], [ɪ'luːʒn]


Image Search
n. 错觉；幻觉；错误的信仰(或观念)
a thing that is or is likely to be wrongly perceived or interpreted by the senses.
a deceptive appearance or impression.
a false idea or belief.
"the illusion makes parallel lines seem to diverge by placing them on a zigzag-striped background"
"the illusion of family togetherness"
"he had no illusions about the trouble she was in"
Mirrors in a room often give an illusion of space.房间里的镜子常给人一种空间增大的错觉。
A mirage is an optical illusion.海市蜃楼是一种视错觉。
I thought I saw a ghost but it was just an optical illusion.我以为我看见鬼了，其实只是一种幻觉。
This creates an illusion of variety.这造成了一种多样化的幻觉。
It is an illusion to think that all wisdom is contained in books.以为学问知识尽在书中的看法是错误的。

illustrate

['ɪləstreɪt], ['ɪləstreɪt]


Image Search
vt. 说明；（为书）作插图；图解
vi. 举例说明；发亮
provide (a book, newspaper, etc.) with pictures.
explain or make (something) clear by using examples, charts, pictures, etc.
serve as an example of.
"the guide is illustrated with full-color photographs"
"the results are illustrated in Figure 7"
"a collection of pieces that illustrate Bach's techniques"
He pointed at the diagram to illustrate his point.他指着图表来说明他的论点。
In this section, I'll illustrate some of these differences.在这一节,我将举例说明一些不同之处。
Our textbook is very well illustrated.我们的课本插图丰富。
This chart is used to illustrate all the changes.这张图片用来解释所有的变化。
We can illustrate our data with the column chart.我们可以用柱状图解释数据。

imagery

['ɪmɪdʒəri], ['ɪmɪdʒəri]


Image Search
n. 意象；肖像；图像；比喻
visually descriptive or figurative language, especially in a literary work.
visual images collectively.
visual symbolism.
"Tennyson uses imagery to create a lyrical emotion"
"the impact of computer-generated imagery on contemporary art"
"the film's religious imagery"
Advertising agencies sometimes use religious imagery to sell products.广告公司有事用宗教意象来推销产品。
Trust uses fragments of rich sensual imagery and sound to weave a portrait of intimacy and emotion.相信使用碎片的富有肉体上形象化的描述和声音的编造肖像的亲密和情感的。
Hao Liang, from Chongqing, blends his technical virtuosity in Chinese ink with a macabre vision that intermingles Song Dynasty portraiture with Tudor and Elizabethan imagery.来自重庆的郝量，将精湛的传统国画水墨技巧与宋代肖像绘画和都铎与伊丽莎白时期的绘画技巧混合在一起，带给观者令人惊奇的视觉感受。
Satellite imagery indicated that dust from the Sahara is spreading westward.卫星图像显示撒哈拉的沙尘正在向北延伸。
The author's imagery mystifies me.作者的比喻令我迷惑。

immaculate

[ɪ'mækjələt], [ɪ'mækjələt]


Image Search
adj. 洁白的；无瑕疵的；无过失的
(especially of a person or their clothes) perfectly clean, neat, or tidy.
free from flaws or mistakes; perfect.
(in the Roman Catholic Church) free from sin.
uniformly colored without spots or other marks.
"an immaculate white suit"
"an immaculate safety record"
He wore an immaculate uniform for the date.他穿着整洁的制服去约会。
No matter how many guests were present, the great house was always immaculate.不论有多少宾客，这幢大房子总是显得异常洁净。
It's an immaculate performance.那是一场完美的演出。
Timing and technique were immaculate.时间选择和方法都是非常完美的。
She was immaculate of history.她的一生白壁无瑕。

immense

[ɪ'mens], [ɪ'mens]


Image Search
adj. 巨大的；广大的；<口>非常好的
extremely large or great, especially in scale or degree.
"the cost of restoration has been immense"
They plunged into their work with immense zeal.他们以极大的热情投入工作。
Her contributions to the state have been immense.她对国家的贡献极大。
It's almost impossible to find him in the immense ocean.在无边无际的海洋中要找到他几乎是不可能的。
It were the new comers who had cultivated the immense wilderness.初来此地的人开辟了这片广袤的荒野。

immerse

[ɪ'mɜːs], [ɪ'mɜːrs]


Image Search
vt. 浸；陷入
dip or submerge in a liquid.
baptize (someone) by immersion in water.
involve oneself deeply in a particular activity or interest.
"immerse the paper in water for twenty minutes"
"she immersed herself in her work"
I immerse my clothes in the water.我把衣服浸在水里。
Please immerse the plant in water for a few minutes.把那棵植物在水里浸泡几分钟。
He immersed himself totally in his work.他埋头于工作。
I immerse myself into reciting English vocabulary.我专心于背英语词汇。
These professors always immerse themselves in their subjects.这些教授一直埋头于研究他们的课题。

immobile

[ɪ'məʊbaɪl], [ɪ'moʊbl]


Image Search
adj. 不动的；不能活动的；不变的；静止的
not moving; motionless.
incapable of moving or being moved.
"she sat immobile for a long time"
"an immobile workforce"
The deer stood immobile among the trees.那只鹿一动不动地站在树丛里。
His illness has left him completely immobile.他的病使他完全丧失了活动能力。
It remained immobile in the centre of each screen.它保持在各个屏幕的中央。

impact

['ɪmpækt], ['ɪmpækt]


Image Search
n. 影响；冲击力；撞击
vt. 挤入；压紧；撞击；对 ... 发生影响
vi. 冲击；撞击；产生影响
the action of one object coming forcibly into contact with another.
the effect or influence of one person, thing, or action, on another.
come into forcible contact with another object.
come into forcible contact with.
press firmly.
have a strong effect on someone or something.
"there was the sound of a third impact"
"our regional measures have had a significant impact on unemployment"
"the shell impacted twenty yards away"
"an asteroid impacted the earth some 60 million years ago"
"the animals' feet do not impact and damage the soil as cows' hooves do"
"high interest rates have impacted on retail spending"
Seasonality or economic cycles will have minimal impact on secular trends.季节性或经济周期两者对长期趋势的影响都不大。
But what these people fail to see is that international tourism may bring about a disastrous impact on our environment and local history.但是这些人忽视了国际旅游可能会给当地环境和历史造成的灾难性的影响。
The impact of the crash hurtled the driver against the windshield of the car.碰撞的震力使驾驶员猛撞于车子的挡风玻璃上。
The impact of the stone against the windowpane shattered the glass.石头撞击窗户打碎了玻璃。
A vast crowd impacted the square.广场上挤集了一大群人。
There is a special tool to impact the road when it is under construction so the base is solid.有种特殊的工具可以在道路修筑过程中将路面压紧，因此，路基是结实的。
Tight fitting clothes like jeans also impact fertility, he said.他说,牛仔裤之类的紧身衣裤同样对生育力有影响。
The company's performance was impacted by the high value of the pound.公司的业绩受到了英镑高值的冲击。
The ball impacted against the bat with a loud noise.球撞击着球棒发出很大的响声。
It is obvious how bad movies will impact on children.坏电影对儿童会产生什么影响是显而易见的。
The embargo impacted on export revenues.禁运对出囗总收入有很大的影响。

impassable

[ɪm'pɑːsəbl], [ɪm'pæsəbl]


Image Search
adj. 不能通行的；无路可通的
impossible to travel along or over.
"the narrow channels are impassable to oceangoing ships"
When the road became impassable, we had to ditch the car and walk.道路无法通行时，我们只好弃车步行。
They may include impassable mountain ranges, oceans, or vast deserts.包括不能通行的山脉、海洋或辽阔的沙漠。

impasse

['æmpɑːs], ['ɪmpæs]


Image Search
n. 僵局；死路
a situation in which no progress is possible, especially because of disagreement; a deadlock.
"the current political impasse"
But the political impasse lingers.但政治僵局却依然持续。
We often reach an impasse in our thinking.我们在思维过程中常常会陷入僵局。

impede

[ɪm'piːd], [ɪm'piːd]


Image Search
vt. 妨碍；阻止
delay or prevent (someone or something) by obstructing them; hinder.
"the sap causes swelling that can impede breathing"
The inflexibility of the country's labor market seriously impede its economic recovery.该国劳工市场缺乏灵活性，这严重阻碍了它的经济恢复。
The development of the project was seriously impeded by a reduction in funds.由于基金削减工程进度严重受阻。
He impedes me to do the job well.他妨碍我把工作做好。
What impedes you to make progress?什么事妨碍你取得进步？
If we try to impede the efforts of others then it is not good.如果我们试图阻止别人的这种努力，那是不好的。
I resolved never to allow fear to impede my actions again.于是我发誓再也不会让恐惧阻止我任何一项行动。
The muddy roads impede our journey.我们的旅游被泥泞的道路阻挠了。

imply

[ɪm'plaɪ], [ɪm'plaɪ]


Image Search
vt. 暗示；意指；含有 ... 的意义
strongly suggest the truth or existence of (something not expressly stated).
(of a fact or occurrence) suggest (something) as a logical consequence.
"the salesmen who uses jargon to imply his superior knowledge"
"the forecasted traffic increase implied more roads and more air pollution"
I don't wish to imply that you are wrong.我无意暗示你错了。
What do you want to imply?你要暗示什么?
His silence implied agreement.他沉默不语意味着同意了。
Cheerfulness doesn't always imply happiness.快活并不总是意味着幸福。
Freedom does not necessarily imply responsibility.自由不一定包含著责任。

impressive

[ɪm'presɪv], [ɪm'presɪv]


Image Search
adj. 给人深刻印象的
evoking admiration through size, quality, or skill: grand, imposing, or awesome.
"an impressive view of the mountains"
His collection of paintings is the most impressive.他的绘画收藏令人叹为观止。
The report looks impressive but it's really nothing but waffle.这篇报告貌似冠冕堂皇，实际上空洞无物。
Among his many good qualities, punctuality is the most impressive one.在他众多优秀品质中,守时给人留下了最深刻印象。
Their success is all the more impressive when you consider the efforts they've made.如果你考虑到他们所付出的努力,你就会觉得他们的成功真的很了不起。

impulsive

[ɪm'pʌlsɪv], [ɪm'pʌlsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 冲动的；任性的
n. (引起冲动的)原因
acting or done without forethought.
acting as an impulse.
"they had married as young impulsive teenagers"
Her impulsive passion was a positive defect.她的冲动的激情则完完全全是个缺点。
A jagged equity curve tends to be a sign of impulsive trading.锯齿状曲线多半代表冲动的交易。

inane

[ɪ'neɪn], [ɪ'neɪn]


Image Search
adj. 愚蠢的；空虚的；无意义的
silly; stupid.
"don't constantly badger people with inane questions"
The woman Folly is fickle and inane, and knows nothing.愚昧太太，浮燥愚蠢，一无所知。
She made up her mind that their lives were, though luxurious, inane.她坚决相信，他们的生活虽然奢侈，但很空虚。
These inane literary works have no affinity to the masses.这些文学作品空洞无物, 丝毫没有人民性。

incalculable

[ɪn'kælkjələbl], [ɪn'kælkjələbl]


Image Search
adj. 不可数的；极大的；无法预料的；难以确定的
too great to be calculated or estimated.
not able to be calculated or estimated.
(of a person or their character) unpredictable.
"an archive of incalculable value"
"the cost is incalculable but colossal"
"under the pressure of anxiety his temper became incalculable"
There are incalculable stars in the sky.天空中有数不尽的星星。
The sands of the sea are incalculable in number.海里的沙是数不尽的。
The war caused incalculable loss.战争造成了无法计算的损失
He did incalculable harm to her reputation.他严重损害了她的声誉。
He is a person of incalculable moods.他是个喜怒无常的人。
He has an incalculable disposition.他有一种捉摸不定的脾气。
Had such calamities occurred in old China, the damage would have been incalculable.这样的灾害要是发生在旧中国，损失是无法估计的。

incessant

[ɪn'sesnt], [ɪn'sesnt]


Image Search
adj. 不断的；无尽的
(of something regarded as unpleasant) continuing without pause or interruption.
"the incessant beat of the music"
The incessant barking of the dog annoyed me.不断的狗叫声让我苦恼。
We felt put out by the guest's incessant requests.客人不断的要求令我们觉得受打扰。

incident

['ɪnsɪdənt], ['ɪnsɪdənt]


Image Search
n. 事变；事件；插曲
adj. 难免的；附带的
an event or occurrence.
a violent event, such as a fracas or assault.
a hostile clash between forces of rival countries.
a case or instance of something happening.
the occurrence of dangerous or exciting things.
likely to happen because of; resulting from.
attaching to.
(especially of light or other radiation) falling on or striking something.
relating to incidence.
"several amusing incidents"
"one person was stabbed in the incident"
"a single incident of rudeness does not support a finding of contemptuous conduct"
"the winter passed without incident"
"the changes incident to economic development"
"the costs properly incident to a suit for foreclosure or redemption"
"when an ion beam is incident on a surface"
"the incident angle"
The serious incident along the border increased our fears of the war.边境上的紧张局势加重了我们对战争的忧虑。
She couldn't erase the incident from her memory.她难以忘记那次事件。
The police are connecting this incident with last week's terrorist bombing.警方认为这次事件和上周的恐怖分子爆炸事件有关。
The incident put a dampener on his birthday party.这件事使得他的生日晚会很扫兴。
These diseases are incident to childhood.儿童易患这类疾病。
There are many evils incident to human society.人类社会有很多罪恶。

incidental

[ˌɪnsɪ'dentl], [ˌɪnsɪ'dentl]


Image Search
adj. 附带的；非主要的；偶然的；容易发生的
n. 附带事件；杂项
accompanying but not a major part of something.
occurring by chance in connection with something else.
liable to happen as a consequence of (an activity).
an incidental detail, expense, event, etc.
"for the fieldworker who deals with real problems, paperwork is incidental"
"the incidental catch of dolphins in the pursuit of tuna"
"the ordinary risks incidental to a fireman's job"
"an allowance to cover meals, taxis, and other incidentals"
The incidental expenses of cars in this city are expensive.这个城市汽车的附加费用很昂贵。
You should know the additional responsibilities that are incidental to the job.你该知道做这项工作要承担额外责任。
Justice is incidental to law and order.对于法律和秩序，公正是偶然的。
Fatigue is incidental to a journey in a strange land.在陌生的地方旅行，容易疲劳。
Carry extra cash for taxis, tips and other incidentals.带些额外的的钱，用来支付出租车费、小费和其它杂项。

incision

[ɪn'sɪʒn], [ɪn'sɪʒn]


Image Search
n. 切口；切割
a surgical cut made in skin or flesh.
a mark or decoration cut into a surface.
the action or process of cutting into something.
"an abdominal incision"
"a block of marble delicately decorated with incisions"
"the method is associated with less blood loss during incision"
An incision was made into his leg.他腿上切开了一个口子。
An incision was made into his hand to take out the splinter.他手上切开了一个口子以便取出那根刺。
Result shows both high quality of incision and good efficiency.结果表明,这种方案不仅切割品质好,而且效率可以大大提高。

incisive

[ɪn'saɪsɪv], [ɪn'saɪsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 一针见血的；敏锐的
(of a person or mental process) intelligently analytical and clear-thinking.
(of an account) accurate and sharply focused.
"she was an incisive critic"
"the songs offer incisive pictures of American ways"
He gave a clear and incisive presentation of the matter.他对整件事作出了一个清楚而又深刻的描述。
Many Chinese experts and scholars have an incisive exposition.中国许多专家学者对此有精辟的论述。
He had an incisive and agile mind.他的思路犀利敏捷。

incite

[ɪn'saɪt], [ɪn'saɪt]


Image Search
v. 煽动；刺激；激励
encourage or stir up (violent or unlawful behavior).
urge or persuade (someone) to act in a violent or unlawful way.
"the offense of inciting racial hatred"
"he incited loyal subjects to rebellion"
Stop anyone trying to incite the people.有人煽动，实行挡驾。
On Sabertron, the Destrons incite an uprising among the prisoners.塞伯特恩之迪斯坦逆党煽动囚犯暴动。

incomprehensible

[ɪnˌkɒmprɪ'hensəbl], [ɪnˌkɑːmprɪ'hensəbl]


Image Search
adj. 不能理解的；费解的；<古>无限的
not able to be understood; not intelligible.
"a language that is incomprehensible to anyone outside the office"
The whole thing was incomprehensible.整件事情都是让人无法理解的。
He speaks an incomprehensible vernacular.他说的是一种无法听得懂的方言。
She grunted some incomprehensible reply.她咕噜着回答了些令人费解的话。
It is incomprehensible that they were admitted to the program.他们竟也获准参与这个项目，真是不可思议。

incumbency

[ɪn'kʌmbənsi], [ɪn'kʌmbənsi]


Image Search
n. 职责；义务
the holding of an office or the period during which one is held.
Every incumbency employee has his year-end bonus.所有的在职员工都可以领到年终奖金。
The dollar's attractions as a bolthole are partly a benefit of incumbency.美元作为避险货币的魅力，在一定程度上得益于它主导货币的地位。

indict

[ɪn'daɪt], [ɪn'daɪt]


Image Search
v. 起诉；控告；指控
formally accuse of or charge with a serious crime.
"his former manager was indicted for fraud"
He grew anxious over the possibility that the Justice Department might now indict him for perjury.他越来越担心司法部现在可能起诉他作伪证。
The Q&A session, which was audiotaped, came about two months prior to the child's initial appearance before the grand jury that later voted to indict Jackson on ten felony counts.录音的问答单元的出现要比男孩在以十项罪名起诉杰克逊大陪审团面前的最初露面早两个月。
The police can't find any valid evidence to indict him for murder.警察找不到有效的证据来控告他谋杀。

indictment

[ɪn'daɪtmənt], [ɪn'daɪtmənt]


Image Search
n. 起诉；控告；起诉状
a formal charge or accusation of a serious crime.
the action of indicting or being indicted.
a thing that serves to illustrate that a system or situation is bad and deserves to be condemned.
"an indictment for conspiracy"
"the indictment of twelve people who had imported cocaine"
"these rapidly escalating crime figures are an indictment of our society"
They quashed the indictment against the manager.他们撤销了对经理的起诉。
Don't view it as an indictment of you as a person.不要把它看成是对你本人的一次起诉。
Even threats of indictment didn't loosen the tongue of the balky witness.即使威胁要控告他也不能使这一不肯合作的证人说出一个字来。
I do not know the method of drawing up an indictment against an whole people.我不知道如何起草控告所有人的方法。
The clerk was gabbling over the indictment.书记官在喃喃诵读起诉状。
Most states also require an indictment by a grand jury when a defendant is charged with a felony.当一个被告被控犯重罪时，大多数州还要求由大陪审团来递交起诉状。

indifferent

[ɪn'dɪfrənt], [ɪn'dɪfrənt]


Image Search
adj. 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；平凡的；中立的
having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.
neither good nor bad; mediocre.
not especially good; fairly bad.
neutral in respect of some specified physical property.
not specialized; undifferentiated.
"they all seemed indifferent rather than angry"
"attempts to distinguish between good, bad, and indifferent work"
"a pair of indifferent watercolors"
He is indifferent to the result of the exam.他对考试结果漠不关心。
She seems indifferent, but deep down she's very pleased.她貌似无动於衷，其实心里非常高兴。
Many one or little one is indifferent to me.多一个或少一个对我是无关紧要的。
It was utterly indifferent to her who he was.封她来说，他是谁，根本是无关紧要的事。
I'm an indifferent cook.我是个手艺平平的厨师。
He remains indifferent in the dispute.他对争论表示中立。

indignant

[ɪn'dɪɡnənt], [ɪn'dɪɡnənt]


Image Search
adj. 愤慨的；愤愤不平的
feeling or showing anger or annoyance at what is perceived as unfair treatment.
"he was indignant at being the object of suspicion"
People are indignant by their shooting of innocent civilians.对于他们枪杀无辜平民，人们感到义愤填膺。
He is indignant at the false accusation.他对被诬告愤愤不平。

induce

[ɪn'djuːs], [ɪn'duːs]


Image Search
vt. 引起；促使；劝服；引诱
succeed in persuading or influencing (someone) to do something.
bring about or give rise to.
produce (an electric charge or current or a magnetic state) by induction.
cause (radioactivity) by bombardment with radiation.
bring on (the birth of a baby) artificially, typically by the use of drugs.
bring on childbirth in (a pregnant woman) artificially, typically by the use of drugs.
derive by inductive reasoning.
"the pickets induced many workers to stay away"
"none of these measures induced a change of policy"
The medicine will induce sleep.这种药会引起睡意。
They hoped their work would induce social changes.他们希望自己的工作可以引起社会上的某些变化。
I can't think what induced her to marry him.我想不出到底是什么原因促使她嫁给他。
Alcohol can induce a loosening of the tongue.酒精可使人信口开河。
We couldn't induce the old lady to travel by air.我们无法劝服那老太太乘飞机旅行。
I tried to induce him to see a doctor but I failed.我试着说服他去看医生，但失败了。
Nothing in the world would induce me to do that.什么也不能引诱我做那种事。

ineffable

[ɪn'efəbl], [ɪn'efəbl]


Image Search
adj. 无法形容的；说不出的；避讳的
too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.
not to be uttered.
"the ineffable natural beauty of the Everglades"
"the ineffable Hebrew name that gentiles write as Jehovah"
The beauty of a sunset is ineffable.日落的美是难以形容的。
Mercds turned her eyes with an ineffable look towards heaven.美塞苔丝带着一种难以形容的神情抬头望天。
The terror had at long intervals given place to a feeling of an almost ineffable sweetness.这种胆战心惊的感觉就偶尔让位给一种简直说不出的甜蜜的感觉了。
The name of the Deity is ineffable.神的名字是忌讳说的。

inept

[ɪ'nept], [ɪ'nept]


Image Search
adj. 不适当的；无能的；笨拙的
having or showing no skill; clumsy.
"the inept handling of the threat"
Only inept officials would burden children with such a requirement rather than install speed bumps, others insisted.另有人认为，只有无能的官员才会用这样的规定来加重孩子们的负担，而不采取安装减速装置。
Why do you give me this tainted Apocrypha, this thousandth copy, this inept falsification?为什么给我这本污损过的伪经，这第一千次的抄本，笨拙的伪造？

inevitable

[ɪn'evɪtəbl], [ɪn'evɪtəbl]


Image Search
adj. 不可避免的；必然(发生)的
certain to happen; unavoidable.
so frequently experienced or seen that it is completely predictable.
a situation that is unavoidable.
"war was inevitable"
"the inevitable letter from the bank"
You'll have to bow to the inevitable.你将不得不向不可避免的事态低头。
But most agree that change is inevitable.但她们多数人同意改变是不可避免的。

infiltrate

['ɪnfɪltreɪt], ['ɪnfɪltreɪt]


Image Search
v. （使）渗透；（使）渗入；潜入
enter or gain access to (an organization, place, etc.) surreptitiously and gradually, especially in order to acquire secret information.
permeate or become a part of (something) by infiltration.
(of a tumor, cells, etc.) spread into or invade (a tissue or organ).
(of a liquid) permeate (something) by filtration.
introduce (a liquid) into something by filtration.
an infiltrating substance or a number of infiltrating cells.
"other areas of the establishment were infiltrated by fascists"
"computing has infiltrated most professions now"
"virtually no water infiltrates deserts such as the Sahara"
"lignocaine was infiltrated into the wound"
The thick fog seemed to have infiltrated through the very walls into the room.浓雾好像透过墙壁进到房间里。
The teacher tried to infiltrate her ideas into the children's minds.老师设法把她的思想渗透到孩子们的心中。
Beware of the fifth column. They often infiltrate into key positions and seek to undermine the body politic from within.要提防隐蔽的敌人，他们经常渗透到关键岗位企图从内部破坏国家政体。
The enemy infiltrated our land.敌人混入我国领土。
Our entire organization had been infiltrated by enemy agents.敌特已打入我们整个组织。
He joined the party and turned out to be a wolf in sheep's clothing because he was sent to infiltrate our group for the extreme right wingers.他加入了我们的党，结果却是一只披着羊皮的豺狼，因为他是被极右分子派来混在我们的团体之中的。

inflammatory

[ɪn'flæmətri], [ɪn'flæmətɔːri]


Image Search
adj. 煽动性的；发炎的；炎症的
relating to or causing inflammation of a part of the body.
(especially of speech or writing) arousing or intended to arouse angry or violent feelings.
"inflammatory slogans"
He gave a inflammatory address to the audience.他对听众发表了煽动性的讲话。
Often, reporters will go out of their way to stir up the pot, asking questions in such a way as to provoke an inflammatory response.记者们经常会故意激起两派的斗争，以一种挑逗的方式询问问题，想得到有煽动性的回答。
Government computers scan Chinese cyberspace constantly, hunting for words and phrases that censors have dubbed inflammatory or seditious.政府的电脑定期对国内的网页进行扫描,以寻找网络审查员所认为的具有煽动性的词语。
Substances that inhibit the capsaicin receptors should therefore dampen inflammatory pain.因此，能够抑制辣椒素受体的物质，应该就可以减轻由发炎引起的疼痛。
Some inflammatory mediators also can stimulate mucin secretion.一些炎症介质也可以刺激粘蛋白的分泌。
Histamine was considered the primary mediator of inflammatory vascular responses.人们考虑组织胺为血管炎症性反应的主要介质。

inflection

[ɪn'flekʃn], [ɪn'flekʃn]


Image Search
n. 屈曲；变调；音调变化
a change in the form of a word (typically the ending) to express a grammatical function or attribute such as tense, mood, person, number, case, and gender.
the process or practice of inflecting words.
the modulation of intonation or pitch in the voice.
the variation of the pitch of a musical note.
a change of curvature from convex to concave at a particular point on a curve.
"she spoke slowly and without inflection"
Say the magic words with great inflection in your voice.The magic words sound more authentic and can help make the magic happen.说这些词的时候音调变化强烈一些，这些词听起来就更能让人相信，从而帮助魔术成功。
Esperanto is an artificial international language with a vocabulary based on word roots common to many European languages and a regularized system of inflection.世界语，一种人造的国际辅助语，其单词是建立在许多欧洲语言基础上，具有规定统一的音调变化系统。

infrastructure

['ɪnfrəstrʌktʃə(r)], ['ɪnfrəstrʌktʃər]


Image Search
n. 基础；基础设施
the basic physical and organizational structures and facilities (e.g., buildings, roads, and power supplies) needed for the operation of a society or enterprise.
We actively press ahead with the infrastructure development plan.我们积极推进基础建设计划。
Our city offer overseas investors services for production aside from infrastructure services.我市除了向外国投资者提供基础设施外,还提供良好的生产服务设施。

infuriate

[ɪn'fjʊərieɪt], [ɪn'fjʊrieɪt]


Image Search
adj. 狂怒的
v. 激怒
make (someone) extremely angry and impatient.
"her silences infuriated him"
I feel infuriate and humiliating!!我感到震惊和耻辱!!
In a languid manner he designed to infuriate her.他显出无精打采的样子,故意想激怒她。
I was infuriated by/with their constant criticism.他们没完没了地批评把我给气坏了。

ingenious

[ɪn'dʒiːniəs], [ɪn'dʒiːniəs]


Image Search
adj. 机灵的；精巧的；有独创性的
(of a person) clever, original, and inventive.
(of a machine or idea) cleverly and originally devised and well suited to its purpose.
"he was ingenious enough to overcome the limited budget"
The ingenious boy made a radio set for himself.这个聪明的男孩自己做了一台收音机。
He invented an ingenious excuse for being late.他为迟到编造了一个巧妙的借口。
It was an intricate and ingenious system.这是一个复杂而精致的体系。
I never heard anything more ingenious than your suggestion.我从来没有听见过象你这样有独创性的提法。
Vistors are struck by its ingenious architecture and exotic layout.但是来访者都被它独创性的建筑风格和奇异的布局所吸引。

ingenuity

[ˌɪndʒə'njuːəti], [ˌɪndʒə'nuːəti]


Image Search
n. 心灵手巧；独创性；精巧
the quality of being clever, original, and inventive.
The writer showed ingenuity in creating a surprising ending.作者别具匠心地设计了一个出人意料的结尾。
She had the ingenuity to succeed where everyone else had failed.她真是心灵手巧,别人办不到的事她却做成了。
It took some ingenuity to squeeze all the furniture into the little room.把全部家具都塞进那个小房间是很费了一番心思的。
This movie is of great ingenuity.这部影片很有独创性。
I admire your ingenuity and perseverance.我钦佩你的独创性和毅力。
In fact, the ingenuity that goes into their design and manufacture sets an example that could usefully be followed by the mainland's moribund cultural industries.事实上，山寨机在设计与制造上的独出心裁与精巧为大陆毫无生气的文化产业提供了一个榜样。

ingrained

[ɪn'ɡreɪnd], [ɪn'ɡreɪnd]


Image Search
adj. 根深蒂固的；深嵌入纺织品或纤维的
动词ingrain的过去式和过去分词.
(of a habit, belief, or attitude) firmly fixed or established; difficult to change.
(of dirt or a stain) deeply embedded and thus difficult to remove.
firmly fix or establish (a habit, belief, or attitude) in a person.
"his deeply ingrained Catholic convictions"
"the ingrained dirt on the flaking paintwork"
Your ingrained prejudice has affected your judgment.你根深蒂固的偏见已经影响了你的判断力。
The belief that one should work hard is ingrained in our culture.人人都应该努力工作这个信念在我们的文化中根深蒂固。
Except for his hands and a circle of his face, his body was grey all over with ancient, ingrained dirt.除了他的双手和脸上一圈以外，他全身发灰，污秽不堪。

ingratitude

[ɪn'ɡrætɪtjuːd], [ɪn'ɡrætɪtuːd]


Image Search
n. 忘恩负义
a discreditable lack of gratitude.
"she returned her daughter's care with ingratitude and unkindness"
She was saddened by her son's ingratitude.儿子的忘恩负义伤了她的心。
I have been repaid for the help I gave only with ingratitude.对于我给予的帮助我得到的只是不义的报答。

ingress

['ɪnɡres], ['ɪnɡres]


Image Search
n. 进入；入口；入境
the action or fact of going in or entering.
the capacity or right of entrance.
a place or means of access; an entrance.
the unwanted introduction of water, foreign bodies, contaminants, etc. into something.
the arrival of the sun, the moon, or a planet in a specified constellation or part of the sky.
the beginning of a transit.
Wheel control joint corroded due to moisture ingress and worn out as a result.车轮转向节因为进入了湿气而腐蚀,从而导致磨损的结果。
The touch-screen surface eliminates pushbutton cavities which prevents liquid ingress.触摸屏表面没有按钮腔，这就避免了液体的进入。

inhabit

[ɪn'hæbɪt], [ɪn'hæbɪt]


Image Search
v. 居住于；占据；栖息
(of a person, animal, or group) live in or occupy (a place or environment).
"a bird that inhabits North America"
Broadly, we investigate the world's lakes and rivers and the creatures which inhabit them.宽广地，我们调查世界的湖和河和居住于他们的人。
Wookiees inhabit the upper levels of the forest, having built their massive cities within the interwoven canopy.伍基人占据了树林的上层，并在交织的树冠上建造了巨大的城市。
Under Forman's tutelage, actors fully inhabit their roles, the hospital becomes an evil institution, and the movie poignantly celebrates the human spirit.根据福尔曼的指导，演员完全占据自己的角色，医院成为一个邪恶的机构，和电影尖锐地庆祝人类的精神。
Many types of seabirds inhabit the coral island.这个珊瑚岛上栖息着很多种海鸟。
Woodpeckers inhabit hollow trees.啄木鸟栖息在中空的树中。

inhabitants

[ɪn'hæbɪtənts], [ɪn'hæbɪtənts]


Image Search
居民
a person or animal that lives in or occupies a place.
a person who fulfills the requirements for legal residency.
The inhabitants were still in the savage state.这些居民仍处于野蛮状态。
Life is very convenient for city inhabitants.城市居民生活很方便。

inherited

[ɪn'herɪtɪd], [ɪn'herɪtɪd]


Image Search
adj. 继承的；遗传的
动词inherit的过去式和过去分词.
receive (money, property, or a title) as an heir at the death of the previous holder.
derive (a quality, characteristic, or predisposition) genetically from one's parents or ancestors.
receive or be left with (a situation, object, etc.) from a predecessor or former owner.
come into possession of (belongings) from someone else.
come into possession of (something) as a right (especially in biblical translations and allusions).
"she inherited a fortune from her father"
"she had inherited the beauty of her grandmother"
"spending commitments inherited from previous administrations"
"she inherits all her clothes from her older sisters"
"master, what must I do to inherit eternal life?"
They live in grand seclusion, drawing their income from the investment of their inherited wealth.他们过着隔离公众的生活，从继承的遗产所做的投资获得收入。
There are numerous inherited antigens on the surface of the human erythrocyte.在人的红细胞表面上存在许多遗传的抗原。
She inherited a large fortune.她继承了一大笔财产。
He inherited the manor and all its appurtenances.他继承了那片庄园及其一切特权。

initial

[ɪ'nɪʃl], [ɪ'nɪʃl]


Image Search
n. (词)首字母
adj. 开始的；最初的；字首的
vt. 签姓名的首字母于
existing or occurring at the beginning.
(of a letter) at the beginning of a word.
the first letter of a name or word, typically a person's name or a word forming part of a phrase.
mark or sign (a document) with one's initials, especially in order to authorize or validate it.
agree to or ratify (a treaty or contract) by signing it.
"our initial impression was favorable"
"they carved their initials into the tree trunk"
This is a letter paper personalized with his initials.这是一张有他姓名首字母的信纸。
After the initial cheers,the noise of the crowd began to die away as the group started playing.开始的欢呼声结束以后，乐队开始演奏，人们的喧闹声也随之逐渐消失。
We are through the initial testing period.我们通过了最初的考试阶段
The word “hour” is pronounced without an initial aspirate.hour一词的首字母h不发送气音。
She initialed a handkerchief and gave it to that young man.她在手帕上绣上姓名的首字母，把它送给了那个年轻人。

initiative

[ɪ'nɪʃətɪv], [ɪ'nɪʃətɪv]


Image Search
adj. 自发的
n. 首创精神；主动权；第一步；倡议；项目
the ability to assess and initiate things independently.
the power or opportunity to act or take charge before others do.
an act or strategy intended to resolve a difficulty or improve a situation; a fresh approach to something.
a proposal made by one nation to another in an attempt to improve relations.
(especially in some US states and Switzerland) the right of citizens outside the legislature to originate legislation.
"use your initiative, imagination, and common sense"
"we have lost the initiative and allowed our opponents to dictate the subject"
"a new initiative against car crime"
"diplomatic initiatives to end the war"
She took an initiative part in the Wildlife Conservation Society.她主动参加野生动物保护协会。
It is innovation plus initiative that has kept it thriving.创新与进取精神使得它蓬勃发展。
In the economic trend of the new era, having the initiative is the key.在新时期的经济大潮中，拥有主动权是关键。
Thus the initiative was lost at the very first move, and that is really the worst and most stupid way to fight.开脚一步就丧失了主动权，真是最蠢最坏的打法。

innate

[ɪ'neɪt], [ɪ'neɪt]


Image Search
adj. 天生的；固有的
inborn; natural.
originating in the mind.
"her innate capacity for organization"
Ability is not innate, but comes through practice.本事不是天生的，是锻炼出来的。
You obviously have an innate talent for music.你显然有天生的音乐才能。
Children have an innate ability to learn language.孩子具有天生的学习语言的能力。
The love is the innate strength.爱是与生俱来的力量!
This passage may be interpreted as a recognition of an innate moral sense in man.这段话可以被解释为对人类固有的道德意识的认识。

innocuous

[ɪ'nɒkjuəs], [ɪ'nɑːkjuəs]


Image Search
adj. 无害的；无毒的；无关痛痒的
not harmful or offensive.
"it was an innocuous question"
It seemed a perfectly innocuous remark.那像是一句毫无恶意的话。
All growing here are innocuous vegetables.这裡种植的都是无公害蔬菜。
This is an innocuous resolution.这项决议案不痛不痒。

innovate

['ɪnəveɪt], ['ɪnəveɪt]


Image Search
v. 改革；创新
make changes in something established, especially by introducing new methods, ideas, or products.
introduce (something new, especially a product).
"the company's failure to diversify and innovate competitively"
"innovating new products, developing existing ones"
We must innovate in order to make progress.我们必须改革以便取得进步。
The priest was determined to innovate upon religious forms.这位教士决心要改革宗教形式。
So, it must want to innovate, change, carry fast.所以，它必须要创新，改变，提速。
They can innovate by promoting remedies that are otherwise unfeasible or remote.有些疾病的疗法并不可行或是太过新奇，慈善家们可以做出创新，对之加以改良。

innovation

[ˌɪnə'veɪʃn], [ˌɪnə'veɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 创新；革新
the action or process of innovating.
a new method, idea, product, etc.
"technological innovations designed to save energy"
There is no end to practice or innovation.实践永无止境,创新永无止境。
In the age of global competition, design innovation is vital.在全球激烈竞争的时代,设计创新至关重要。
It was a period of innovation.这是革新时期。
A surge of innovation in techniques is on the horizon.技术改进的浪潮即将出现。
After being led by him, one innovation after another are showing.从他领导后，一个又一个革新项目出现了。

innovative

['ɪnəveɪtɪv], ['ɪnəveɪtɪv]


Image Search
adj. 创新的；革新的
(of a product, idea, etc.) featuring new methods; advanced and original.
(of a person) introducing new ideas; original and creative in thinking.
"innovative designs"
"an innovative thinker"
Its glass carving is beautiful and innovative.玻璃雕刻创意新颖。
These designs are full of innovative ideas.这些设计富有创新的理念。
She was an imaginative and innovative manager.她是个有想象力和革新精神的经理。
This is an innovative approach to language teaching.这是语言教学中一种革新的方法。

inquiry

[ɪn'kwaɪərɪ], [ɪn'kwaɪrɪ]


Image Search
n. 调查；询问；打听；查问
=enquiry(英).
an act of asking for information.
an official investigation.
"the deluge of phone inquiries after a crash"
We made an application to the court for an inquiry.我们曾请求法院调查。
They've promised a thorough inquiry into the plane crash.他们答应对这次飞机失事进行彻底的调查。
I'm not able to help you with your inquiry.我对你的咨询无能为力。
He is fishing for information by a letter of inquiry.他写信询问，希望打听一下消息。
Please quote us as soon as you receive our inquiry.请接到我们的询价单后马上给我们报价。

insight

['ɪnsaɪt], ['ɪnsaɪt]


Image Search
n. 洞察力；见识；深刻的理解
the capacity to gain an accurate and deep intuitive understanding of a person or thing.
a deep understanding of a person or thing.
new understanding by a mentally ill person of the causes of their disorder.
"this paper is alive with sympathetic insight into Shakespeare"
"the signals would give marine biologists new insights into the behavior of whales"
I've got an insight into the problem.我对问题豁然开朗。
The book is filled with remarkable insights.这本书很有真知卓见。
In this new book he hits off the American temperament with amazing insight.在这本新书里，他对美国人性格的描写表现出惊人的洞察力。
Once human limits are breached, the person sees beyond the horizon of human insight, to reach a truly cosmic consciousness.当局限被打破,人们的洞察力就可以超越凡人,看到宇宙真正的奥秘。

insinuate

[ɪn'sɪnjueɪt], [ɪn'sɪnjueɪt]


Image Search
v. 暗示；迂回进入；迂回进行；含沙射影的说
suggest or hint (something bad or reprehensible) in an indirect and unpleasant way.
maneuver oneself into (a position of favor or office) by subtle manipulation.
slide (oneself or a thing) slowly and smoothly into a position.
"he was insinuating that she had slept her way to the top"
"she seemed to be taking over, insinuating herself into the family"
"the bugs insinuate themselves between one's skin and clothes"
He insinuated his doubt of her ability.他暗示了他对她能力的怀疑。
He tried to insinuate himself into the boss's favor.他设法巧妙地渐渐取得老板的欢心。
She insinuate to us that her partner have embezzle fund.她旁敲侧击地指出她的合夥人盗用了资金。
I didn't insinuate anybody or anything.我并未影射如何人或任何事。
It seems to me you insinuate things about her.我觉得你讲起她来，总有些弦外之音。

insipid

[ɪn'sɪpɪd], [ɪn'sɪpɪd]


Image Search
adj. 没有味道的；枯燥乏味的
lacking flavor.
lacking vigor or interest.
"mugs of insipid coffee"
"many artists continued to churn out insipid, shallow works"
The food was rather insipid and needed gingering up.这食物缺少味道，需要加点作料。

insolent

['ɪnsələnt], ['ɪnsələnt]


Image Search
adj. 粗野的；无礼的；厚颜的；无耻的
showing a rude and arrogant lack of respect.
"she hated the insolent tone of his voice"
My boss is so rude and insolent that I can't do with him.我的老板是那样的粗野无礼，叫我无法忍受。
He was insolent in his manner.他态度傲慢无礼。
It was insolent of them to demand special treatment.他们要求给予特殊待遇,脸皮真厚。

instantaneous

[ˌɪnstən'teɪniəs], [ˌɪnstən'teɪniəs]


Image Search
adj. 瞬间的；即刻的
occurring or done in an instant or instantly.
existing or measured at a particular instant.
"her reaction was almost instantaneous"
"measurement of the instantaneous velocity"
Relief was instantaneous.痛苦的消除是瞬间的事
Death is instantaneous in a fatal accident.在致命的事故中，死亡是即刻发生的。
The reaction of the audience was instantaneous.观众即刻有了反应。
He had an instantaneous response.他立刻作了反应。

integrate

['ɪntɪɡreɪt], ['ɪntɪɡreɪt]


Image Search
v. 整合；结合；取消隔离；求积分
adj. 完整的；组合的
combine (one thing) with another so that they become a whole.
combine (two things) so that they become a whole.
(of a thing) combine with another to form a whole.
bring (people or groups with particular characteristics or needs) into equal participation in or membership of a social group or institution.
come into equal participation in or membership of society or an institution or body.
desegregate (a school, neighborhood, etc.), especially racially.
find the integral of.
"transportation planning should be integrated with energy policy"
"the problem of integrating the two approaches"
"the stone will blend with the environment and integrate into the landscape"
"integrating children with special needs into ordinary schools"
"she was anxious to integrate well into her husband's family"
"there was a national campaign under way to integrate the lunch counters"
The Message Board tool is an easy tool to integrate into daily school life.留言板是一种非常方便的工具,可以将其整合到日常学校生活中。
Only 20% of teachers report feeling very well prepared to integrate education technology into classroom instruction.仅有20%25的教师认为他们感觉能够将技术与课堂教学进行整合。
I learn quickly. I integrate disparate concepts with relative ease.我学习速度很快,我能将完全不同的概念毫不费力地结合在一起。
We must carry out the Party's education policy that education should serve socialist modernization and the people and integrate itself with productive labor and social practice.全面贯彻党的教育方针
The city will integrate all public services.这个城市将把所有的公共场所对各族人民开放。
Science is not an independent knowledge system, it has to integrate from various perspectives in order to reach a full understanding.但是科学并非独立的知识系统，必须从不同的角度作综合性研究，方能对它有较完整的认识。
A relatively integrate scheme is put forward after many years' research, namely Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), which aims at improving Internet security.经过多年研究,提出一套完整的安全解决方案,即PKI技术,用于提高网络的安全性能。

integrity

[ɪn'teɡrəti], [ɪn'teɡrəti]


Image Search
n. 完整；完善；正直；诚实
the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; moral uprightness.
the state of being whole and undivided.
the condition of being unified, unimpaired, or sound in construction.
internal consistency or lack of corruption in electronic data.
"he is known to be a man of integrity"
"upholding territorial integrity and national sovereignty"
"the structural integrity of the novel"
"integrity checking"
We must respect each other's territorial integrity.我们应当尊重彼此的领土完整。
We all have an interest in maintaining the integrity of the ecosystem.维持生态系统的完整是我们共同的利益。
One of the most important features of the steel cables is their structural integrity.钢索最重要的特点之一，是结构的完善性。
My husband is a man of the highest integrity.我丈夫是个非常正直的人。
The kid was raised to become a man of integrity.这孩子被培养成了一个诚实的人。

intensive

[ɪn'tensɪv], [ɪn'tensɪv]


Image Search
adj. 密集的；彻底的；精细的；强调的
n. (语法)强调成份
concentrated on a single area or subject or into a short time; very thorough or vigorous.
(of agriculture) aiming to achieve the highest possible level of production within a limited area, especially by using chemical and technological aids.
(typically in business and economics) concentrating on or making much use of a specified thing.
(of an adjective, adverb, or particle) expressing intensity; giving force or emphasis.
denoting a property that is measured in terms of intensity (e.g., concentration) rather than of extent (e.g., volume), and so is not simply increased by addition of one thing to another.
an intensive adjective, adverb, or particle; an intensifier.
"she undertook an intensive Arabic course"
"intensive farming"
"computer-intensive methods"
This patient requires intensive care.该病人需要加强护理。
We concentrated intensive fire on the enemy.我们集中密集的火力向敌人攻击。
An intensive search failed to reveal any clues.经过彻底搜查未发现任何线索。
Do you have an intensive reading of English this term?这个学期你们有英语精读课程吗？
The word is used as an intensive word.这个词是用作加强语气的词。

interlude

['ɪntəluːd], ['ɪntərluːd]


Image Search
n. 中间；中间时间；插曲；介在中间的事件
an intervening period of time.
a pause between the acts of a play.
something performed during a theater intermission.
a piece of music played between other pieces or between the verses of a hymn.
a temporary amusement or source of entertainment that contrasts with what goes before or after.
"enjoying a lunchtime interlude"
"an orchestral interlude"
"the romantic interlude withered rapidly once he was back in town"
There will now be a 15-minute interlude.现在有15分钟的中间休息。
Apart from a brief interlude of peace, the war lasted nine years.除了一段短暂的和平，那场战争持续了九年。
Her time in Paris was a happy interlude in a difficult career.她在巴黎期间是她艰辛的事业中一段愉快的插曲。

intermission

[ˌɪntə'mɪʃn], [ˌɪntər'mɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 中止；中断；停顿；幕间休息
a pause or break.
an interval between parts of a play, movie, or concert.
"he was granted an intermission in his studies"
Her fever lasted five days without intermission.她连续五天一直发烧。
Drills were set to work without intermission.螺旋钻在一刻不停地挥舞着。
The violinist resumed playing after the intermission .幕间休息之后,那小提琴手又重新开始演奏。
We had a short intermission halfway through a film.我们电影放映中途做了短暂的休息。

inside the body.

"he creates a dialogue internal to his work"

He worked in internal trade.他的工作是做国内贸易。
We should make an internal inquiry to find out who is responsible for the it.我们应进行内部调查,找出对此事承担责任的人。
She's been having some internal problems.她一直有些内科疾病。

intervene

[ˌɪntə'viːn], [ˌɪntər'viːn]


Image Search
vi. 干涉；干预；介入；调停；插入；阻挠
come between so as to prevent or alter a result or course of events.
(of an event or circumstance) occur as a delay or obstacle to something being done.
interrupt verbally.
interpose in a lawsuit as a third party.
occur in time between events.
be situated between things.
"he acted outside his authority when he intervened in the dispute"
"Christmas intervened, and the investigation was suspended"
"“It's true!” he intervened"
"to occupy the intervening months, she took a job in a hospital"
"they heard the sound of distant gunfire, muffled by the intervening trees"
Don't intervene in the affairs of another country.不要干涉别的国家的事务。
It's time that men of good sense and good will to intervene.这该是那些头脑清醒和心地善良的人们出面干预的时候了。
You'd better not intervene in their dispute.你最好还是不要介入他们的争端。
I am powerless to intervene in the matter.我对调停此事无能为力。
I will come if nothing intervenes.假若没有别的事，我一定来。

He was intimidated into silence.他吓得不敢作声。

Your sons don't intimidate me. And neither do you.你的儿子们威胁不了我,你也一样。
The gang tried to intimidate the bank manager.那帮歹徒企图恐吓银行经理。

Taiwan is a complex of intricate relationships.台湾是个各种关系错综复杂的地方。
The situation seems to be intricate.局势似乎错综复杂。

inundate

['ɪnʌndeɪt], ['ɪnʌndeɪt]

"we've been inundated with complaints from listeners"
"the islands may be the first to be inundated as sea levels rise"
Police say rescue officials are worried that water from a choked river could inundate towns near the epicenter.警方称救援人员担心堵塞的河流一旦决堤将会淹没震中附近地区的乡镇。
The course changes frequently, and the area is so flat that a small change in the level of the river may inundate a considerable area.河道变化多端，下游地区却很平坦，水位少许上涨河流就会淹没一大片土地。

invoke

Image Search

[计算机] 调用.

call earnestly for.
summon (a spirit) by charms or incantation.

cause (a procedure) to be carried out.
"the antiquated defense of insanity is rarely invoked today"

"how could she explain how the accident happened without invoking his wrath?"
The government has invoked the official secret act in having the book banned.政府援引国家机密保密法以禁该书。
It invokes new problems.它引起一些新的问题。
The speech invoked his memory of childhood.演讲唤起了他童年的记忆。
They invoked help in the desperate situation.他们在走投无路的情况下恳求援助。
Let us invoke the blessings of peace.让我们祈求和平之福。
He invoked the judge's mercy.他恳求法官宽恕。
They invoked God in times of trouble.他们在困难时向上帝乞灵。
This command can invoke the applications.这条命令可以调用应用程序。

It irked him that she had thought of it first.她竟先想到那件事，为此他很不痛快。
By midday the irk of his pack became too oppressive.走到中午的时候，累赘的包袱压得他受不了。

irresistible

He had an irresistible desire to run away.他一心想逃跑,无法抑制这个愿望。
Historical trend is irresistible.历史潮流是不可阻挡的。
She saw an irresistible skirt in the store window.她看见商店的橱窗里有一条叫人着迷的裙子。

jest

[dʒest], [dʒest]


Image Search
n. 说笑；玩笑

a thing said or done for amusement; a joke.
an object of derision.

"there are jests about administrative gaffes"
"lowly virtue is the jest of fools"
"you jest, surely?"
They made a jest of his ignorance.他们笑话他无知。
He spoke it in a kind of jest, but it was with such an awkward smile.他用一种说笑的口吻说着，但是说时带着那么不自然的微笑。
I said in jest I would marry Jim.我开玩笑说要嫁给吉姆。
It began as a jest and ended as a tragedy.事情以玩笑开始，以悲剧告终。
He is not a man to jest with.他是个不能开玩笑的人。
Do not jest about serious things .对于重要的事情不能当儿戏。
You jest so lightly in a time of crisis?在这时候你还有心情开玩笑？
