justify

['dʒʌstɪfaɪ], ['dʒʌstɪfaɪ]


Image Search
vt. 替 ... 辩护；证明 ... 正当；调整版面
show or prove to be right or reasonable.
be a good reason for.
declare or make righteous in the sight of God.
adjust (a line of type or piece of text) so that the print fills a space evenly or forms a straight edge at one or both margins.
"the person appointed has fully justified our confidence"
"the situation was grave enough to justify further investigation"
He had to justify himself for his conduct.他不得不为自己的行为辩白。
Don't try to justify your mistakes.不要为自己的缺点辩护。
Nothing can justify your cheating on an exam.任何事情都不能成为你考试作弊的理由。
Such action can be justified on the grounds of greater efficiency.以提高功效为依据可以证明采取这种措施是正确的。
Click on this icon to align or justify text.点击图标排列调整文本。

juxtaposed

[ˌdʒʌkstə'pəʊz], [ˌdʒʌkstə'poʊz]


Image Search
v. 并置；并列
place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
"black-and-white photos of slums were starkly juxtaposed with color images"
Elements of Indian culture juxtapose newer designs. 印度文化元素与新型设计并行。
We tried to juxtapose the sculptures to give the best effect. 我们把雕刻品加以并排以得到最好的效果。
Juxtapose the use of override with new. What is shadowing? 什么时候使用override?什么时候使用new? 什么叫shadowing?
Juxtapose the HTTP verbs GET and POST. What is HEAD? 对比http动词GET和POST? 什么是HEAD?
Comparison will be easier if you juxtapose the two objects. 把这两个物体并列就较易作出比较了。
When you juxtapose the two, you can see the difference. 要是你把这两个人并在一起,就看得出分别来了。

keen

[kiːn], [kiːn]


Image Search
adj. 敏锐的；强烈的；锋利的；热衷的；精明的
sharp or penetrating, in particular.
(of a sense) highly developed.
(of mental faculties) quick to understand or function.
(of the air or wind) extremely cold; biting.
(of the edge or point of a blade) sharp.
(of a smell, light, or sound) penetrating; clear.
having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm.
interested in or attracted by (someone or something).
excellent.
(of prices) very low; competitive.
wail in grief for a dead person; sing a keen.
make an eerie wailing sound.
an Irish funeral song accompanied by wailing in lamentation for the dead.
"I have keen eyesight"
"her keen intellect"
"keen believers in the monetary system"
"Bob makes it obvious he's keen on her"
"I would soon fly to distant stars—how keen!"
"the keening of the cold night wind"
The blind have a keen sense of touch.盲人有敏锐的触觉。
Their keen eyes can penetrate the water to a depth of forty feet.他们锐利的眼睛能透过水面看到40 英尺的深处。
Be brave, a fence between makes love more keen.勇敢点,受到阻隔的爱情会更强烈。
The razor has a very keen edge.这把剃刀有锋利的口。
They have a wide knowledge of everyday things, and a keen interest in their particular city and state.他们对日常事情所知甚广,对所在的城市和州深为关切。
He's keen, but his youth is a minus factor.他非常精明, 但他的年轻却是个不利的因素。

keepsake

['kiːpseɪk], ['kiːpseɪk]


Image Search
n. 纪念品
a small item kept in memory of the person who gave it or originally owned it.
He gave me his picture as a keepsake before going away.他在离开前送我一张照片做为纪念。
My aunt gave me one of her brooches as a keepsake.我姑母把她的一支胸针送给我作记念。
The keepsake she gave me is small and not very costly.她送我的纪念品很小而且不值钱。
This is just a little keepsake for your birthday.这是我的一点小意思， 送给你做生日礼物。

kinetic

[kɪ'netɪk], [kɪ'netɪk]


Image Search
adj. 运动的；动力学的
relating to or resulting from motion.
(of a work of art) depending on movement for its effect.
Kinetic energy is a scalar property of motion.动能是运动的一种标量属性。
Bodies traveling in a gravitational field are always undergoing an exchange of gravitational and kinetic energy.在重力场中运动的物体会不停地改变其动能与重力位能。
By the research of the ethylene slurry polymerization mechanism and kinetics, the corresponding kinetic and moment ordinary differential equations were built and solved.在研究了淤浆法乙烯聚合反应机理与动力学的基础上，建立并求解了相应的动力学与矩常微分方程组。

kiwi

['kiːwiː], ['kiːwiː]


Image Search
n. 几维鸟(新西兰国岛)；猕猴桃
Kiwi
n. <口> 新西兰人
a flightless New Zealand bird with hairlike feathers, having a long down-curved bill with sensitive nostrils at the tip.
a New Zealander, especially a soldier or member of a national sports team.
kiwi fruit.
"a bowl of cherries and kiwis"
The Kiwi is New Zealand's national symbol and New Zealanders refer to themselves as Kiwis.几维鸟是新西兰的名族象征，新西兰人也常常把自己称为几维人。
Saya mempunyai sebuah Kiwi dan sebuah Melon.我有一个猕猴桃和一个甜瓜。
In Asia, the hardy kiwi grows well in the shade.在亚洲，猕猴桃在荫蔽条件下能生长得很好。

knockout

['nɒkaʊt], ['nɑːkaʊt]


Image Search
adj. <美俚> 引人注目的；杰出的；迷人的；猛烈的
n. 打出；击倒；引人注目的人或物
an act of knocking someone out, especially in boxing.
an extremely attractive or impressive person or thing.
a tournament in which the loser in each round is eliminated.
"a knockout blow"
"he must have been a knockout when he was young"
Seeing the opponent was off guarded, the boxer landed a knockout punch.乘对手不提防，那拳击手一下子把他击倒了。
The fight was won by a knockout.这场拳击以一击将对方打倒而获胜。
I know she's a knockout and he's nuts about her.我知道她是一个美人，他迷恋着她。
You really look a knockout in your new dress.你穿上这条裙子真是出尽风头。

lag

[læɡ], [læɡ]


Image Search
v. 落后；减退；缓慢进行
n. 落后；时间间隔
fall behind in movement, progress, or development; not keep pace with another or others.
determine the order of play by striking the cue ball from balk to rebound off the top cushion, first stroke going to the player whose ball comes to rest nearer the bottom cushion.
a period of time between one event or phenomenon and another.
a retardation in an electric current or movement.
enclose or cover (a boiler, pipes, etc.) with material that provides heat insulation.
the non-heat-conducting cover of a boiler, pipes, etc.; lagging.
a piece of this.
a person who has been frequently convicted and sent to prison.
arrest or send to prison.
"they stopped to wait for one of the children who was lagging behind"
"there was a time lag between the commission of the crime and its reporting to the police"
"a lagged hot-water tank"
"both old lags were sentenced to ten years' imprisonment"
Some of the runners in the race began to lag.参加比赛的运动员中有一些开始落後了。
The children always lag behind when we go for a walk.我们出去散步时，孩子们总是落在后面。
Interest lags in such matters.对这类事情的兴趣慢慢减少了。
It takes a lot of time to catch up with a cultural lag.文化的落后需要长时间才能赶上。
There was a long lag in forwarding mail to us.转寄给我们的邮件晚了很久才拿到。

lament

[lə'ment], [lə'ment]


Image Search
n. 悲叹；悼词
v. 哀悼；惋惜；悲叹
a passionate expression of grief or sorrow.
a song, piece of music, or poem expressing sorrow.
an expression of regret or disappointment; a complaint.
mourn (a person's loss or death).
express one's deep grief about.
express regret or disappointment over something considered unsatisfactory, unreasonable, or unfair.
"his mother's night-long laments for his father"
"there were constant laments about the conditions of employment"
"he was lamenting the death of his infant daughter"
"she lamented the lack of shops in the town"
It is the lament of an impoverished peasant.它是一个已贫穷化的农民的哀词。
This poem can be characterized as a lament for a dead lover.这首诗可以看作是对死去情人的悼词。
The children lament the death of their mother.孩子们哀悼母亲的去世。
She lament her son's death all night.她整夜为儿子之死而悲伤。
People lament the passing of the good old days.人们惋惜过去的好时光的流逝。
He deeply lamented the death of his wife.他对妻子的去世深感悲痛。

latter

['lætə(r)], ['lætər]


Image Search
adj. 后者的；后面的
situated or occurring nearer to the end of something than to the beginning.
recent.
denoting the second or second mentioned of two people or things.
"the latter half of 1989"
"the project had low cash flows in its latter years"
"the Russians could advance into either Germany or Austria—they chose the latter option"
I prefer the former design to the latter.比起后者的设计方案,我更喜欢前者的。
One can travel there by ship or plane. Most people choose the latter.乘船或乘飞机都可以到那,人们多选择后者。
The latter point is the most important.后面提及的那一点是最重要的。
In the latter years of his life he lived alone and never welcomed visitors.他晚年独居，从不欢迎来访者。

laudatory

['lɔːdətəri], ['lɔːdətɔːri]


Image Search
adj. 赞美的；赞赏的
(of speech or writing) expressing praise and commendation.
Sometime I can hear the laudatory words, sometime I can meet the random railer.时常会听到赞美的话，也会听到胡乱骂街的话。

launder

['lɔːndə(r)], ['lɔːndər]


Image Search
n. 流水槽
v. 洗涤；清洗；洗黑钱(把来路可疑的钱弄得貌似合法)
wash, or wash and iron, (clothes or linens).
conceal the origins of (money obtained illegally) by transfers involving foreign banks or legitimate businesses.
alter (information) to make it appear more acceptable.
a trough for holding or conveying water, especially (in mining) one used for washing ore.
a channel for conveying molten metal from a furnace or container to a ladle or mold.
"he wasn't used to laundering his own bed linens"
"we began to notice attempts to launder the data retrospectively"
Detergent powders will however,launder less efficiently at the boil,a use for which they are not intended.沸水可降低洗衣粉的洗涤效果，且洗衣粉无此用法。
North Korea's already limping economy is suffering too, as banks that once helped launder money for the communist state, for example in Macau, have frozen its accounts.朝鲜已然疲软的经济也正受此影响，因为曾经帮朝鲜政府洗黑钱的那些银行，比如澳门的银行，已经冻结了该国的账户。

lavish

['lævɪʃ], ['lævɪʃ]


Image Search
adj. 大方的；丰富的；浪费的
vt. 浪费；慷慨给予
sumptuously rich, elaborate, or luxurious.
(of a person) very generous or extravagant.
spent or given in profusion.
bestow something in generous or extravagant quantities upon.
cover something thickly or liberally with.
"a lavish banquet"
"he was lavish with his hospitality"
"lavish praise"
"the media couldn't lavish enough praise on the film"
"she lavished our son with kisses"
A rich man can be lavish of his money.富有的人用钱大手大脚。
He was lavish in his praise for her paintings.他大力赞扬她的绘画。
The Empress can also represent lavish abundance of all kinds.女皇也代表各种各样的丰富奢侈。
That is a vast and lavish party.那是个规模盛大、极其铺张的宴会。
Those small factories are also lavish consumer and waster of raw materials.那些小工厂还在极大的消耗和浪费原材料。
The practiceof giving lavish feasts at weddings is just a waste of money.结婚大办酒席实在太浪费了。
The country girl was not used to their lavish mode of living.这个乡下姑娘不习惯他们奢侈的生活方式。
It is a mistake to lavish kindness ungrateful people.对于不领情的人来说浪费感情是一种错误。
Many claim that pet owners today lavish too much time and money on their pets.许多人认为现在饲主浪费太多时间和金钱在宠物身上。
My mother always lavishes us with attention.妈妈对我们关怀得无微不至。

layers

['leɪəs], ['leɪəs]


Image Search
n. 层
名词layer的复数形式.
a sheet, quantity, or thickness of material, typically one of several, covering a surface or body.
a level of seniority in the hierarchy of an organization.
a person or thing that lays something.
a shoot fastened down to take root while attached to the parent plant.
arrange in a layer or layers.
cut (hair) in overlapping layers.
propagate (a plant) as a layer.
"bears depend on a layer of blubber to keep them warm in the water"
"a managerial layer"
"the worms are prolific egg-layers"
"the current trend for layered clothes"
"her layered, shoulder-length hair"
"a layered shoot"
There are several layers of meaning.有几层不同的含意。
Individual layers generally have sharp contacts.单层间一般具有截然的接触带。

leaky

['liːki], ['liːki]


Image Search
adj. 出现裂缝的；泄漏的
having a leak or leaks.
"a leaky roof"
Commend me to a leaky house on a rainy day.雨天我要漏水的房子才怪呢。
The plumber went down to the cellar to fix the leaky pipe.管道工到地下室去修漏水的管子。
Water oozed from the leaky pipe.水从漏的管子中渗出来。
Why isn't the husband fixing the leaky roof?丈夫为什么不打算修补漏雨的屋顶呢?

leek

[liːk], [liːk]


Image Search
n. 韭葱；青蒜
a plant related to the onion, with flat overlapping leaves forming an elongated cylindrical bulb that together with the leaf bases is eaten as a vegetable. It is used as a Welsh national emblem.
When I am young I grow some leek in a pot.小时候我曾在花盆里种了些韭葱。
Throughout the text, she records recipes for French cookery varying in complexity from leek broth to croissants.这本书记录了各种各样的法国烹调菜谱，从韭葱肉汤到羊角面包。

leeway

['liːweɪ], ['liːweɪ]


Image Search
n. 余地
the amount of freedom to move or act that is available.
margin of safety.
the sideways drift of a ship or an aircraft to leeward of the desired course.
"the government had several months' leeway to introduce reforms"
"there is little leeway if anything goes wrong"
"the leeway is only about 2°"
Give me lots of leeway around the chest.胸围部分多给我留些余地。
This point is no leeway for dispute.这一点是没有争论的余地的。
Better to be quiet and leave a little leeway.还是少说几句，留点余地罢。
We have an hour's leeway to catch the express.我们还有一小时的充裕时间搭那班快车。
This itinerary leaves us plenty of leeway.这个旅行计划给我们留有很多自由活动的余地。
Ten days should be a big enough leeway to allow for delays.把耽搁考虑在内，增加十天时间是绰绰有余的了。
They allow more leeway rather than enforcing leniency, and do not apply directly to the state courts where most drug cases are heard.他们允许有更多的回旋余地，而不是强制执行宽赦，也不会在有许多毒品犯罪案件要被审理的州法院直接采用。

legacy

['leɡəsi], ['leɡəsi]


Image Search
n. 遗赠物；先人或过去遗留下来的东西
adj. [计算机]旧系统的
an amount of money or property left to someone in a will.
a thing handed down by a predecessor.
denoting software or hardware that has been superseded but is difficult to replace because of its wide use.
"the legacy of centuries of neglect"
He left me a small legacy in a nuncupative will, as a token of his kindness to me.他囗头遗言上遗留给我一点小小遗产作为他对我关爱的表征。
These are the cultural legacies of the Renaissance.这些是文艺复兴时期的文化遗产。

legend

['ledʒənd], ['ledʒənd]


Image Search
n. 传说；传奇；图例
a traditional story sometimes popularly regarded as historical but unauthenticated.
an extremely famous or notorious person, especially in a particular field.
an inscription, especially on a coin or medal.
a caption.
the wording on a map or diagram explaining the symbols used.
the story of a saint's life.
very well known.
"the legend of King Arthur"
"the man was a living legend"
"a picture of a tiger with the legend, “Go ahead, make my day.”"
"see legend under Fig. 1"
"the mosaics illustrate the legends of the saints"
"his speed and ferocity in attack were legend"
According to the old legend, Romulus was the founder of Rome.按照古老的传说，罗穆卢斯是古罗马的建国者。
This oriental legend is fascinating.这个东方传说很吸引人。
The little girl is very interested in the old legend of immortal creatures.小女孩对有关永生的精灵的古老传奇非常感兴趣。
He is a legend in his lifetime for his scientific discoveries.他的科学发现使他一生成为传奇人物。
Add a legend using cells on the side of the report by using the following table as a guide.参照下表,使用报表一侧的单元格添加图例。

legitimate

[lɪ'dʒɪtɪmət], [lɪ'dʒɪtɪmət]


Image Search
adj. 合法的；世袭的；婚生的；正当的；合理的
vt. 使合法；授权；宣布 ... 为合法
conforming to the law or to rules.
able to be defended with logic or justification.
(of a child) born of parents lawfully married to each other.
(of a sovereign) having a title based on strict hereditary right.
constituting or relating to serious drama as distinct from musical comedy, revue, etc.
make legitimate; justify or make lawful.
"his claims to legitimate authority"
"a legitimate excuse for being late"
"the last legitimate Anglo-Saxon king"
"the legitimate theater"
"the regime was not legitimated by popular support"
I'm not sure that his business is strictly legitimate.我说不好他的生意是否全部合法。
He is a legitimate heir to the throne.他是王位的合法继承人。
a legitimate son.婚生子
Politicians are legitimate targets for satire.政治家理所当然是讽刺的靶子。
This is a legitimate argument.这是合乎情理的论据。
Distributed Denial of Service, which depletes the network's resource and denies service to legitimate users, is one of the hardest security problems in the Internet.分布式拒绝服务攻击，目的在于耗尽网络资源从而使合法用户的服务请求被拒绝，是最难解决的网络安全问题之一。
The second made its unlicensed nuclear programme more legitimate, removing the main objection to India's presence among great powers.而核合作则赋予了印度未经授权的核项目合法性，为印度跻身于强国之林扫除了主要障碍。
For merchants, it is important to remember that an authorization is not proof that the true card holder is making a purchase or that a legitimate card is involved.对于商家，这是重要的是要记住，一个授权是不是证明了真正的信用卡持有人正在购买或一个合法的卡是参与。

lemming

['lemɪŋ], ['lemɪŋ]


Image Search
n. 旅鼠
a small, short-tailed, thickset rodent related to the voles, found in the Arctic tundra.
a person who unthinkingly joins a mass movement, especially a headlong rush to destruction.
"the flailings of the lemmings on Wall Street"
The soldiers continued their advance, possessed by some lemming like instinct for self-destruction.士兵们持续他们的前进，像某些旅鼠自我毁灭的天性般著魔。
The stock consists of the polar bear, arctic wolf, arctic fox, lemming, musk ox, and reindeer.动物群里主要有北极熊，北极狼，北极狐，旅鼠，麝牛和驯鹿。

lemon

['lemən], ['lemən]


Image Search
n. 柠檬；柠檬色；<俚>次品；令人讨厌的人
a yellow, oval citrus fruit with thick skin and fragrant, acidic juice.
a drink made from or flavored with lemon juice.
the evergreen citrus tree that produces the lemon, widely cultivated in warm climates.
a pale yellow color.
a person or thing, especially an automobile, regarded as unsatisfactory, disappointing, or feeble.
"a port and lemon"
"lemon yellow"
I like orange more than lemon.我喜欢桔子更甚于喜欢柠檬。
The fish was garnished with slices of lemon.那盆鱼上配了几片柠檬作为装饰。
The Clumber is primarily a white dog with lemon color or orange color markings.克伦伯猎鹬犬主要颜色是白色，带有柠檬色或橘色斑纹。
He just stood there looking like a real lemon.他只是站在那里，看上去像个地地道道的笨蛋。

lemon grass


Image Search
a fragrant tropical grass that yields an oil that smells lemon. It is widely used in Asian cooking and in perfumery and medicine.
Boil the thin coconut milk with lemon grass, kaffir leaves, shallot and galanga.把椰浆煮滚，加入蓝姜，柠檬叶，香茅和小葱头。
Chilled Lemon Grass, using the lemon grass and the jelly as desserts, managed to neutralise the spiciness on the taste bud of the previous spicy dishes.香茅冻，里面有些香茅及果冻，是一道可以中和味蕾上过于刺激的辣味的甜品。

lenient

['liːniənt], ['liːniənt]


Image Search
adj. 宽大的；仁慈的
(of punishment or a person in authority) permissive, merciful, or tolerant.
emollient.
"judges were far too lenient with petty criminals"
Most of the others appealed against their life prison sentences with death, hoping for more lenient ones.其他大部分罪犯都进行了上诉，反对法院对他们终生监禁的判决，并希望受到更宽大的处理。

lest

[lest], [lest]


Image Search
conj. 惟恐；以免；担心
with the intention of preventing (something undesirable); to avoid the risk of.
(after a clause indicating fear) because of the possibility of something undesirable happening; in case.
"he spent whole days in his room, headphones on lest he disturb anyone"
"she sat up late worrying lest he be held up on the way home"
They spoke in whispers lest they should be heard.他们低声说话，唯恐被别人听见。
He took a flashlight lest it should get dark before he returned.为了预防回来以前天就黑了，所以他带着手电筒。
I got up early lest I should miss the train.我早起以免错过了火车。
We talked in a low voice lest we should wake the baby up.我们小声说话以免吵醒婴儿。
I was afraid lest the new car should be stolen.我担心新汽车会被偷走。

lettuce

['letɪs], ['letɪs]


Image Search
n. 莴苣；生菜；<俚>纸币
a cultivated plant of the daisy family, with edible leaves that are a usual ingredient of salads. Many varieties of lettuce have been developed with a range of form, texture, and color.
used in names of other plants with edible green leaves, e.g., lamb's lettuce, sea lettuce.
paper money; greenbacks.
She never grew lettuce in her garden.她从不在她的花园里培育莴苣。
I like the delicious salad of crisp lettuce and tomatoes.我喜欢这种脆莴苣和番茄做的沙拉,很好吃。
We need a head of lettuce, a bunch of carrots, and a bag of onions.我们要一棵生菜，一把胡萝卜和一袋洋葱。

liable

['laɪəbl], ['laɪəbl]


Image Search
adj. 有义务的；应负责的；有 ... 倾向；可能的；易遭受…的，易患…（病）的
responsible by law; legally answerable.
likely to do or to be something.
likely to experience (something undesirable).
"the supplier of goods or services can become liable for breach of contract in a variety of ways"
"patients were liable to faint if they stood up too suddenly"
"areas liable to flooding"
He declared that he was not liable for his wife's debts.他宣称对妻子的债务不负责。
Parents are liable forchildren's education.父母应负责孩子的教育。
They are liable to run off with your money.他们有卷款而走的倾向。
We are liable to make mistakes.我们都易犯错误。
A feeble attempt is liable to fail.愚蠢的尝试多半是要失败的。
Failure to pay your taxes will make you liable to prosecution.不缴纳税款就可能被起诉。

libel

['laɪbl], ['laɪbl]


Image Search
n. 诽谤的文字；诽谤(罪)；侮辱
v. 诽谤；中伤；损害名誉
a published false statement that is damaging to a person's reputation; a written defamation.
the action or crime of publishing a false statement about a person.
a false and malicious statement about a person.
a thing or circumstance that brings undeserved discredit on a person by misrepresentation.
(in admiralty and ecclesiastical law) a plaintiff's written declaration.
defame (someone) by publishing a libel.
make a false and malicious statement about.
(in admiralty and ecclesiastical law) bring a suit against (someone).
"a councilor who sued two national newspapers for libel"
"she alleged the magazine had libeled her"
She sued a newspaper for libel.她控告某报刊登诽谤性文字。
I'll sue you for libel.我要以诽谤罪控告你。
His attempt to discredit his opponent boomeranged (on him) when he was charged with libel.他企图败坏对手名声反而自食其果，被控以诽谤罪。
That interview was an absolute libel on the honest man.那篇报道完全是对那个老实人的侮辱。
He libel(l)ed against her character in an article.他在一篇文章中诽谤她的人格。
The rival parties libel(l)ed each other during the election.在大选中竞选两党互相说对方的坏话。

liberate

['lɪbəreɪt], ['lɪbəreɪt]


Image Search
v. 解放；使获得自由；释出；放出
set (someone) free from a situation, especially imprisonment or slavery, in which their liberty is severely restricted.
free (a country, city, or people) from enemy occupation.
release (someone) from a state or situation that limits freedom of thought or behavior.
free (someone) from rigid social conventions, especially those concerned with accepted sexual roles.
steal (something).
release (gas, energy, etc.) as a result of chemical reaction or physical decomposition.
"the serfs had been liberated"
"twelve months earlier Paris had been liberated"
"the use of computers can liberate students from the constraints of disabilities"
"ways of working politically that liberate women"
"the drummer's wearing a beret he's liberated from Lord knows where"
"energy liberated by the annihilation of matter"
The country was liberated in 1966.这个国家是在1966年解放的。
Our army had liberated many occupied areas.我们的军队解放了许多地区。
This small software can liberate your fingers!这个小软件可以解放你的手指啦！
They can liberate us from the limitations of our thoughts and feelings.他们可以使我们从思想与感受解放。
This will liberate him from economic worry.这将解除他经济上的忧虑。
There are some methylmercuric compounds which do not liberate methylmercury for extraction by the action of strong halide acids alone.有一些甲基汞化合物，它们在强含卤酸的单独作用下不能释出供萃取的甲基汞。
The free alkali metals react immediately with water to liberate hydrogen.游离的碱金属直接和水中作用，放出氢气。

likened

['laɪkən], ['laɪkən]


Image Search
v. 比作；比拟；使像
point out the resemblance of someone or something to.
"they likened the reigning emperor to a god"
Someone likens his voice to the croak of a bull-frog.有人把他的声音比作牛蛙的叫声。
Life can be likened to a journey with an unknown destination.生命可以被比作一次不知目的地的旅行。
We often liken the heart to a pump.我们常把心脏比拟为水泵。

limber

['lɪmbə(r)], ['lɪmbər]


Image Search
adj. 柔软的；灵活的
v. 使变柔软；做准备活动
n. 前车；污水道
(of a person or body part) lithe; supple.
(of a thing) flexible.
warm up in preparation for exercise or activity, especially sports.
the detachable front part of a gun carriage, consisting of two wheels and an axle, a pole, and a frame holding one or more ammunition boxes.
attach a limber to (a gun).
"limber graphite fishing rods"
"the acrobats were limbering up for the big show"
Gymnasts do everyday exercises to keep themselves limber.体操运动员每天都做运动保持身体柔软。
Before running, he liked to limber up.在跑步前，他喜欢先热身以使身体柔软灵活。
I always do a few easy exercises to limber up before a match.我在比赛前总要做些简单的准备活动。
The commander ordered the troops to limber up and move out.指挥官下令把炮装上牵引车开出去。
However in this case it means there is no room for a team, limber or caisson.但是这样就没有足够空间加上炮组，前车以及弹药箱了。

lime

[laɪm], [laɪm]


Image Search
n. 石灰；粘鸟胶
n. 酸橙；酸橙树
vt. 施石灰；涂上粘性物质；沾上粘鸟胶
adj. 石灰的
a white caustic alkaline substance consisting of calcium oxide, which is obtained by heating limestone and which combines with water with the production of much heat; quicklime.
a white alkaline substance consisting of calcium hydroxide, made by adding water to quicklime.
(in general use) any of a number of calcium compounds, especially calcium hydroxide, used as an additive to soil or water.
birdlime.
treat (soil or water) with lime to reduce acidity and improve fertility or oxygen levels.
give (wood) a bleached appearance by treating it with lime.
catch (a bird) with birdlime.
a rounded citrus fruit similar to a lemon but greener, smaller, and with a distinctive acid flavor.
the evergreen citrus tree that produces the lime, widely cultivated in warm climates.
a bright light green color like that of a lime.
another term for linden, especially the European linden.
"limed oak dining furniture"
"day-glo orange, pink, or lime green"
He added some water into the lime.他往石灰里加了些水。
We spread lime where the soil was sour.土壤酸性大的地方我们就撒上石灰。
This lime curry is particularly hot .这酸橙咖喱菜非常辣。
A broad avenue of lime trees led up to a grand entrance with huge oak doors.一条栽有酸橙树的宽阔林阴道通向巨大的橡木门的雄伟入口。
Lime water may be bought at any druggist's, or easily prepared at home.石灰水可从药店购得，不过在家里配制也很容易。

linger

['lɪŋɡə(r)], ['lɪŋɡər]


Image Search
vi. 徘徊；逗留；消磨；漫步
stay in a place longer than necessary, typically because of a reluctance to leave.
spend a long time over (something).
be slow to disappear or die.
"she lingered in the yard, enjoying the warm sunshine"
"she lingered over her meal"
"the tradition seems to linger on"
The beautiful melody is lingering in my mind.美妙的音乐在我心中回荡。
She linger after the concert, hoping to meet the star.音乐会后她徘徊不去，希望能遇见明星。
He made excuses to linger on the stairs.他找借口故意在楼梯口上磨磨蹭蹭。
We can't linger any more, because we have so many works unfinished.我们有这么作业还没完成,不能在拖延了。
To linger at the love gate is sweet,and it can never be brought to an end.漫步在爱的大门是甜蜜的，它永远不会有尽头。

literary

['lɪtərəri], [lɪtəreri]


Image Search
adj. 文学的
concerning the writing, study, or content of literature, especially of the kind valued for quality of form.

"the great literary works of the nineteenth century"
"it was signed by such literary figures as Maya Angelou"
He is endowed with literary talent.他有文学天分。
Dickens' A Tale of Two Cities is a literary classic.狄更斯的《双城记》是文学名著。
I don't like to read his literary criticism.我不喜欢读他的文学批评。
Her poetry is full of obscure literary allusions.他的诗里用了很多晦涩的文学典故。
Literary works are art works of language.文学作品是一种语言文学的艺术。

litigation

[ˌlɪtɪ'ɡeɪʃn], [ˌlɪtɪ'ɡeɪʃn]

We are pleased that the litigation has been resolved.我们很高兴这个诉讼得到了解决。
These two methods share certain advantages over litigation.这两种方法比诉讼有一定的优势。
He has got into litigation with the county council.他已起诉郡议会。

Image Search

=loathe；loth.

She seemed somewhat loath to depart.她似乎不愿意离开。
He is loath to get out of bed on cold morning.在寒冷的早晨他讨厌起床。

lofty

['lɒfti], ['lɔːfti]


Image Search
adj. 高的；崇高的；高尚的；傲慢的
of imposing height.
of a noble or exalted nature.

"the elegant square was shaded by lofty palms"

"lofty intellectual disdain"
There are lofty fells behind this village.这个村庄后面是高高的荒山。
Longer shadow falls from lofty mountain.山高投影长。
They saw the lofty peak in all its majesty.他们看到了高耸的山峰，气势雄伟壮丽。
He has lent his name to the lofty cause.他以自己的名义支持这一崇高的事业。
He has lofty ideals about life.他对人生抱有崇高的理想。

I don't like her lofty treatment of her visitors.我不喜欢她对来访者的高傲态度。

Image Search

of or according to the rules of logic or formal argument.
characterized by or capable of clear, sound reasoning.
(of an action, development, decision, etc.) natural or sensible given the circumstances.

"a logical impossibility"
"the information is displayed in a simple and logical fashion"
"it is a logical progression from the job before"
Every argument was stated with logical precision.每一个论点都阐述得精确严密，符合逻辑。
You must learn how to construct a logical argument.你必须学会怎样确立合乎逻辑的论点。
My argument follows the rules of logical induction.我是遵循逻辑归纳的法则进行论证的。
The article has a logical composition.这篇文章布局合理。
It seems like the most logical solution to the problem.这似乎是最合理的解决方案。

He made many ludicrous mistakes in his speech.他的演讲中有许多可笑的错误。
In normal times, this would be a ludicrous question.在正常时期，这会是个可笑的问题。
The ludicrous performance of the clown fascinated the children.小丑那滑稽的表演吸引着孩子。

lukewarm

[ˌluːk'wɔːm], [ˌluːk'wɔːrm]

"the universities were lukewarm about the proposal from the start"

Our enjoyment seemed rather lukewarm.我们的欣赏热情似乎不高。
He gave only lukewarm support to our plan.他只是半心半意地支持我们的计划。

luminous

['luːmɪnəs], ['luːmɪnəs]


Image Search
adj. 发光的；发亮的；清楚的；明白易懂的
full of or shedding light; bright or shining, especially in the dark.
(of a color) very bright; harsh to the eye.
relating to light as it is perceived by the eye, rather than in terms of its actual energy.
"the luminous dial on his watch"
"he wore luminous green socks"
These reactions are not luminous.这些反应是不发光的。
They like the luminous stones like diamonds in our reality.他们喜欢发光的石头像现实中的钻石。
With this watch you can tell time in the dark because its hands and dial are luminous.用这只表你可以在黑暗中看时间，因为它的针和针盘都是会发亮的。
We are part of eternity, a tremendously luminous experience of ecstasy that is beyond words.我们是永恒的一部分，有一个极其巨大的发亮的狂喜体验很难用语言表达。

lure

[lʊə(r)], [lʊr]


Image Search
vt. 诱惑；吸引
n. 诱惑；吸引力；饵
tempt (a person or an animal) to do something or to go somewhere, especially by offering some form of reward.
something that tempts or is used to tempt a person or animal to do something.
the strongly attractive quality of a person or thing.
a type of bait used in fishing or hunting.
a bunch of feathers with a weighted object attached to a long string, swung around the head of the falconer to recall a hawk.
"the child was lured into a car but managed to escape"
"the film industry always has been a glamorous lure for young girls"
"the lure of a better-paid job"
The travel brochure lured me into taking a Caribbean vacation.这本旅游小册子诱使我去加勒比地区度假。
The enticement of the big city lure her away from her home.大城市的种种诱惑吸引了她离家出走。
It's very difficult to lure talent away from Silicon Valley.很难将硅谷的人才吸引走。
Do not lure her away from her duty .不要引诱她离开职守。
He left home because of the lures of the life in the city.由于受到城市生活的诱惑,他离开了家。
He could not resist the lure of money.他不能抵制金钱的诱惑。
Gant succumbed to the lure of new land.甘德也抵抗不住新地方的吸引力。
Life in big cities is a lure for many country boys.大城市的生活吸引着许多乡下小伙子。
Cheese is really a good lure for mice.奶酪是很好的引诱老鼠的诱饵。
Then he tied on a small silver lure and practiced casting.他系上鱼饵,练习如何抛线。

majority

[mə'dʒɒrəti], [mə'dʒɔːrəti]


Image Search
n. 大多数；多数；多数党；多数派
the greater number.
the number by which votes for one candidate in an election are more than those for all other candidates combined.
the number by which the votes for one party or candidate exceed those of the next in rank.
a party or group receiving the greater number of votes.
the age when a person is legally considered a full adult, in most contexts either 18 or 21.
the rank or office of a major.
"in the majority of cases all will go smoothly"
The majority of people seem to prefer TV to radio.多数人喜欢电视胜过广播。
Racism is abhorrent to the majority of people.种族主义是大多数人都憎恨的。
The Democrats became the majority in the election.民主党在这次选举中变成了多数党。
The Democrats became the majority in the election.民主党在这次选举中变成了多数党。
The majority was determined to press its proposal.多数派决心强求通过其提案。

Image Search

a large extinct elephant of the Pleistocene epoch, typically hairy with a sloping back and long curved tusks.
huge.
"a mammoth corporation"
Building the new railroad will be a mammoth job.修建那条新铁路将是一项巨大工程。
The mammoth buffalo roamed the plains.庞大的野牛群出没在这些平原上。
By comparison, the Great Wall in China is a mammoth presence.相比之下，中国的长城真是个庞然大物。
The woolly mammoth was a month old when she died.这只长毛象刚满月就不幸身亡。
The mammoth fell into an ice crevasse.猛犸掉进冰河裂缝里了。

maneuver

[mə'nuːvə], [mə'nuːvər]


Image Search

a movement or series of moves requiring skill and care.

the fact or process of taking carefully planned or deceptive action.

move skillfully or carefully.

"the truck was unable to maneuver comfortably in the narrow street"
"they were maneuvering him into a betrayal of his countryman"
"two decades of political maneuvering"
The mouse had a quick wit and was able to maneuver his way out of danger.老鼠有急智可以灵巧地脱离危险。
They have had to maneuver the ship to avoid unforeseen shoals and shallows.他们必须设法避开无法预见的暗礁和浅滩。
The maneuver aims to strengthen special police forces' emergency response and combat capabilities.此次演习的目的在于提高特种警力的危机反应能力和战斗能力。
An anti-failure maneuver is very important for power system safety and stability in operation.反事故演习是保证电网安全稳定运行的重要一环。
Politicians maneuvered for position.政客为争地位而耍弄花招。
He must have considered the patrol as an effective maneuver.他思想上一定还以为派兵侦察是条妙计。

mangle

['mæŋɡl], ['mæŋɡl]


Image Search
v. 碾压；损坏；糟蹋；乱切
n. 碾压机
severely mutilate, disfigure, or damage by cutting, tearing, or crushing.
a large machine for ironing sheets or other fabrics, usually when they are damp, using heated rollers.
a machine having two or more cylinders turned by a handle, between which wet laundry is squeezed (to remove excess moisture) and pressed.
press or squeeze with a mangle.
"the car was mangled almost beyond recognition"
New shoes don't cut, blister, or mangle his feet.新鞋子不会硌脚，起泡，或让脚受伤。
The symphony was dreadfully mangled.那首交响乐曲给糟蹋得不成样子。
The plane is late; it is going to mangle your schedule for the day.航班延误了，而它将影响你一整天的行程。

manipulate

[mə'nɪpjuleɪt], [mə'nɪpjuleɪt]


Image Search
vt. 操纵；操作；控制；利用；(巧妙地)处理；篡改
handle or control (a tool, mechanism, etc.), typically in a skillful manner.
alter, edit, or move (text or data) on a computer.
examine or treat (a part of the body) by feeling or moving it with the hand.
control or influence (a person or situation) cleverly, unfairly, or unscrupulously.
alter (data) or present (statistics) so as to mislead.
"he manipulated the dials of the set"
"a system of healing based on manipulating the ligaments of the spine"
"the masses were deceived and manipulated by a tiny group"
A clever politician know how to manipulate public opinion.聪明的政客知道如何操纵公众舆论。
He is one of those who manipulate the market.他是操纵市场者之一。
Do you know how to manipulate a computer ?你知道怎样操作计算机吗?
She uses her charm to manipulate people.她利用其魅力左右他人。
She uses her charm to manipulate people.她利用其魅力左右他人。
A clever politician knows how to manipulate his public opinion.一个聪明的政治家知道如何利用他的舆论。
With special lenses and prisms we can manipulate this light.我们可以用特殊透镜和棱镜处理这种光线。
An applications program is designed to manipulate data rather than govern the operation of the computer.应用程序是为处理数据而不是控制计算机的运转而编写的程序。
The treasurer was arrested for trying to manipulate the company's accounts.这个会计因企图篡改公司账目而被捕。

martial

['mɑːʃl], ['mɑːrʃl]


Image Search
adj. 军事的；战争的；好战的
of or appropriate to war; warlike.

The city remains firmly under martial law.这个城市仍实施严格的军事管制。
The president also harked back to ancient Sinhalese martial heroes.总统又提及古代僧伽罗战争英雄。
We should always remember that Japan is a martial nation.我们应该始终牢记日本是一个好战的国家。

massacre

['mæsəkə(r)], ['mæsəkər]


Image Search
n. 大屠杀；<口>惨败
v. 大屠杀；<口>彻底击败
an indiscriminate and brutal slaughter of people.
a heavy defeat of a sports team or contestant.
deliberately and violently kill (a large number of people).
inflict a heavy defeat on (a sports team or contestant).
"the attack was described as a cold-blooded massacre"
The massacre was a crime against humanity.这场大屠杀是一桩反人类的罪行。
The press has reported the massacre of thousands of people for their religious beliefs.新闻界报道了那场因宗教信仰原因而对千万人的大屠杀。
The game was a complete massacre; we lost 10-0.那次比赛真是一次惨败，我们0比10输了。
Vichy government was the accessory of Nazi to massacre the Jews who lived in France.维希政府是德国纳粹残害住在法国的犹太人的帮凶之一。
The hunters came from the East to massacre the buffaloes of the plains, killing several million in a short time.这批猎手从东部来到这片平原上大肆捕杀野牛，很快就有几百万只野牛惨遭杀戮。
He is collecting evidence to massacre his opponents.他正在收集证据要彻底击败他的对手。

maximum

['mæksɪməm], ['mæksɪməm]


Image Search
n. 最大量；最大限度；最高点
adj. 最高的；最大极限的
as great, high, or intense as possible or permitted.
denoting the greatest or highest point or amount attained.
the greatest or highest amount possible or attained.
a maximum permitted prison sentence for an offense.
at the most.
"the vehicle's maximum speed"
"the maximum depth of the pool is 6 feet"
"the school takes a maximum of 32 students"
"an offense that carries a maximum of 14 years"
"it has a length of 4 feet maximum"
This hall holds a maximum of seventy people.这厅最多容纳七十人。
The child turned the volume up to the maximum.小孩把音量转到了最大。
It is the maximum the insurance company will pay.这是保险公司所能付给的最大金额。
Our goal is to achieve the maximum of efficiency.我们的目标是取得最高的效率。
The maximum price we can pay is 50 pence per yard.我们所能出的最高价格是每码50便士。
The maximum temperature in July may be 36 Celsius degree.七月份最高温度可能达到36摄氏度。
The maximum load for this lorry is one ton.这辆卡车最大载重量是一吨。
The dress is carefully styled for maximum comfort.这服装精心设计，力求达到最大限度的舒适。
The demonstration was carefully orchestrated to attract maximum publicity.该示威经过精心策划以尽量吸引公众注意。

maze

[meɪz], [meɪz]


Image Search
n. 迷宫；曲径；迷惑
vt. 使迷惑
a network of paths and hedges designed as a puzzle through which one has to find a way.
a complex network of paths or passages.
a confusing mass of information.
be dazed and confused.
"they were trapped in a menacing maze of corridors"
"a maze of petty regulations"
"she was still mazed with the drug she had taken"
We were lost in the maze for several hours.我们在迷宫里兜了好几个小时出不来。
I twisted through a maze of narrow corridors.我弯弯曲曲地穿行迷宫式的狭窄走廊。
The psychologist raced the rats through a long maze.经过长时间的迷惑心理学家揭穿胡言蜚语。

meager

['miːgə], ['miːgə]


Image Search
adj. 贫乏的；不足的；瘦的
(of something provided or available) lacking in quantity or quality.
(of a person or animal) lean; thin.
"they were forced to supplement their meager earnings"
It was medieval European monks who introduced scientific brewing techniques in an effort to produce a nutritious beverage to supplement their meager diets.正是中世纪欧洲的僧侣们引进科学的啤酒酿造技术，制造有营养的饮料，从而补充了他们贫乏的饮食。

meander

[mi'ændə(r)], [mi'ændər]


Image Search
v. 缓慢而弯曲地流动；漫步；闲聊
n. 河流的曲折；漫步；迂回曲折的进程
(of a river or road) follow a winding course.
(of a person) wander at random.
(of a speaker or text) proceed aimlessly or with little purpose.
a winding curve or bend of a river or road.
a circuitous journey, especially an aimless one.
an ornamental pattern of winding or interlocking lines, e.g., in a mosaic.
"a river that meandered gently through a meadow"
"kids meandered in and out"
"a stylish offbeat thriller which occasionally meanders"
"the river flows in sweeping meanders"
"a leisurely meander around the twisting coastline road"
They tumble down mountainsides; they meander through flat farmlands.它们滚滚冲下山脊，蜿蜒穿过平坦的农田。
I liked to meander through familiar streets.我喜欢闲逛穿过熟悉的街道。
They usually meander down to the pub after work.他们通常下班后漫步到那家小酒店去。
The discussion meandered (on) for hours.讨论会漫无边际地进行了几小时。
Major changes in a river course result in both lateral shifts of the old meander belt and in the development of new belts.河道中大的变动，造成老河曲带的侧向迁移和新河曲带的产生。
The Crocodile River Ramble and the Magalies Meander are two well-known tourist routes here.鳄鱼河漫游和马格雷斯漫步是此处两条著名的旅游路线。

meddle

['medl], ['medl]


Image Search
v. 干涉
interfere in or busy oneself unduly with something that is not one's concern.
touch or handle (something) without permission.
"I don't want him meddling in our affairs"
"you have no right to come in here and meddle with my things"
Don't meddle in my affairs.别干预我的事情。
Do not meddle with the tools.不要乱动工具。
He is inclined to meddle in other people's affairs.他总喜欢干涉别人的事。

memento

[mə'mentəʊ], [mə'mentoʊ]


Image Search
n. 纪念品
an object kept as a reminder or souvenir of a person or event.
"you can purchase a memento of your visit"
He kept a lock of her hair as a memento.他保留着她的一束头发作纪念。
My friend gave me his picture as a memento before going away.我的朋友在离别前给我一张照片留作纪念品。

memorandum

[ˌmemə'rændəm], [ˌmemə'rændəm]


Image Search
n. 【商】备忘录；【法】交易备忘录；契约书
a written message, especially in business or diplomacy.
a note or record made for future use.
a document recording the terms of a contract or other legal details.
"he told them of his decision in a memorandum"
"the two countries signed a memorandum of understanding on economic cooperation"
It seems quite easy to write a memorandum.看来写备忘录也很容易。
Let's give this memorandum the once-over.让我们大略地看一下备忘录。
He sent us a memorandum about the meeting.他给我们寄来了会议备忘录。
He noted down the date of the meeting in the memorandum book.他把会议日期记到备忘录里。
His response to my first memorandum was oblique.他对我的第一份备忘录的答复是闪烁其词的。
I wrote a memorandum to confirm our verbal agreement.我写了份备忘录以确认我们的口头协议。

menace

['menəs], ['menəs]


Image Search
n. 威胁；恐吓；<口>讨厌的人（物）
v. 威吓；威胁
a person or thing that is likely to cause harm; a threat or danger.
a threatening quality, tone, or atmosphere.
a person or thing that causes trouble or annoyance.
threaten, especially in a malignant or hostile manner.
"a new initiative aimed at beating the menace of drugs"
"he spoke the words with a hint of menace"
"his kid sister, that chatty little menace, had become the knockout of the neighborhood"
"Africa's elephants are still menaced by poaching"
These weapons are a menace to world peace.这些武器是对世界和平的威胁。
The man's lunatic behavior is a menace to society.那个人的疯狂行为构成对社会的威胁。
That film creates an atmosphere of menace.那部影片营造出吓人的气氛。
Your vicious dog is menacing my cat!你那条恶狗对我家的猫太凶了！
These measures menace our liberty.这些措施威胁着我们的自由。
Our country is menaced by war.我们的国家受到战争威胁。

mentor

['mentɔː(r)], ['mentɔːr]


Image Search
n. 指导者
v. 指导
an experienced and trusted adviser.
an experienced person in a company, college, or school who trains and counsels new employees or students.
advise or train (someone, especially a younger colleague).
"he was her friend and mentor until his death in 1915"
He fed on the great ideas of his mentor.他以他导师的伟大思想为支撑。
The key to mastering any new job is finding the right mentor.对新工作尽快上手的窍门，就是找对职业导师。
When they want to learn more, mentor.如果这些年轻人想了解更多，那么就教导他们吧。

merge

[mɜːdʒ], [mɜːrdʒ]


Image Search
v. 合并；融合；兼并
combine or cause to combine to form a single entity.
blend or cause to blend gradually into something else so as to become indistinguishable from it.
"the utility companies are cutting costs and merging with other companies"
"he crouched low and endeavored to merge into the darkness of the forest"
His department will merge with mine.他的部门将和我的合并。
The two marching columns moved closer and finally merged.行进中的两路纵队越走越近，终于合成一路。
The shadows slowly merge together.这些阴影慢慢地融合在一起了。
The water and the sky merge into a pure whole.水与天连成一线,不染纤尘。
All his efforts facilitated the company to merge its main rival.他的努力使得该公司成功吞并了竞争对手。

meteoric

[ˌmiːti'ɒrɪk], [ˌmiːti'ɔːrɪk]


Image Search
adj. 流星的；昙花一现的；大气的
relating to meteors or meteorites.
(of the development of something, especially a person's career) very rapid.
relating to or denoting water derived from the atmosphere by precipitation or condensation.
"meteoric iron"
"her meteoric rise to the top of her profession"
Scientists found the celestial origin of the meteoric shower.科学家发现了那场流星雨的太空源。
Many wonderful things are just meteoric.很多美好的事物只是昙花一现。
The main ore fluid was magma water mixed with meteoric water.成矿流体是以岩浆水为主,混有古大气水的混合流体。

meticulous

[mə'tɪkjələs], [mə'tɪkjələs]


Image Search
adj. 一丝不苟的；缜密的
showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
"he had always been so meticulous about his appearance"
He is noted for his meticulous scholarship.他以治学严谨著称。
She is meticulous in her presentation of facts.她介绍事实十分详细。
Their rooms had been prepared with meticulous care.他们的房间是经过精心布置的。
The arrangements were meticulous.布置得很缜密。
He's always meticulous in keeping the records up to date.他总是十分细心地补充最新的资料。

migrant

['maɪɡrənt], ['maɪɡrənt]


Image Search
n. 移居者；候鸟
adj. 移居的
a worker who moves from place to place to do seasonal work.
an animal that migrates.
tending to migrate or having migrated.
"migrant birds"
Migrants to the city send money home to their relatives.这个城市的移居者把钱寄回家给他们的亲戚。
Virus may travel through migrant, and cause epidemic situation to spread.病毒可能通过候鸟传播，致使疫情蔓延。
Migrant workers move from city to city in search of work.流动工人为了寻找工作从一个城市移居到另一个城市。
The army comprised of both the local and migrant soldiers.军队由地方和移居战士组成。

mimic

['mɪmɪk], ['mɪmɪk]


Image Search
vt. 模仿；模拟
n. 模仿者；仿制品
adj. 模仿的；假的
imitate (someone or their actions or words), typically in order to entertain or ridicule.
(of an animal or plant) resemble or imitate (another animal or plant), especially to deter predators or for camouflage.
(of a drug) replicate the physiological effects of (another substance).
(of a disease) exhibit symptoms that bear a deceptive resemblance to those of (another disease).
a person skilled in imitating the voice, mannerisms, or movements of others in an entertaining way.
an animal or plant that exhibits mimicry.
imitative of something, especially for amusement.
"she mimicked Eileen's voice"
"they were waging mimic war"
He mimicked his uncle's voice and gestures perfectly.他把叔叔的声音和姿态模仿得惟妙惟肖。
He could mimic all the teachers' accents.他能够模仿每位老师的口音。
You would like to mimic this plan on your test environment.您需要在测试环境中模拟该计划。
One of my brothers is a wonderful mimic.我的一个兄弟很善于模仿。
He is a clever mimic who can take off most of the lectures in this college.他是一个聪明的模仿家,他能模仿学校里大部分的演讲。
This parrot is an amazing mimic.这只鹦鹉很会学舌。
Is this real antique or mimic?这真的是古董，还是仿制品？
At the international level sport is frankly mimic warfare.国际级比赛简直就是一场模拟战争。

minimum

['mɪnɪməm], ['mɪnɪməm]


Image Search
adj. 最少的；最低程度的
n. 最低限度；最小量
the least or smallest amount or quantity possible, attainable, or required.
the lowest or smallest amount of a varying quantity (e.g., temperature) allowed, attained, or recorded.
a point at which a continuously varying quantity ceases to decrease and begins to increase; the value of a quantity at such a point.
smallest or lowest.
"technical difficulties have been kept to a minimum"
"clients with a minimum of $500,000 to invest"
"this can be done with the minimum amount of effort"
That is the minimum number necessary to complete the circuit.这是完善循环的最低限度人数。
The minimum wage is 4.25 dollars an hour.最低工价为每小时四点二五美元。
Repairing your car will cost a minimum of 100 dollars.修理你的汽车最低限度要100美元。
The class needs a minimum of 6 pupils to continue.这个班最低限度要六个学生才可以继续办下去。
Consolidate everything to the bare minimum.把一切巩固到最低限度的最小量。
And when I did, I tried to keep it to a minimum.吃的时候，我也要保持在最小量。

minorities

[maɪ'nɒrəti], [maɪ'nɔːrəti]


Image Search
n. 少数；少数民族；未成年
the smaller number or part, especially a number that is less than half the whole number.
the number of votes cast for or by the smaller party in a legislative assembly.
a relatively small group of people, especially one commonly discriminated against in a community, society, or nation, differing from others in race, religion, language, or political persuasion.
the state or period of being under the age of full legal responsibility.
"harsher measures for the minority of really serious offenders"
"a blocking minority of 23 votes"
"representatives of ethnic minorities"
Only a minority of British households do not have a car.英国只有少数家庭没有汽车。
A small minority voted against the motion.投票反对该提议的人占少数。
The question of which state the minority group should belong to was decided by (a) plebiscite.该少数民族应归属哪一州的问题已由公民投票表决。
There are 56 minorities in our country.我国有56个少数民族。
The nationality of the minority groups in that country is still at issue.在那个国家的少数民族的国籍问题上仍有争论。
He is in his minority.他尚未成年。

mirage

['mɪrɑːʒ], [mə'rɑːʒ]


Image Search
n. 海市蜃楼；幻想
an optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions, especially the appearance of a sheet of water in a desert or on a hot road caused by the refraction of light from the sky by heated air.
something that appears real or possible but is not in fact so.
"the notion that the public is pro-business is a mirage"
A mirage is an optical illusion.海市蜃楼是一种视错觉。
Although the morning was young, the hazy mirage was up.天色虽早，朦胧的海市蜃楼却已经出现。
Perhaps we are all just chasing a mirage.也许我们都只是在追逐一个幻想。
I stared at the canteen as if it were a mirage.我看着那水壶就好象看着一个幻想。

misapprehension

[ˌmɪsæprɪ'henʃn], [ˌmɪsæprɪ'henʃn]


Image Search
n. 误解
a mistaken belief about or interpretation of something.
"she must have been laboring under the misapprehension that you are nice"
A quarrel often rises from a misapprehension.争吵常起于误解.
I was under the misapprehension that he was dead.我误以为他死了。
The boss's misapprehension mad her want to weep with frustration.上司的误解使得她沮丧地想哭.
I thought you wanted to see me but I was clearly under a complete misapprehension.我以为你想见我，显然完全是我误解了。

misery

['mɪzəri], ['mɪzəri]


Image Search
n. 痛苦；悲惨的境遇；苦难
a state or feeling of great distress or discomfort of mind or body.
a cause or source of great distress or discomfort.
"she went upstairs and cried in misery"
"the miseries of war"
War necessarily causes misery and waste.战争必然造成痛苦和破坏。
He was doomed to undergo another misery.他注定要经历另一场痛苦。
One usually associates poverty with misery.人们一说到贫穷，常常就联想起悲惨的境遇。
He endured agonies of loneliness and misery.他忍受着寂寞和贫穷的折磨。
How can we blot out the memory of past misery?我们怎能忘记过去的苦难呢？
The child's misery would move even the most obdurate heart.这个孩子所受的苦难会打动世界上最冷酷的心。

misgiving

[ˌmɪs'ɡɪvɪŋ], [ˌmɪs'ɡɪvɪŋ]


Image Search
n. 疑虑；怀疑
动词misgive的现在分词.
a feeling of doubt or apprehension about the outcome or consequences of something.
(of a person's mind or heart) fill (that person) with doubt, apprehension, or foreboding.
"we have misgivings about the way the campaign is being run"
"my heart misgave me when I saw him"
All their misgivings were driven out by the arrival of the good news.一听到这个好消息，他们一切疑虑都烟消云散了。
I have many misgivings about taking the job.我对是否接受那项工作顾虑重重。

misnomer

[ˌmɪs'nəʊmə(r)], [ˌmɪs'noʊmər]


Image Search
n. 误称；用词不当
a wrong or inaccurate name or designation.
a wrong or inaccurate use of a name or term.
"“king crab” is a misnomer—these creatures are not crustaceans at all"
"to call this “neighborhood policing” would be a misnomer"
Indeed, the word "constant" may be a misnomer.当然，“常数”这个词或许是个误称。
Luckily, that property is a bit of a misnomer.幸运的是,这个属性名只是有点用词不当。

misrepresent

[ˌmɪsˌreprɪ'zent], [ˌmɪsˌreprɪ'zent]


Image Search
v. 误称；歪曲；不合适地代表
give a false or misleading account of the nature of.
"you are misrepresenting the views of the government"
If you misrepresent what's in the plan, we will call you out.如果有人再恶意解读健保改革计划，我们会直接批评你。
Something intended to misrepresent the true nature of an activity.意欲歪曲一个行动真实性质的东西。
Astrologers do not misrepresent their sources of information, and make every effort to verify their accuracy.占星家不歪曲他们的信息来源，并尽一切努力，以核实其准确性。

modalities

[məʊ'dæləti], [moʊ'dæləti]


Image Search
n. 样式；形式；形态
[医学]药征.
[生理学]感觉.
modal quality.
a particular mode in which something exists or is experienced or expressed.
a particular method or procedure.
a particular form of sensory perception.
(in medicine, particularly homeopathy) a symptom or pattern that aids in diagnosis.
"the harmony had a touch of modality"
"traditional modalities of representing time and space"
"the visual and auditory modalities"
"The modality of “worse with activity” is associated with Rhus Tox"
Essence is more important than modality.实质重于形式。
As a visual modality of art, Xiao Zhuan possesses Symmetrical and balanceable beauty.作为一种视觉艺术形式，小篆具有一种对称的平衡美。
And that is the ineluctable modality of the audible.这就是可听事物无可避免的形态。

model

['mɒdl], ['mɑːdl]


Image Search
n. 模范；模特儿；模型
adj. 模范的；作模型用的
v. 做模型；模仿；塑造
a three-dimensional representation of a person or thing or of a proposed structure, typically on a smaller scale than the original.
(in sculpture) a figure or object made in clay or wax, to be reproduced in another more durable material.
a system or thing used as an example to follow or imitate.
a simplified description, especially a mathematical one, of a system or process, to assist calculations and predictions.
a person or thing regarded as an excellent example of a specified quality.
an actual person or place on which a specified fictional character or location is based.
a person, typically a woman, employed to display clothes by wearing them.
a person employed to pose for an artist, photographer, or sculptor.
a particular design or version of a product.
fashion or shape (a three-dimensional figure or object) in a malleable material such as clay or wax.
(in drawing or painting) represent so as to appear three-dimensional.
use (especially a system or procedure) as an example to follow or imitate.
take (someone admired or respected) as an example to copy.
devise a representation, especially a mathematical one, of (a phenomenon or system).
display (clothes) by wearing them.
work as a model by displaying clothes or posing for an artist, photographer, or sculptor.
"a model of St. Paul's Cathedral"
"the law became a model for dozens of laws banning nondegradable plastic products"
"a statistical model used for predicting the survival rates of endangered species"
"as she grew older, she became a model of self-control"
"the author denied that Marilyn was the model for his tragic heroine"
"a fashion model"
"trading your car in for a newer model"
"use the icing to model a house"
"the body of the woman to the right is modeled in softer, riper forms"
"the research method will be modeled on previous work"
"he models himself on rock legend Elvis Presley"
"a computer program that can model how smoke behaves"
His mother is a model of industry.他母亲是勤劳的模范。
Lily is a fashion model.莉莉是个时装模特儿。
The model has an individual way of dressing.这个模特儿有著独特的穿衣方式。
He showed us a model of the new office building.他给我们看了新办公楼的模型。
The delicate model was set in plastic to protect it.这个精致的模型被嵌在塑料里加以保护。
They are a model couple.他们是一对模范夫妻。
It took him a whole day to finish making a model plane.他用了一整天的时间做完了一架飞机模型。
She models in clay.她用粘土做模型。
She modeled herself on her mother.她模仿母亲的一举一动。
He modelled the statue on a Greek pattern.他塑造了一尊希腊式的雕像。

modify

['mɒdɪfaɪ], ['mɑːdɪfaɪ]


Image Search
v. 修改；更改；缓和；修饰
make partial or minor changes to (something), typically so as to improve it or to make it less extreme.
transform (a structure) from its original anatomical form during development or evolution.
(especially of an adjective) restrict or add to the sense of (a noun).
pronounce (a speech sound) in a way that is different from the norm for that sound.
"she may be prepared to modify her views"
"the target noun is modified by a “direction” word"
We have to modify our plan a little bit.我们得对我们的计划稍加修改。
The policy was agreed by the committee, but only in a modified form.那项政策经修改后才获得委员会同意。
The union has been forced to slightly modify its position.工会被迫稍稍改变立场。
He'll have to modify his views if he wants to be elected.他要想当选就得把观点改得缓和些。
Adverbs modify verbs and adjectives.副词修饰动词和形容词。

molten

['məʊltən], ['moʊltən]


Image Search
adj. 熔化的；炽热的；铸造的
melt的过去分词.
(especially of materials with a high melting point, such as metal and glass) liquefied by heat.
The molten metal was run into a mould.熔化的金属被倒进模内。
The rising sun danced in water like molten gold.初升的太阳犹如熔化的金子在水中荡漾。
Deep inside the Earth are very hot molten rocks called lava.地球内部深处是十分炽热的岩浆的岩石熔化物。
As the plates separate, hot molten mantle material flows up to fill the void.随着板块的分开，炽热的熔融地幔物质向上流动，以填充空隙。
Finns have been known to do the same with molten tin and buckets.据说芬兰人也一样，只不过是用铸造的锡块和水桶来玩。

monotonous

[mə'nɒtənəs], [mə'nɑːtənəs]


Image Search
adj. 单调的
dull, tedious, and repetitious; lacking in variety and interest.
(of a sound or utterance) lacking in variation in tone or pitch.
"the statistics that he quotes with monotonous regularity"
"soon we heard a low, monotonous wailing of many voices"
The preacher's monotonous voice put me to sleep.传教士单调的声音催我入眠。
His monotonous whistling grated on her nerves.他单调的口哨声令她的神经受不了。

moral

['mɒrəl], ['mɔːrəl]


Image Search
adj. 道德的；精神上的
n. 寓意；道德；品行；伦理
concerned with the principles of right and wrong behavior and the goodness or badness of human character.
concerned with or derived from the code of interpersonal behavior that is considered right or acceptable in a particular society.
examining the nature of ethics and the foundations of good and bad character and conduct.
holding or manifesting high principles for proper conduct.
a lesson, especially one concerning what is right or prudent, that can be derived from a story, a piece of information, or an experience.
a person's standards of behavior or beliefs concerning what is and is not acceptable for them to do.
"the moral dimensions of medical intervention"
"an individual's ambitions may get out of step with the general moral code"
"moral philosophers"
"he prides himself on being a highly moral and ethical person"
"the moral of this story was that one must see the beauty in what one has"
"the corruption of public morals"
She regards his moral faults with charity.她宽恕他的品行不端。
We differ about moral standards.我们对道德标准看法不一致。
His behavior transgressed the moral rules of the social conduct.他的行为违背了社会行为的道德准则。
It comprises two main sets of rights: the economic rights and the moral rights.版权包括两种主要的权利:经济权利和精神权利。
The moral of this story is ‘Better late than never'.这个故事的寓意是｀迟做总比不做好＇.
People can draw a moral from tales.人们可以从寓言里吸取经验教训。
You may draw your own moral from it.你可以从中得出自己的教训。
As a Puritan, he is strict in moral and religion.作为清教徒，他的道德和宗教观念都很严格。
Taking drygs is also a moral and ethical problem.用药问题也涉及到伦理道德问题。
She threw aside all her moral teachings and inhibitions.她把她所讲的伦理道德全抛到了一边。

morals

['mɒrəl], ['mɒrəl]


Image Search
n. 道德
名词moral的复数形式.
a lesson, especially one concerning what is right or prudent, that can be derived from a story, a piece of information, or an experience.
a person's standards of behavior or beliefs concerning what is and is not acceptable for them to do.
"the moral of this story was that one must see the beauty in what one has"
"the corruption of public morals"
Some people have no business morals.有些人毫无商业道德。
His ideas on morals are really prehistoric.他的道德观念真是太陈腐了。

morose

[mə'rəʊs], [mə'roʊs]


Image Search
adj. 郁闷的；抑郁的；难相处的
sullen and ill-tempered.
He lost his morose depressed attitude and began to open his heart to others.他那消沉的情绪为之一扫而光，开始与人热情交往。
The next time you're feeling cranky or morose, check in with your body.下一次你感觉心情烦躁或者郁闷、审视一下你的身体。
He became insular, emotionally dead, passionless and morose.他变得孤僻,心灰意冷,郁郁寡欢。
He became at times listless and morose.有时候他就愈加无精打彩，脾气乖张。
One easy, although unkind, way of dealing with two morose teenagers is to play one off against the other.有一个简单然而有点冷酷的方法来对付这两个难处的青年——记他们互相争斗你从中得利。

mortal

['mɔːtl], ['mɔːrtl]


Image Search
adj. 致命的；终有一死的；不共戴天的；极度的
n. 凡人
(of a living human being, often in contrast to a divine being) subject to death.
relating to humanity as subject to death.
conceivable or imaginable.
causing or liable to cause death; fatal.
(of a battle) fought to the death.
(of an enemy or a state of hostility) admitting or allowing no reconciliation until death.
denoting a grave sin that is regarded as depriving the soul of divine grace.
(of a feeling, especially fear) very intense.
very great.
long and tedious.
a human being subject to death, often contrasted with a divine being.
a person contrasted with others regarded as being of higher status or ability.
"all men are mortal"
"the coffin held the mortal remains of her uncle"
"punishment out of all mortal proportion to the offense"
"a mortal disease"
"from the outbuildings came the screams of men in mortal combat"
"parents live in mortal fear of children's diseases"
"he was in a mortal hurry"
"for three mortal days it rained"
"an ambassador had to live in a style that was not expected of lesser mortals"
His injuries proved mortal.他的伤成了致命伤。
He received a mortal wound soon after the battle began.战争开始后不久, 他就受到了致命的重伤。
Man is mortal.人都是会死的。
The antagonisms between the two empires and systems were mortal.这两个帝国和两种制度之间，有着不共戴天的仇恨。
She lives in mortal terror of her husband's anger.她极度害怕她丈夫发脾气。
No mortal could vie with Zeus.任何凡人都没法与宙斯匹敌。

motivate

['məʊtɪveɪt], ['moʊtɪveɪt]


Image Search
vt. 激发(兴趣或欲望)；给与动机
provide (someone) with a motive for doing something.
stimulate (someone's) interest in or enthusiasm for doing something.
"he was primarily motivated by the desire for profit"
"I'm going to motivate kids to study civics"
He is just sitting there doing nothing. He needs to be motivated.他坐在那儿什么也不干,他需要一点动力去激发他。
The crime appears to have been motivated by hatred.犯罪似乎都来自于仇恨。
A good teacher is one who can motivate his students.好老师是能激励学生的老师。

muddled

['mʌdld], ['mʌdld]


Image Search

动词muddle的过去式和过去分词形式.
in a state of bewildered or bewildering confusion or disorder.
bring into a disordered or confusing state.
confuse (a person or their thoughts).
busy oneself in a confused and ineffective way.
mix (a drink) or stir (an ingredient) into a drink.
"misplaced suggestions and muddled thinking"
"they were muddling up the cards"
"I do not wish to muddle him by making him read more books"
"he was muddling about in the kitchen"
This statement contains many muddled ideas.这段话里有很多糊涂思想。
His muddled brain suddenly clarified.他糊涂的头脑突然清醒过来。
You're clearly rather muddled about office procedures but I'll soon straighten you out.你显然不大明白办事的手续，我很快就给你解释清楚。

mundane

[mʌn'deɪn], [mʌn'deɪn]


Image Search
adj. 平凡的；世俗的；世界的
lacking interest or excitement; dull.
of this earthly world rather than a heavenly or spiritual one.
relating to or denoting the branch of astrology that deals with political, social, economic, and geophysical events and processes.
"seeking a way out of his mundane, humdrum existence"
"the boundaries of the mundane world"
I lead a pretty mundane life; nothing interesting ever happens to me.我生活平凡
Even the most mundane things can become objects of beauty in French eyes.即使是最平凡的事物，在法国人的眼中也是美丽的。
The book is full of complicated and sometimes mundane details.书中充满了复杂,有时甚至是世俗的细节。
Each one is contained in a spherical shell surrounded by layers of elemental matter that mark the boundary between mundane space and the unlimited spiritual world.每个宇宙被物质元素构成的壳所包裹着，这些层层的壳就是物质世界与无限的灵性世界的分界。

muster

['mʌstə(r)], ['mʌstər]


Image Search

(of troops) come together for inspection or preparation.
(of a group of people) gather together.
collect or assemble (a number or amount).
summon up (a particular feeling, attitude, or response).
a formal gathering of troops, especially for inspection, display, or exercise.
short for muster roll.
a group of peacocks.
"the cavalrymen mustered beside the other regiments"
"reporters mustered outside her house"
"he could fail to muster a majority"
"he replied with as much dignity as he could muster"
"the sound was like the cry of a muster of peacocks"
Go and muster all the men you can find.去集合所有你能找到的人。
The troops mustered on the hill.部队在小山上集合。
You'd better muster your courage and never give up.你最好鼓起勇气,永不放弃。
He mustered all his courage to take part in the game.他鼓起全部的勇气参加比赛。
There was a muster of all the guards.全体卫兵进行了一次集合。

mutiny

Image Search

"a mutiny by those manning the weapons could trigger a global war"
There is a talk of mutiny among the sailors.水手中有种哗变的传说。
He led a military mutiny against the senior generals.他发动了一场反对高级将领的兵变。
Mutiny was effectually laid to rest for the moment.叛乱总算暂时平定了下来。
Discontent stirred the men to mutiny.不满情绪酿成了兵变。
The captain was accused of inciting other officers to mutiny.该上尉被控煽动军官叛变。
